original: @15b * // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @15b * // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:üîΩSatyadvayavibhangapanjika

original: sa tya dva ya bi bham ga panydzi ka / bod skad du /
analyzed: sa tya dva ya bi bham ga panydzi ka / bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: bden pa gnyis rnam par 'byed pa'i dka' 'grel /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis rnam par 'byed pa'i dka' 'grel /
translated: The Commentary on the Difficult Points of the Differentiation of the Two Truths

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: Fascicle One

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the youthful Manjushri.üîΩIn order to greatly expand the wisdom

original: blo chung rnams kyi shes rab dag / rab tu rgyas par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: blo chung rnams kyi shes rab dag / rab tu rgyas par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: of those with little intelligence,üîΩI will compose this concise commentary

original: bden gnyis rnam par dbye ba yis ;üîΩ/ dka' 'grel 'di ni mdor bsdu bya //
analyzed: bden gnyis rnam par dbye ba yis ; / dka' 'grel 'di ni mdor bsdu bya //
translated: on the Differentiation of the Two Truths.

original: de la bstan bcos brtsam pa la //
analyzed: de la bstan bcos brtsam pa la //
translated: Regarding the composition of the treatise,

original: gang dag dngos po ngo bo nyid med yang dag mkhyen gyur kyang //
analyzed: gang dag dngos po ngo bo nyid med yang dag mkhyen gyur kyang //
translated: those who know the naturelessness of entities,üîΩthe lords of sages and their sons,

original: thugs rjes 'khor ba ji srid bar du thub dbang sras bcas rnams //
analyzed: thugs rjes 'khor ba ji srid bar du thub dbang sras bcas rnams //
translated: through compassion remain for as long as cyclic existence endures,

original: 'jig rten ma lus pa yi 'tshal ba'i dngos po bsgrub slad du //
analyzed: 'jig rten ma lus pa yi 'tshal ba'i dngos po bsgrub slad du //
translated: in order to accomplish the desired goals of all worldly beings.

original: 'dir bzhugs dri med blo ldan de dag rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'dir bzhugs dri med blo ldan de dag rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Here I pay homage to those stainless ones.

original: zhes bya ba sdug pa'i lha la phyag bya ba brjod pa ni bkra shis par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba sdug pa'i lha la phyag bya ba brjod pa ni bkra shis par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This expression of homage to the beloved deities is for the sake of auspiciousness.

original: gcig tu na ya rabs kyi tshul dang mthun par 'jug pa yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu na ya rabs kyi tshul dang mthun par 'jug pa yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: In one way, it is taught that it is in accordance with the way of the noble ones.

original: gcig tu na bstan bcos brtsam pa la ston pa la mchod pa bya ba ni bstan bcos de la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: gcig tu na bstan bcos brtsam pa la ston pa la mchod pa bya ba ni bstan bcos de la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir ram /
translated: In one way, the worship of the Teacher at the beginning of the treatise is in order to generate respect for that treatise,

original: de'i don bzang ba las na ston pa grub par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i don bzang ba las na ston pa grub par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: or it is in order to establish the Teacher, since its meaning is good.

original: de la grub pa dang ma grub pa'i rigs gnyis yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la grub pa dang ma grub pa'i rigs gnyis yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there are two types of establishment and non-establishment.

original: phyag bya ba 'di ni bstan bcos kyi don ji lta bu yin pa de dang mthun pa kho nar byas pa yin te /
analyzed: phyag bya ba 'di ni bstan bcos kyi don ji lta bu yin pa de dang mthun pa kho nar byas pa yin te /
translated: This homage is made in accordance with just what the meaning of the treatise is,

original: bdag gis 'dir don 'di lta bu rab tu bsgrub bo zhes bstan pa'i phyir te ;
analyzed: bdag gis 'dir don 'di lta bu rab tu bsgrub bo zhes bstan pa'i phyir te ;
translated: because it teaches, Here I will fully establish this meaning.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dir don gsum bstan te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dir don gsum bstan te /
translated: In this verse, three meanings are taught.üîΩThe correct understanding of the suchness of thingsüîΩis taught by the line, Those who know the naturelessness of things as it is.

original: dngos po'i de kho na ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud pa ni /üîΩgang dag dngos po ngo bo nyid med yang dag mkhyen gyur kyang //
analyzed: dngos po'i de kho na ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud pa ni / gang dag dngos po ngo bo nyid med yang dag mkhyen gyur kyang //
translated: The correct understanding of the suchness of things as it is

original: zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
translated: is taught by the line, Those who know the naturelessness of things as it is.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid las 'das pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid las 'das pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
translated: The reality of neither existence nor nonexistence is the reality of non-realities.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyi ga ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyi ga ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-reality of both existence and nonexistence.

original: dngos po zhes bya ba'i sgra ni ngo bo nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba'i sgra ni ngo bo nyid la bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúexistence‚Äù is used here for reality.

original: bzhugs pa ni chen po rnam pa lngas bstan te /
analyzed: bzhugs pa ni chen po rnam pa lngas bstan te /
translated: The great abiding is shown by five greatnesses.

original: rgyu chen po ni thugs rje'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu chen po ni thugs rje'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The great cause is the cause of compassion.

original: thugs rje ni sems can la sogs pa la dmigs pas rnam pa gsum mo //üîΩdus chen po ni 'khor ba ji srid bar @16a * //
analyzed: thugs rje ni sems can la sogs pa la dmigs pas rnam pa gsum mo // dus chen po ni 'khor ba ji srid bar @16a * //
translated: Compassion has three aspects, because it has sentient beings, etc. as its objects.

original: du bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great time is the time of abiding as long as cyclic life endures.

original: mdzad pa chen po ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mdzad pa po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdzad pa chen po ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mdzad pa po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great deed is the deed of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid thub pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid thub pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: The great power is the power of the three secrets of body, speech, and mind.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni thub pa rnams so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni thub pa rnams so //
translated: The Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas are the sages.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni lus dang ngag dang yid thub pa thun mong ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir de dag gi dbang po yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni lus dang ngag dang yid thub pa thun mong ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir de dag gi dbang po yin te /
translated: The Bhagavat is the lord of those because he possesses the uncommon power of body, speech, and mind.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i mdo las /
translated: That is taught in the Tathagata‚Äôs Secret Sutra,

original: sku'i gsang ba la sogs pa smos bas bstan te /
analyzed: sku'i gsang ba la sogs pa smos bas bstan te /
translated: which mentions the secret of body and so forth.

original: sras bcas zhes smos pa ni /
analyzed: sras bcas zhes smos pa ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äútogether with his sons‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi 'khor rtag tu mang zhing rnam par dag pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi 'khor rtag tu mang zhing rnam par dag pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: teaches that the Bhagavat‚Äôs retinue is always numerous and pure.

original: dgos pa chen po de yang 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: dgos pa chen po de yang 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: That great purpose is taught by the phrase ‚Äúthe desire of all worlds‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'jig rten ma lus pa'i 'tshal ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten ma lus pa'i 'tshal ba ni /
translated: The desire of all worlds

original: 'di ma lus pa yang yin /
analyzed: 'di ma lus pa yang yin /
translated: is also this.

original: 'jig rten gyi 'tshal ba'i dngos po 'grub pa yang yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi 'tshal ba'i dngos po 'grub pa yang yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe desire of all worlds‚Äù should be connected with the phrase ‚Äúthe accomplishment of the thing desired.‚Äù

original: skyon rnams kyis ma gos pa chen po ni /
analyzed: skyon rnams kyis ma gos pa chen po ni /
translated: The great purity from faults

original: dri med blo ldan zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: dri med blo ldan zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: is taught by the phrase ‚Äúthe stainless ones.‚Äù

original: blo dri ma med pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: blo dri ma med pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The stainless mind is free from the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa de gnyis gtan du spangs pa dang / bag chags dang bcas par spangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad kyi sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa de gnyis gtan du spangs pa dang / bag chags dang bcas par spangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad kyi sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the complete abandonment of both the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, because of the abandonment together with their imprints, and because of the abandonment of the obstructions to all meditative concentrations and meditative attainments.

original: gcig tu na 'khor ba na gnas pa rnams kyi 'khor ba'i skyon 'jig rten gyi chos la sogs pas mi gos pa'i phyir blo dri ma med pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu na 'khor ba na gnas pa rnams kyi 'khor ba'i skyon 'jig rten gyi chos la sogs pas mi gos pa'i phyir blo dri ma med pa yin no //
translated: In one way, the stainless mind is because of not being soiled by the faults of cyclic existence, such as the worldly dharmas, of those who abide in cyclic existence.

original: kyang zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i rgyan ston pa yin te /
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i rgyan ston pa yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates the teaching of an incompatible ornament.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa la brten nas ni dngos po'i de kho na ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud la /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa la brten nas ni dngos po'i de kho na ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud la /
translated: In dependence on the ultimate truth, the suchness of things is just as it is realized in the mind.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas ni bzhugs pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas ni bzhugs pa yang bstan to //
translated: In dependence on the conventional truth, abiding is also taught.

original: gang gi phyir rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i sku de bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs las nges par byung ba yin yang byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bor snang ba ji lta ba
analyzed: gang gi phyir rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i sku de bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs las nges par byung ba yin yang byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bor snang ba ji lta ba
translated: Because, although that body of perfect enjoyment definitely arises from the stores of merit and wisdom, it appears in the nature of blue, etc., in accordance with the aspirations of the great bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin du rnam par 'jog ste de'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par 'jog ste de'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: It is posited in just that way, and therefore there is no contradiction.

original: phyag bya ba de ni mdor na las gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyag bya ba de ni mdor na las gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That homage is, in brief, the meaning of the nature of the three activities.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir brtsam par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir brtsam par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: This chapter should not be undertaken because it is pointless.

original: bya rog gis so brtag pa dang 'dra'o snyam du dogs pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya rog gis so brtag pa dang 'dra'o snyam du dogs pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: It is like the crow's examination of its beak.

original: bden pa gnyis ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par @16b bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par @16b bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to understand the two realities as they are,

original: ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba'i tshig ni /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba'i tshig ni /
translated: the phrase as they are

original: gzhan dag gis kyang bden pa gnyis rnam par dbye ba bstan mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis kyang bden pa gnyis rnam par dbye ba bstan mod kyi /
translated: Others have also taught the analysis of the two realities,

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but that is not correct.

original: 'brel ba ni dgos pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir logs shig tu ma smos te /
analyzed: 'brel ba ni dgos pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir logs shig tu ma smos te /
translated: Since the relation is included in the purpose, it is not mentioned separately.

original: 'di ltar bstan bcos thams cad dam /
analyzed: 'di ltar bstan bcos thams cad dam /
translated: For, all treatises

original: las la ni dgos pa nyid kyi 'brel pa brjod par bya'i /
analyzed: las la ni dgos pa nyid kyi 'brel pa brjod par bya'i /
translated: the relation of purpose is to be stated for the action,

original: byed pa'i mjug thogs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa gzhan ni brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: byed pa'i mjug thogs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa gzhan ni brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: but another relation, such as that of immediate succession of the agent, is not to be stated,

original: bstan bcos la bya ba'i yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos la bya ba'i yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is not a part of the treatise.

original: dper na gso ba'i bstan bcos ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na gso ba'i bstan bcos ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as in the case of a medical treatise,

original: dgos pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: dgos pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de brtsam par bya ste /
translated: one should undertake that which has a purpose.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di yang dgos pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di yang dgos pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: And this chapter has a purpose.

original: dper na gso ba'i bstan bcos la ji lta ba de bzhin du 'brel pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams kyis gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: dper na gso ba'i bstan bcos la ji lta ba de bzhin du 'brel pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams kyis gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Just as a medical treatise should be studied by those who intend to practice medicine, so this treatise should be studied by those who intend to practice the path.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di yang 'brel pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di yang 'brel pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: This chapter is related to the others,

original: rtog pa sngon du gtong pa'i skye bo bden pa gnyis khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rtog pa sngon du gtong pa'i skye bo bden pa gnyis khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: because it is intended for those who intend to understand the two truths.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i rab tu byed pa nang du yongs su rdzogs pa'i ngo bor bzhag nas brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i rab tu byed pa nang du yongs su rdzogs pa'i ngo bor bzhag nas brjod pa yin te /
translated: This means that the chapter which is about to be presented is considered to be complete in its essential nature.

original: mngon sum nye ba'i tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum nye ba'i tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the word ‚Äúthis‚Äù is a term of proximity.

original: brtsams te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: brtsams te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúcommence‚Äù

original: da ltar dang nye ba la da ltar zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar dang nye ba la da ltar zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means that the present is near to the present.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na brtsams la yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin pa ni da ltar gyi dus so //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na brtsams la yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin pa ni da ltar gyi dus so //
translated: In another way, the present time is that in which something has been commenced but not completed.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bden pa gnyis ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par phye la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bden pa gnyis ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par phye la /
translated: The Lord has distinguished the two truths just as they are.

original: slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis kyang gsal bar mdzad zin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis kyang gsal bar mdzad zin pa ma yin nam /
translated: And hasn‚Äôt Master Nagarjuna already elucidated them?

original: ci'i phyir bden pa gnyis rnam par dbye ba ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di brtsams she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bden pa gnyis rnam par dbye ba ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di brtsams she na /
translated: Why then did he compose this chapter in order to understand the distinction between the two truths just as it is?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: bden pa gnyis po rnam phye yang //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis po rnam phye yang //
translated: even though the two truths have been distinguished,

original: shing rta che dag rmongs nyid na //
analyzed: shing rta che dag rmongs nyid na //
translated: the great charioteers are confused.

original: gzhan rnams smos kyang ci dgos te //üîΩde bas bdag gis rnam par dbye //
analyzed: gzhan rnams smos kyang ci dgos te // de bas bdag gis rnam par dbye //
translated: What need is there to mention others?

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore I will distinguish them.

original: gzhan gyi don ni mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don ni mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The benefit of others is characterized by high status and certain goodness.

original: de 'byung ba de la mkhas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de 'byung ba de la mkhas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The arising of that is called ‚Äúexpertise.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bdud bzhi bcom pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bdud bzhi bcom pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The Lord is so called because he has conquered the four demons.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are endowed with the qualities of ƒ™≈õvara, etc.

original: skye bo blo chung ngu ni blo mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: skye bo blo chung ngu ni blo mi gsal ba'o //
translated: Those of little intelligence are those whose minds are unclear.

original: rang gi sde ba ni slob dpon chos skyong la sogs @17a * //
analyzed: rang gi sde ba ni slob dpon chos skyong la sogs @17a * //
translated: Our own schools are the masters Dharmottara, etc.

original: pa'o // de dag gi kha na las pas 'jug pa gang dag slob dpon chos skyong la sogs pa'i lta ba'i rjes su 'brang bas zhugs pa de dag ni shin tu rmongs pa kho na yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pa'o // de dag gi kha na las pas 'jug pa gang dag slob dpon chos skyong la sogs pa'i lta ba'i rjes su 'brang bas zhugs pa de dag ni shin tu rmongs pa kho na yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Those who enter into the sphere of activity of those who are affected by the fault of the masters Dharmottara, etc., who follow the views, enter into a state of utter delusion,

original: gzhan rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gzhan rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: to say nothing of others.

original: bden pa gnyis rnam par phye ba de nyid kyis don ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis rnam par phye ba de nyid kyis don ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the point of the distinction between the two realities?üîΩThose who know the distinction between the two realities

original: bden gnyis rnam dbye shes pa dag / thub pa'i bka' la mi rmongs te //
analyzed: bden gnyis rnam dbye shes pa dag / thub pa'i bka' la mi rmongs te //
translated: are not confused about the word of the Sage.

original: de dag ma lus tshogs bsags nas //
analyzed: de dag ma lus tshogs bsags nas //
translated: Having accumulated the entire collection,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: 'dis ni bden pa gnyis rnam par dbye ba shes pa ni dgos pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dis ni bden pa gnyis rnam par dbye ba shes pa ni dgos pa yin la /
translated: Here, the knowledge of the distinction between the two realities is the point.

original: dgos pa de yang bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' dag la mi rmongs shing ma rmongs na /
analyzed: dgos pa de yang bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' dag la mi rmongs shing ma rmongs na /
translated: The purpose of that is to show that if one is not confused about the Bhagavat's word, then one will not be confused.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ma lus pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ma lus pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur la /
translated: And if one is not confused, then one will complete the entire accumulation of merit and knowledge.

original: rdzogs pa de yang bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa rab kyi mthar phyin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rdzogs pa de yang bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa rab kyi mthar phyin par 'gyur te /
translated: And that completion will be the perfection of the highest good for oneself and for others.

original: de ni sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro zhes de skad du ston te /
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro zhes de skad du ston te /
translated: That is Buddhahood.

original: de las dgos pa gzhan med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las dgos pa gzhan med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no other purpose than that.

original: phun tshogs pha rol 'gro ba nyid //üîΩces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phun tshogs pha rol 'gro ba nyid // ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The perfection of going is itself going.

original: 'gro 'am / mi 'gro snyam du the tshom za ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gro 'am / mi 'gro snyam du the tshom za ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no cause for doubt as to whether or not one goes,

original: 'gro ba nyid ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'gro ba nyid ces bya ba smos so //
translated: it is said that it is itself going.

original: 'di ni go rims kho na bzhin du rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni go rims kho na bzhin du rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that in just the right order, he says,

original: bden pa gnyis rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩ'gro la phan pa de 'byung ba //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // 'gro la phan pa de 'byung ba //
translated: skill in the discernment of the two truths, and so on.üîΩThe arising of that benefit for the world

original: de bskyed pa ni byed pa ste //
analyzed: de bskyed pa ni byed pa ste //
translated: is the production of it.

original: der blo dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: der blo dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with that mind.

original: yang na blo des 'gro ba la phan pa 'byung ba skyed pas de 'gro ba la phan pa 'byung ba skyed pa'i blo dang ldan pa'o zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na blo des 'gro ba la phan pa 'byung ba skyed pas de 'gro ba la phan pa 'byung ba skyed pa'i blo dang ldan pa'o zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Or, he is endowed with the mind that generates the benefit of beings, because the benefit of beings arises from that mind.

original: 'jig rten smos pa ni bden pa gnyis rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jig rten smos pa ni bden pa gnyis rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mention of the world is for the purpose of expressing the greatness of his skill in the analysis of the two truths.

original: bden pa gnyis rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa 'di lta bu ni /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa 'di lta bu ni /
translated: For, with such skill in the analysis of the two truths,

original: gang gis 'jig rten 'khor ba'i srin bu yang /
analyzed: gang gis 'jig rten 'khor ba'i srin bu yang /
translated: he causes even the worldly, who are like worms,

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: to reach the perfection of their own and others aims.

original: bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa ni ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa ni ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The perfection of ones own aim is characterized by the perfection of intuition and abandonment.

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The perfection of others aims is similar to that.

original: bye brag tu byar med pa ni sangs rgyas kyi thugs kyi rgyud la mnga' ba'i bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩshin tu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bye brag tu byar med pa ni sangs rgyas kyi thugs kyi rgyud la mnga' ba'i bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa brjod pa'i phyir ro // shin tu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one without anything to be done is because of the expression of the perfection of one's own and others' goals that exists in the mind continuum of a Buddha.

original: bden pa gnyis rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig lnga po @17b dag dang sbyar ro //üîΩgzhan ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig lnga po @17b dag dang sbyar ro // gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Very is connected with the five words beginning with skilled in the division of the two truths.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can te /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can te /
translated: The other is the one who has the lineage of the Sravakas, etc.

original: 'gro ba la phan pa 'byung ba bskyed pa'i blo dang ldan pa dag las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba la phan pa 'byung ba bskyed pa'i blo dang ldan pa dag las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is other than those who have the mind that produces the benefit of beings.

original: de yang bden pa gnyis rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa kho nar gyur na /
analyzed: de yang bden pa gnyis rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa kho nar gyur na /
translated: And that one, having become skilled in the division of the two truths,

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung rab rab 'byam dag la shes pa'i snang ba thob nas bsam pa dang mthun pa nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid yid la bsams pa bzhin du yongs su rdzogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung rab rab 'byam dag la shes pa'i snang ba thob nas bsam pa dang mthun pa nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid yid la bsams pa bzhin du yongs su rdzogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar
translated: Having obtained the light of knowledge in the Sugata's scriptures, one will perfect the characteristics of the enlightenment of the sravakas and so on, in accordance with one's thoughts.

original: sbyar ro // nges par zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbyar ro // nges par zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The word certainly should be applied to both.

original: de'i phyir 'dis ni gdon mi za ba kho nar pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis ni gdon mi za ba kho nar pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, this shows that one will certainly perfect the perfections,

original: 'khrul pa yin pa snyam du mi bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin pa snyam du mi bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: and one should not think that it is a mistake.

original: de dang der zhes bya ba ni spyir btang ba'i tshig ste /
analyzed: de dang der zhes bya ba ni spyir btang ba'i tshig ste /
translated: The word there is a general term,

original: mdo sde mang ba nyid du ston to //
analyzed: mdo sde mang ba nyid du ston to //
translated: indicating the multiplicity of sutras.

original: bden pa gnyis rnam par dbye ba'i don kyang bya'o zhes ston pa la /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis rnam par dbye ba'i don kyang bya'o zhes ston pa la /
translated: It shows that one should also do the division of the two truths.

original: ji ltar snang ba 'di kho na zhes bya ba bsnan pa ni rigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba 'di kho na zhes bya ba bsnan pa ni rigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The addition of just as they appear is for the purpose of showing that they are not as they appear.

original: kun rdzob smos pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste tshig tha ma khong nas dbyung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob smos pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste tshig tha ma khong nas dbyung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of conventional is for the sake of the conventional truth, since the final word is implied.

original: gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word other means

original: ji ltar snang ba las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba las gzhan pa'o //
translated: other than just as they appear.

original: de'i phyir 'dis ni rigs pa ji lta ba bzhin nyid ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis ni rigs pa ji lta ba bzhin nyid ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, this shows that just as they are is the ultimate truth.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni bsnan pa'i don te //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni bsnan pa'i don te //
translated: The word only means addition.

original: gzhan kho na zhes bya ba'am cig shos kho na zhes bya bar bsnan par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan kho na zhes bya ba'am cig shos kho na zhes bya bar bsnan par bya'o //
translated: Either only other or only different should be added.

original: 'di rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain this, he says,

original: ji ltar ba lang rdzi mo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar ba lang rdzi mo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Just as a cowherd...

original: ba lang rdzi mo smos pa ni blo ma byang ba'i 'jig rten bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba lang rdzi mo smos pa ni blo ma byang ba'i 'jig rten bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of a cowherd is for the purpose of showing the untrained world.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni blo byang ba rnams gzung ste /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni blo byang ba rnams gzung ste /
translated: The mention of etc. includes the trained.

original: ji ltar de dag gi mthong ba bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang mthun par zhags pa yin no zhes bya ba lhag ma ste /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag gi mthong ba bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang mthun par zhags pa yin no zhes bya ba lhag ma ste /
translated: The rest is as above.

original: de bzhin du kun rdzob tu bum pa la sogs pa bden par rnam par gnas kyi de kho na nyid du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun rdzob tu bum pa la sogs pa bden par rnam par gnas kyi de kho na nyid du ni ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, a pot, etc. are established as real conventionally, but not in reality,

original: rigs pas dpyad na bum par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rigs pas dpyad na bum par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because when analyzed with reasoning, they are not suitable as a pot, and so on.

original: ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du rnam par gnas pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du rnam par gnas pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How are they established as they are seen?

original: mthong ba dang mthun par dngos po'i don nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mthong ba dang mthun par dngos po'i don nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, because they apprehend the meaning of things in accordance with how they are seen.

original: de'i phyir 'dis ni byis pa dang / mkhas pa dag bum pa la sogs pa gang la blo mthun pa de ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis ni byis pa dang / mkhas pa dag bum pa la sogs pa gang la blo mthun pa de ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore this teaches that whatever pot, etc. are in agreement with the minds of the childish and the learned are the reality of the correct relative.

original: mthong ba ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: mthong ba ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: With respect to the phrase, ‚Äúseeing is of two types,‚Äù etc.,

original: yang dag pa dang @18a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa dang @18a * //
translated: correct seeing is seeing that is non mistaken with respect to the object that is seen.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gi tshul nyid kyis kun rdzob kyi bden pa bsdus par bstan to //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gi tshul nyid kyis kun rdzob kyi bden pa bsdus par bstan to //
translated: The reality of the conventional is indicated by the mode of the distinction of the unreal, etc.

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsnan pa'i don to zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa nyid do //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsnan pa'i don to zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa nyid do //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù has the sense of ‚Äúalso.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir rigs pa la don dam pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rigs pa la don dam pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the rational the ultimate?

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩslu ba med pas rigs pa ni //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / slu ba med pas rigs pa ni //
translated: Because,üîΩthe rational is the ultimate,

original: don dam yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: don dam yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: because it is non-deceptive.

original: mi slu ba de nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mi slu ba de nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that non-deceptiveness?

original: rigs pa'i stobs kyis don la nges pa ni slu bar mi 'gyur te /üîΩde'i phyir tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyi bskyed pa'i rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni dam pa yang yin la /
analyzed: rigs pa'i stobs kyis don la nges pa ni slu bar mi 'gyur te / de'i phyir tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyi bskyed pa'i rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni dam pa yang yin la /
translated: The ascertainment of the object by the power of reason is not deceptive.

original: don kyang yin pas don dam pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: don kyang yin pas don dam pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, that understanding which is produced by the reason of the trimodal mark is the ultimate, because it is the best and it is the object, and so it is called the ultimate.

original: rigs pa'i stobs ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba dang ldan pa'i dngos po'i stobs so //
analyzed: rigs pa'i stobs ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba dang ldan pa'i dngos po'i stobs so //
translated: The power of reason is the power of the thing which is related by the character of being of the same nature or being derived from it.

original: slu bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: slu bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not deceptive‚Äù means

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bus rgyu la 'khrul bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bus rgyu la 'khrul bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: that the effect is not mistaken with regard to the cause,

original: de'i 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would not be its effect.

original: ngo bo nyid kyang ngo bo nyid la 'khrul bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyang ngo bo nyid la 'khrul bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor is the intrinsic reality mistaken with regard to intrinsic reality,

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would not be its intrinsic reality.

original: dam pa yang yin zhes bya ba ni mi slu ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: dam pa yang yin zhes bya ba ni mi slu ba'i phyir ram /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is also supreme‚Äù means that it is nondeceptive,

original: don dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: or it is related to the meaning.

original: mngon sum gyis gtan la phab pa'i don ni //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gtan la phab pa'i don ni //
translated: The meaning that is ascertained by direct perception

original: mngon sum dang bres gzhal ba'i 'bru ni bre zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: mngon sum dang bres gzhal ba'i 'bru ni bre zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar /
translated: is like the grain that is measured by the measure.

original: don dam pas gtan la phab pa'i don /
analyzed: don dam pas gtan la phab pa'i don /
translated: The meaning that is ascertained by the ultimate

original: skye ba med pa la sogs pa yang don dam pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: skye ba med pa la sogs pa yang don dam pa zhes brjod do //
translated: is also called the ultimate.

original: gal te tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyis bskyed pa'i shes pa don dam pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyis bskyed pa'i shes pa don dam pa yin na /
translated: If the consciousness that is generated by a reason having the three modes is the ultimate,üîΩthen how could it be the ultimate?

original: de lta na ni 'di na du ba yod pa'i phyir me yod do zhes bya ba'i shes pa yang don dam par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'di na du ba yod pa'i phyir me yod do zhes bya ba'i shes pa yang don dam par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, the knowledge that fire exists here because smoke exists would be ultimate.

original: de lta na des gtan la phab pa'i don kyang don dam par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na des gtan la phab pa'i don kyang don dam par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And in that case, the object ascertained by that would be ultimate.

original: de ltar ni shes par mi bya ste /üîΩdu ba la sogs pa ni gzod ma nas ma skyes pas med pa'i phyir des bskyed pa'i shes pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar ni shes par mi bya ste / du ba la sogs pa ni gzod ma nas ma skyes pas med pa'i phyir des bskyed pa'i shes pa'am /
translated: But it should not be known in that way.

original: des gzhal pa'i don yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: des gzhal pa'i don yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Because smoke and so on are primordially unarisen and nonexistent, how could the object that is generated by that or the object that is measured by that exist?

original: ji ste ji ltar mthong ba nyid kyi du ba la sogs pa'i rtags kyis me la sogs pa'i don sgrub na ;
analyzed: ji ste ji ltar mthong ba nyid kyi du ba la sogs pa'i rtags kyis me la sogs pa'i don sgrub na ;
translated: If one establishes the object fire and so on by the sign smoke and so on as it is seen,

original: de lta na ni 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir de nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir de nyes pa med de /
translated: in that case there is no fault because that is our assertion.

original: 'di ltar me la sogs pa med pa gcod par sgrub pa de ni don dam pa dang mthun pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar me la sogs pa med pa gcod par sgrub pa de ni don dam pa dang mthun pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the establishment that eliminates the nonexistence of fire and so on accords with the ultimate,

original: don dam pa nyid ces bya bar 'dod pa nyid de /
analyzed: don dam pa nyid ces bya bar 'dod pa nyid de /
translated: it is asserted to be the ultimate itself.

original: don dam pa ni rtog pa'i dra ba ma lus pa rnam par gcod pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa ni rtog pa'i dra ba ma lus pa rnam par gcod pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the ultimate is characterized by the complete elimination of the web of conceptual thoughts.

original: tshig le'ur @18b byas pa las ni kun rdzob ces brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: tshig le'ur @18b byas pa las ni kun rdzob ces brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it said in the verse that it is the superficial?

original: 'brel ba las kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'brel ba las kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it said to be the truth of the superficial in the compound?

original: tshig tha ma khong nas dbyung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: tshig tha ma khong nas dbyung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is supplied from the previous sentence.

original: gal te rigs pas rung ba ma yin na ji ltar bden pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rigs pas rung ba ma yin na ji ltar bden pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: If it is not tenable by reason, how can it be called truth?

original: ji ltar snang ba de nyid bden //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba de nyid bden //
translated: It is the truth in just that appearance.

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: This is what is said.

original: de lta na bum pa la sogs pa dang / zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa bye brag ci yang med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na bum pa la sogs pa dang / zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa bye brag ci yang med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, there is no difference at all between a pot, etc. and a double moon, etc.

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: A double moon, etc. also, etc.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bum pa la sogs pa 'ba' zhig ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bum pa la sogs pa 'ba' zhig ma yin pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means not only a pot, etc.

original: 'o na 'jig rten pa dag bum pa la sogs pa dang / zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa la bden pa dang / bden pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad ji lta bur 'dogs she na /
analyzed: 'o na 'jig rten pa dag bum pa la sogs pa dang / zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa la bden pa dang / bden pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad ji lta bur 'dogs she na /
translated: Well then, how do worldly people impute the conventions of true and not true to a pot and so on, and to a second moon and so on?

original: ma rig pas ldongs pa'i 'jig rten pa rnams bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ma rig pas ldongs pa'i 'jig rten pa rnams bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du /
translated: Worldly people, blinded by ignorance, impute true existence to a pot and so on,

original: zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa bden pa nyid du /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa bden pa nyid du /
translated: and to a second moon and so on, just as they do to a pot and so on.

original: de ltar khas mi len pas so //
analyzed: de ltar khas mi len pas so //
translated: But we do not accept that.

original: tshig de dag gis don dam pa dang mthun pa'i don dam pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: tshig de dag gis don dam pa dang mthun pa'i don dam pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Those words indicate the ultimate that is concordant with the ultimate.

original: de'i sa bon tsam zhig smos pa byas nas /
analyzed: de'i sa bon tsam zhig smos pa byas nas /
translated: They mention just the seed of that.

original: zhib tu ni 'og nas rnam par 'byed par byed do //
analyzed: zhib tu ni 'og nas rnam par 'byed par byed do //
translated: They will analyze it in detail later.

original: da ni rnam grangs ma yin pa'i don dam pa gang yin pa de /üîΩji ltar snang ba'i dngos por ni //
analyzed: da ni rnam grangs ma yin pa'i don dam pa gang yin pa de / ji ltar snang ba'i dngos por ni //
translated: Now, with regard to the nonenumerated ultimate,

original: rnam par gnas par mi rung ste //
analyzed: rnam par gnas par mi rung ste //
translated: it is not suitable to abideüîΩin the entity that appears.

original: shes pa'i dngos po thams cad la //
analyzed: shes pa'i dngos po thams cad la //
translated: In all entities of consciousness,

original: ji lta bur yang snang mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur yang snang mi 'gyur //
translated: nothing at all appears.

original: zhes bya ba smos pa la sogs pa mdo tsam zhig byed do /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos pa la sogs pa mdo tsam zhig byed do /
translated: This is a mere summary of what is stated in the root text.

original: zhib tu ni 'og nas gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: zhib tu ni 'og nas gsal bar byed do //
translated: This will be made clear in detail below.

original: shes pa'i dngos po thams cad ni //
analyzed: shes pa'i dngos po thams cad ni //
translated: All entities of consciousness

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid thams cad do //
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid thams cad do //
translated: are of the nature of consciousness.

original: thams cad smos pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa bsdu ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: thams cad smos pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa bsdu ba'i phyir te /
translated: The word ‚Äúall‚Äù is used to include both the omniscient and the non-omniscient.

original: de ltar na drug par bsdu'o //
analyzed: de ltar na drug par bsdu'o //
translated: Thus, it is included in the sixth.

original: gcig tu thams cad smos pa ni mtha' dag gi don te bye bag gi tshig sdud pa'o //
analyzed: gcig tu thams cad smos pa ni mtha' dag gi don te bye bag gi tshig sdud pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúall‚Äù is used in the sense of totality, to include all the various words.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i yang ngo //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i yang ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù refers to the non-omniscient.

original: shes pa'i dngos po thams cad la //
analyzed: shes pa'i dngos po thams cad la //
translated: All entities of consciousness

original: ji lta bur yang mi snang 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur yang mi snang 'gyur //
translated: do not appear in any way.

original: zhes bya ba 'di lung dang sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di lung dang sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to connect this with scripture,

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdo sde las zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdo sde las zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it says ‚Äútherefore, in the sutra‚Äù and so on.

original: 'ga' yang zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo la bya'o //
analyzed: 'ga' yang zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo la bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAny‚Äù refers to the nature of entities, non-entities, and so on.

original: mthong ba med pa zhes bya ba ni med par dgag pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba med pa zhes bya ba ni med par dgag pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-seeing‚Äù is a negative particle.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba so so rang gis rig @19a * //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba so so rang gis rig @19a * //
translated: Dependent origination, free from the grasped and the grasper, is the knowledge that is the individual intuitive awareness of each one.

original: pa'i shes pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: pa'i shes pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: It exists.

original: 'ga' yang mthong ba med pa ni zhes de skad gang gsungs ba de ni /
analyzed: 'ga' yang mthong ba med pa ni zhes de skad gang gsungs ba de ni /
translated: As for the statement, ‚ÄúNo one sees anything,‚Äù

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no zhes zer ba la /
translated: this was said with the imagined nature in mind.

original: gal te brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: gal te brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: If the imagined nature

original: 'ga' yang mthong ba med ce na //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'ga' yang mthong ba med ce na // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: is not seen by anyone,üîΩthen it is not seen by anyone at all,

original: de ni rtag tu med pa nyid yin pas de snang ba'i lam du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu med pa nyid yin pas de snang ba'i lam du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because it is always nonexistent. Therefore, it does not appear as an object of knowledge.

original: de ni de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa'o //üîΩde lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid ma lus phar yongs su bsdu na ni /
analyzed: de ni de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa'o // de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid ma lus phar yongs su bsdu na ni /
translated: ‚Äú It is just like that‚Äù means that this was said with the imagined nature in mind.üîΩIf it were not so,

original: 'ga' yang zhes ci'i phyir gsungs /
analyzed: 'ga' yang zhes ci'i phyir gsungs /
translated: then why would it be said that ‚Äúno one sees anything‚Äù if the imagined nature were included in the three natures?

original: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spang ba la bya ste //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spang ba la bya ste //
translated: ‚Äú Why?‚Äù means ‚Äúin what way?‚Äù

original: spyir bya ba yin na ni /
analyzed: spyir bya ba yin na ni /
translated: If it were a general activity,

original: ngo bo nyid mi mthong ba zhes bya ba kho nar gsung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid mi mthong ba zhes bya ba kho nar gsung bar 'gyur te /
translated: he would have said, ‚Äúone does not see its own nature.‚Äù

original: de lta na bshad pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na bshad pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: In this way, the explanation would be complete.

original: de lta ma yin na skabs dang mthun par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na skabs dang mthun par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be consistent with the context.

original: de med par zhes bya ba ni gnyis med par ro //
analyzed: de med par zhes bya ba ni gnyis med par ro //
translated: ‚Äú Without it‚Äù means without the other.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú Otherwise‚Äù means

original: gal te dben pa'i ngo bor rig pa mi 'byung na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te dben pa'i ngo bor rig pa mi 'byung na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: if the cognition of the nature of isolation does not occur.

original: mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis med par shes pa zhes bya ba lhag ma ste /
analyzed: mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis med par shes pa zhes bya ba lhag ma ste /
translated: ‚Äú Because it is not tenable‚Äù means that the cognition of the other is not tenable.

original: 'dis ni ji ltar bum pa la sogs pas dben pa'i ngo bo'i sa zhig khong du chud par de na bum pa med par mi shes pa de bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ji ltar bum pa la sogs pas dben pa'i ngo bo'i sa zhig khong du chud par de na bum pa med par mi shes pa de bzhin du bstan to //
translated: This shows that just as one does not understand the nature of the isolation of a pot, for example, by the cognition of the absence of a pot there,üîΩso it is with the self.

original: gnyis kyis dben pa'i ngo bo'i bdag shes pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis kyis dben pa'i ngo bo'i bdag shes pa yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is a cognition of the nature of the self that is isolated from the two,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: de'i phyir / shes pa ni bdag gis bdag shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / shes pa ni bdag gis bdag shes pa ma yin te /
translated: The self does not cognize the self.

original: rang snang bas stong pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rang snang bas stong pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Because it is empty of itself.

original: 'di ni sbyor ba gtso bo smos pa'i tshig yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni sbyor ba gtso bo smos pa'i tshig yin gyi /
translated: This is a statement that mentions the main syllogism,

original: 'di nyid sgrub pa'i sbyor ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid sgrub pa'i sbyor ba ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not the syllogism itself.

original: gal te yin na ni de'i tshe shes pa gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba dang mi ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yin na ni de'i tshe shes pa gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba dang mi ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were, then the example, ‚Äúlike another cognition,‚Äù would not be established.

original: pha rol gyi shes pa gzhan ni bdag shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: pha rol gyi shes pa gzhan ni bdag shes pa nyid do //
translated: This is because another cognition of an object is not itself the cognition of the subject.

original: 'dir sbyor ba ni 'di lta bu yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba ni 'di lta bu yin te /
translated: The syllogism here is as follows:

original: gang dang gang snang bas stong pa de dang de mi shes te /
analyzed: gang dang gang snang bas stong pa de dang de mi shes te /
translated: Whatever is empty of itself is not cognized,

original: dper na shes pa gzhan mi shes pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na shes pa gzhan mi shes pa bzhin te /
translated: like another cognition.

original: de bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba nyid du brjod par 'dod pa'i shes pa ni rang snang bas stong pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba nyid du brjod par 'dod pa'i shes pa ni rang snang bas stong pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the cognition that is the object to be established is empty of itself.

original: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yang ma yin te /üîΩde'i phyir / rang snang bar khas mi len na ni /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yang ma yin te / de'i phyir / rang snang bar khas mi len na ni /
translated: This reason is not unestablished.üîΩIf you do not accept that it is empty of itself,

original: tha dad par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha dad par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows, absurdly, that it is different from itself.

original: sngon po dang de shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sngon po dang de shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúLike blue and its perception.‚Äù

original: de ni 'di skad du dper na sngon po dang / @19b der snang ba sngon po shes pa ni tha dad de /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du dper na sngon po dang / @19b der snang ba sngon po shes pa ni tha dad de /
translated: This is what is being said: Just as blue and the perception of blue that appears as blue are different,

original: gang gi phyir sngon po nyid sngon por snang ba ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngon po nyid sngon por snang ba ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: because blue itself does not appear as blue,

original: shes pa dang shes pa'i bdag nyid du snang ba tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes pa'i bdag nyid du snang ba tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: in the same way, consciousness and the appearance as consciousness would be different.

original: de ltar ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar ni mi 'dod do //
translated: But that is not accepted.

original: shes pa gzhan gyis shes pa myong bar brtags na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis shes pa myong bar brtags na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is imagined that consciousness is experienced by another consciousness, there would be an infinite regress.

original: de lta bas na gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, this reason is not unestablished.

original: gal te rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag shes pa yang yin la /
analyzed: gal te rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag shes pa yang yin la /
translated: If you say that because it has the nature of awareness, the self is also consciousness,

original: rang gi rnam pas stong pa yang yin te 'di gnyis la 'gal pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: rang gi rnam pas stong pa yang yin te 'di gnyis la 'gal pa ci zhig yod /
translated: and it is empty of its own manifestation, what contradiction is there between these two?

original: de bas na gtan tshigs 'di ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na gtan tshigs 'di ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, this reason is doubtful in regard to the opposite of the similar example.

original: rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir yang ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir yang ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Nor is it because of the nature of awareness, he says.

original: bdag shes par zhes bya ba bsnyegs so //
analyzed: bdag shes par zhes bya ba bsnyegs so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the nature of awareness‚Äù is supplied from the commentary.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absurd consequence.

original: de lta na ni shes pa thams cad kyang thams cad rig pa por 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni shes pa thams cad kyang thams cad rig pa por 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, all awarenesses would be the knower of everything,

original: shes pa gang yang dngos po ci yang mi shes pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa gang yang dngos po ci yang mi shes pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: because there is no awareness that does not have the nature of knowing some thing.

original: gal te sngon po shes pa ni ser po shes pa'i rig pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sngon po shes pa ni ser po shes pa'i rig pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the awareness of blue does not have the nature of awareness of yellow,

original: rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mi rung ste /üîΩyul myong ba na 'di ni sngon po shes pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mi rung ste / yul myong ba na 'di ni sngon po shes pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: it is not tenable that it is because of the nature of awareness.üîΩWhen an object is experienced, there is no difference in the statement ‚ÄúThis is the awareness of blue‚Äù

original: 'di ser po shes pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ser po shes pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the statement ‚ÄúThis is the awareness of yellow.‚Äù

original: gal te rang rig pa'i ngo bo yin pas /
analyzed: gal te rang rig pa'i ngo bo yin pas /
translated: If you say that because it is the nature of reflexive awareness,

original: bdag rig ces bya bar bsnyegs te /
analyzed: bdag rig ces bya bar bsnyegs te /
translated: it is called ‚Äúself-awareness,‚Äù

original: de'i phyir rgyu des ha cang thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu des ha cang thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then for that reason, the absurd consequence does not follow.

original: de yang mi rung ste de ni mi rigs so zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste de ni mi rigs so zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: This is also not correct. The remainder is ‚ÄúThis is not logical.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: nye ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no reason for it.

original: de ni 'di skad du 'di ni rang rig pa'i ngo bo yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du 'di ni rang rig pa'i ngo bo yin gyi /
translated: This is explained as follows: What is the reason for saying, ‚ÄúThis is the nature of reflexive awareness,

original: 'di gzhan rig pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin no zhes 'di la nye ba'i rgyu ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: 'di gzhan rig pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin no zhes 'di la nye ba'i rgyu ci zhig yod de /
translated: but it is not the nature of awareness of something other‚Äù?

original: gang gis na de skad ces smra zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis na de skad ces smra zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By what means do you say this?

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it is not like that,

original: nye ba'i rgyu med par yin na ni ha cang thal bar snga ma de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye ba'i rgyu med par yin na ni ha cang thal bar snga ma de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then because there is no reason for it, the absurd consequence stated previously follows.

original: ji ste rgyu yod la rgyu de yang de'i rnam pa las gzhan ma yin na ni /
analyzed: ji ste rgyu yod la rgyu de yang de'i rnam pa las gzhan ma yin na ni /
translated: But if there is a reason, and that reason is not different from its aspect,

original: de lta na yang rang snang bar khas len na ni tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes skyon sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de lta na yang rang snang bar khas len na ni tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes skyon sngar bstan zin to //
translated: This fault has already been explained.

original: mi rung ste lan btab zin pa'i phyir ram zhes bya bas ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: mi rung ste lan btab zin pa'i phyir ram zhes bya bas ni 'di skad du /
translated: ‚Äú It is not tenable‚Äù means that the response has already been given.

original: gal te rig pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rang gi rgyu las skyes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rig pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rang gi rgyu las skyes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the nature of cognition is produced from its own cause,

original: de la kho bos rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir yang ma yin te /üîΩha cang thal bar @20a * //
analyzed: de la kho bos rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir yang ma yin te / ha cang thal bar @20a * //
translated: we respond that it is not because of being the nature of cognition.üîΩBecause of the absurd consequence

original: 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas lan btab zin to //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas lan btab zin to //
translated: that it would be produced again.

original: zhes bya bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: ji ste rig pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rang gi rgyu las skyes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste rig pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rang gi rgyu las skyes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the nature of cognition is produced from its own cause,

original: kho bos de la yang rang rig pa'i ngo bo yin pas de'i phyir ha cang thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: kho bos de la yang rang rig pa'i ngo bo yin pas de'i phyir ha cang thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na yang mi rung ste /
translated: we respond that it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúBecause it is the nature of reflexive awareness, there is no absurd consequence.‚Äù

original: nye ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no proximate cause.

original: de lta ma yin na ha cang thal ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya bas lan btab zin te rnam pa gzhan ni mi srid do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ha cang thal ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya bas lan btab zin te rnam pa gzhan ni mi srid do //
translated: We have already responded to this by saying that it is impossible for it to be otherwise.

original: ci'i phyir mi srid de /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi srid de /
translated: Why is it impossible?

original: 'di ltar gang gi phyir 'di ni bdag rig pa yin gyi 'di gzhan rig pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid cig shes pa de la yod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi phyir 'di ni bdag rig pa yin gyi 'di gzhan rig pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid cig shes pa de la yod mod kyi /
translated: It is because the nature of consciousness is such that it is self-cognizing, not other-cognizing.

original: de ni dpyad par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: de ni dpyad par mi nus so zhe na /
translated: But it cannot be analyzed.

original: gal te de ltar dpyad du med pas 'di ni bdag gis bdag rig pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te de ltar dpyad du med pas 'di ni bdag gis bdag rig pa yin gyi /
translated: If it cannot be analyzed in this way, then it is self-cognizing,

original: gzhan rig pa ni ma yin no zhes de ltar rnam par 'jog na /
analyzed: gzhan rig pa ni ma yin no zhes de ltar rnam par 'jog na /
translated: not other-cognizing.

original: ji skad brjod par bya /
analyzed: ji skad brjod par bya /
translated: How can you posit it in this way?

original: bdag rig pa legs par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag rig pa legs par gnas pa yin te /
translated: It is well established that it is self-cognizing.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: Therefore, this is nonsense.

original: shes pa de'i ngo bo nyid ni 'di 'dra ste /
analyzed: shes pa de'i ngo bo nyid ni 'di 'dra ste /
translated: The nature of that consciousness is such that

original: rang gi rgyu las skyes zhes bya ba de la tshad ma ci yang med pa de'i phyir mi slu ba'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu las skyes zhes bya ba de la tshad ma ci yang med pa de'i phyir mi slu ba'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The phrase because there is no valid cognition is stated because there is no non-deceptive valid cognition of the statement it arises from its own cause.

original: tshad ma med kyang shes pa de lta bu 'byung ba mi rigs par brjod pa'i phyir sems mi mthun pa gzhan rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: tshad ma med kyang shes pa de lta bu 'byung ba mi rigs par brjod pa'i phyir sems mi mthun pa gzhan rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to state that it is illogical for such a consciousness to arise even in the absence of valid cognition, he says the other discordant minds, etc.

original: sems mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni gzhung lugs tha dad pa gang la gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni gzhung lugs tha dad pa gang la gnas pa rnams so //
translated: The phrase discordant minds refers to those who adhere to different philosophical systems.

original: rang gi tshul brjod pa ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' brjod pa'o /
analyzed: rang gi tshul brjod pa ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' brjod pa'o /
translated: The phrase their own position refers to their own tenets.

original: rnam pa med par smra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dir snon smras pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa med par smra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dir snon smras pa'o //
translated: The phrase those who advocate the absence of aspects, etc. is an addition here.

original: de skad brgal ba zhes bya ba ni shes pa 'di ni rnam pa med pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: de skad brgal ba zhes bya ba ni shes pa 'di ni rnam pa med pa kho na yin la /
translated: The phrase such an objection refers to the statement this consciousness is devoid of aspects.

original: de'i bdag nyid ni 'di 'dra ste /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni 'di 'dra ste /
translated: Its nature is like this.

original: rang gi rgyu las skyes shing gang gis 'di ltar 'di ni sngon po rig pa yin gyi ser po rig pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu las skyes shing gang gis 'di ltar 'di ni sngon po rig pa yin gyi ser po rig pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and it arises from its own cause, and it is by virtue of that that it is said, ‚ÄúThis is the cognition of blue, not the cognition of yellow.‚Äù

original: de bas ni 'dir gtan tshigs kyis ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas ni 'dir gtan tshigs kyis ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: So what is the use of a reason here?

original: mtshan nyid dang rnam 'grel byed pa smos pa ni de gnyis khyed kyi nang na rtog ge pa'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang rnam 'grel byed pa smos pa ni de gnyis khyed kyi nang na rtog ge pa'i mchog yin no //
translated: The mention of the definition and the commentator is to show that these two are the best of logicians among you.

original: gzhan yang rung zhes smos pa ni rigs pa 'di'i rjes su 'brang ba khyed yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rung zhes smos pa ni rigs pa 'di'i rjes su 'brang ba khyed yin te /
translated: The mention of ‚Äúany other‚Äù is to show that you are the followers of this reasoning,

original: ci byar yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir la yug pa rkyang gi rigs pa 'di lta bu rtog ge pa gzhan dag kyang khas mi len te /
analyzed: ci byar yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir la yug pa rkyang gi rigs pa 'di lta bu rtog ge pa gzhan dag kyang khas mi len te /
translated: and that this reasoning of the blind leading the blind is not accepted by any other logicians.

original: de'i phyir de ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable.

original: gzhan yang de'i ngo bo ni 'di 'dra ste rang gi rgyu las skyes zhes @20b bya ba 'di lta bu ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang de'i ngo bo ni 'di 'dra ste rang gi rgyu las skyes zhes @20b bya ba 'di lta bu ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is not reasonable to say, ‚ÄúIts nature is such that it arises from its own cause.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu'i nus pa bkag phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i nus pa bkag phyir ro //
translated: because the power of the cause is blocked.

original: 'og nas zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'og nas zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: rang rig pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid gsum po yang mi mthong ba yin du chug kyang /
analyzed: rang rig pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid gsum po yang mi mthong ba yin du chug kyang /
translated: Even granting that the three realities are not seen because self-awareness is impossible,

original: ngo bo nyid gsum po de ni yod pa kho na ste /üîΩgang gi phyir mi dmigs pa tsam gyi phyir med do zhes nges par byar mi nus so zhes brgya la de skad zer na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum po de ni yod pa kho na ste / gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa tsam gyi phyir med do zhes nges par byar mi nus so zhes brgya la de skad zer na de'i phyir /
translated: nevertheless, the three realities do exist.üîΩIf someone were to say that, then in response to that, it is said:

original: nges par bya bar mi nus zhes bya bar smos te /
analyzed: nges par bya bar mi nus zhes bya bar smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt cannot be ascertained that they do not exist.‚Äù

original: de dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dang sbyar ro //
translated: That is applied.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: mi mthong ba ni de kho na mthong ba'o zhes bya bar chug na yang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mi mthong ba ni de kho na mthong ba'o zhes bya bar chug na yang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Even granting that not seeing is seeing reality, it is said:

original: gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig ce na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

original: ngo bo nyid thams cad ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid thams cad ces bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: ‚Äúall realities.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi dbang la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yod par zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yod par zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest is: ‚Äúthe dependent reality and so on are said to exist.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚Äúbecause of that.‚Äù

original: rang rig pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because self-awareness is not tenable.

original: ji ga zhes bya ba ni mi bzod pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: ji ga zhes bya ba ni mi bzod pa ston pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú How? ‚Äù shows intolerance.

original: ci'i phyir nges par byar mi nus she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nges par byar mi nus she na /
translated: Why is it definitely not possible?

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar /üîΩyod med dngos po mkhyen pa'o ;
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar / yod med dngos po mkhyen pa'o ;
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: / kun mkhyen pas kyang gang ma gzigs //
analyzed: / kun mkhyen pas kyang gang ma gzigs //
translated: The Omniscient One does not seeüîΩthe entity of that which does not exist.üîΩWith the most subtle view, analyze

original: de yi dngos po ci 'dra zhig / shin tu zhib pa'i lta bas dpyod //üîΩces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de yi dngos po ci 'dra zhig / shin tu zhib pa'i lta bas dpyod // ces bya ba smos so //
translated: what kind of entity it is.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gzhan lta zhog ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gzhan lta zhog ces bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means ‚Äúforget about the others.‚Äù

original: ci 'dra zhig ces bya ba ni spong ba'o //üîΩshin tu zhib pa'i lta bas zhes bya ba ni mchog tu phyas bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci 'dra zhig ces bya ba ni spong ba'o // shin tu zhib pa'i lta bas zhes bya ba ni mchog tu phyas bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚Äú What kind of entity? ‚Äù is a rejection.üîΩ‚Äú With the most subtle view‚Äù means ‚Äúwith the most refined view.‚Äù

original: shin tu zhes bya ba ni zhib pa'i lta ba zhes bya ba'i bye brag go //
analyzed: shin tu zhes bya ba ni zhib pa'i lta ba zhes bya ba'i bye brag go //
translated: ‚Äú Most‚Äù is a specification of ‚Äúsubtle view.‚Äù

original: yang na dpyod cig pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dpyod cig pa'o //
translated: Or it means ‚Äúanalyze.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir ji ltar snang ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ji ltar snang ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: Therefore, what appears is the conventional truth.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni so so rang la ji ltar yang snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni so so rang la ji ltar yang snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The ultimate truth does not appear in any way to the individual.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las kyang /
translated: For this very reason, a scripture says:

original: de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the conventional truth?

original: ji snyed 'jig rten gyi tha snyad gdags pa dang / yi ge dang skad dang brda bstan pa dag go //
analyzed: ji snyed 'jig rten gyi tha snyad gdags pa dang / yi ge dang skad dang brda bstan pa dag go //
translated: It is whatever is designated as the conventions of the world, the teaching of letters, words, and expressions.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni gang la sems rgyu ba yang med na /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni gang la sems rgyu ba yang med na /
translated: The ultimate truth is that in which the mind does not move,

original: yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩmdo'i tshig 'di dag bshad par 'dod nas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad gdags pa ni 'jig rten gyi 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba smos so // mdo'i tshig 'di dag bshad par 'dod nas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad gdags pa ni 'jig rten gyi 'jug pa ste /
translated: how much less so letters.

original: shes pa dang shes bya'i mtshan nyid yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya'i mtshan nyid yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Desiring to explain these words of the scripture, he says, ‚ÄúThe conventions of the world are the activities of the world, which are characterized by consciousness and the objects of consciousness.‚Äù

original: tha snyad gdags pa zhes bya ba ni las su sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad gdags pa zhes bya ba ni las su sgrub pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúconventional‚Äù is a nominal action noun.

original: rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid de ni yi ge dang skad dang brda bstan pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'og ma 'dis brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid de ni yi ge dang skad dang brda bstan pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'og ma 'dis brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of the expression is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúthe teaching of letters, speech, and symbols.‚Äù

original: @21a * // rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid de yang 'jig rten gyi 'jug pa shes bya'i mtshan nyid du ma gtogs sam zhe na /
analyzed: @21a * // rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid de yang 'jig rten gyi 'jug pa shes bya'i mtshan nyid du ma gtogs sam zhe na /
translated: And is the characteristic of the knowable not included in the characteristic of worldly engagement?

original: rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes bshad /
analyzed: rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes bshad /
