translated: It is not the characteristic of the expression.

original: de ni bden te shes bya'i ngo bos ni 'dus mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni bden te shes bya'i ngo bos ni 'dus mod kyi /
translated: This is true, it is included in the nature of the knowable.

original: rjod par byed pa'i ngo bos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rjod par byed pa'i ngo bos ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not included in the nature of the expression.

original: de ni byed pa yin la ;
analyzed: de ni byed pa yin la ;
translated: For that is the agent,

original: las kyi ngo bo ni ma yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: las kyi ngo bo ni ma yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: but not the nature of the object.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni ji snyed pa zhes bya ba tshig gis so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni ji snyed pa zhes bya ba tshig gis so //
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúas many as there are‚Äù refers to the phrase ‚Äúas many as there are knowable things.‚Äù

original: yang na des na zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad gdags pa 'jig rten gyi 'jug pa shes pa dang / shes bya'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: yang na des na zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad gdags pa 'jig rten gyi 'jug pa shes pa dang / shes bya'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba 'dis so //
translated: Or else, the phrase ‚Äútherefore‚Äù refers to the phrase ‚Äúthe characteristic of the knowable, which is the knowledge of worldly engagement, the designation of worldly convention.‚Äù

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gzhan gyi mi srid do snyam pa gcad pa ston to //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gzhan gyi mi srid do snyam pa gcad pa ston to //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is stated to eliminate the idea that something else is possible.

original: kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig ni ma yin no snyam du dogs par mi bya bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig ni ma yin no snyam du dogs par mi bya bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is not to be taken as meaning ‚Äúnot at all.‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni ji snyed ces bya ba'i tshig la bya'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni ji snyed ces bya ba'i tshig la bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat much‚Äù refers to the phrase ‚Äúthat much is known.‚Äù

original: 'og tu yang zhes bya ba ni yi ge dang skad dang brda bstan pa'o zhes bya ba der ro //
analyzed: 'og tu yang zhes bya ba ni yi ge dang skad dang brda bstan pa'o zhes bya ba der ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to the explanation of letters, speech, and conventional symbols.

original: brjod zin pa'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brjod zin pa'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to indicate the meaning of what has been said, he says,

original: de ni de ltar rtogs par bya zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar rtogs par bya zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat should be understood in that way.‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang shes bya'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid de kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no zhes de ni de ltar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang shes bya'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid de kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no zhes de ni de ltar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat should be understood in that way‚Äù means that the characteristic of the knower and the known and the characteristic of verbal expression should be understood as conventional truth.

original: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
translated: Why is that?

original: don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pa la sems rgyu ba yang med de zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩ'dis ni gang la sems rgyu ba yang med pa yin gyi tshig 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pa la sems rgyu ba yang med de zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so // 'dis ni gang la sems rgyu ba yang med pa yin gyi tshig 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúThe mind does not engage in the teaching of ultimate truth.‚ÄùüîΩThis shows that the ultimate truth is not just a word, but that the mind does not engage there.

original: de ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir la /
translated: It is said that the ultimate truth is that in which the mind does not engage and words do not apply.

original: gang la sems rgyu ba dang tshig kyang yod pa de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la sems rgyu ba dang tshig kyang yod pa de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that the conventional truth is that in which the mind engages and words apply.

original: de ltar shes pa dang shes bya 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin na /
analyzed: de ltar shes pa dang shes bya 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin na /
translated: If the conventional truth is characterized by the engagement of the knower and the known,

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang bde ba la sogs pa sems kyi yul yin par gyur pa yang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang bde ba la sogs pa sems kyi yul yin par gyur pa yang /
translated: then form, etc., and pleasure, etc., which are the objects of mind,

original: gang gis kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid du mi 'gyur zhes su zhig zlog par byed ces de skad bstan pa yin te /üîΩde ni de ltar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid du mi 'gyur zhes su zhig zlog par byed ces de skad bstan pa yin te / de ni de ltar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: how could they not be the conventional truth? Who would deny that?üîΩThis is the point.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: This should be understood.

original: rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kho na kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin na zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin par khas len na ni zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kho na kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin na zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin par khas len na ni zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: If the characteristic of the expression were the conventional truth, then the rest of the sentence would be, ‚ÄúIf one accepts the conventional truth.‚Äù

original: yi ge rgyu ba yang med na zhes gsungs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yi ge rgyu ba yang med na zhes gsungs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúThe movement of the syllables would not exist‚Äù would be the correct statement,üîΩbut it would not say ‚Äúthe mind.‚Äù

original: sems zhes gsung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sems rgyu ba med pa la @21b ni mi bya ste /
analyzed: sems zhes gsung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sems rgyu ba med pa la @21b ni mi bya ste /
translated: The movement of the mind is not called the conventional truth,

original: gang gi phyir sems rgyu ba kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems rgyu ba kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the movement of the mind is not accepted as the conventional truth.

original: kho na zhes bya ba ni sems rgyu ba'i mtshan nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa ma yin par rnam par gcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho na zhes bya ba ni sems rgyu ba'i mtshan nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa ma yin par rnam par gcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is used to exclude the characteristic of the movement of the mind from being the conventional truth.

original: gal te ji skad gsungs pa'i go rims can de gnyis mi 'dod na ni sems rgyu ba yang med na /
analyzed: gal te ji skad gsungs pa'i go rims can de gnyis mi 'dod na ni sems rgyu ba yang med na /
translated: If one does not accept the conventional truth as it has been explained, then the movement of the mind would not exist.

original: yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba brjod par bya ba'i go rims ci'i phyir mdzad ces bya bas ni snon bstan to //
analyzed: yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba brjod par bya ba'i go rims ci'i phyir mdzad ces bya bas ni snon bstan to //
translated: Why is the order of expression made?üîΩThis is the addition.

original: go rims de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: go rims de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that order?

original: sems rgyu ba yang med na /
analyzed: sems rgyu ba yang med na /
translated: If there is no movement of mind,

original: yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: what need is there to mention syllables?

original: ci'i phyir go rims mi rung zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir go rims mi rung zhe na //
translated: Why is the order not suitable?

original: gal te ji skad gsungs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te ji skad gsungs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If it is as stated,

original: ji skad gsungs pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa ni gnyis te /
translated: there are two as stated:

original: sems rgyu ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sems rgyu ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of the movement of mind and the characteristic of expression.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What kind?

original: go rims can zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: go rims can zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said to be orderly.

original: go rims can zhes bya ba ni sems rgyu ba de rjod par byed pa'i sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go rims can zhes bya ba ni sems rgyu ba de rjod par byed pa'i sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Orderly means that the movement of mind precedes expression.

original: mi 'dod ni zhes bya ba kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid du zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod ni zhes bya ba kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid du zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: If it is not accepted, it is said to be only conventional truth.

original: gal te 'dod par gyur na ni de'i rgyu med na 'bras bu med pas sems rgyu ba yang med na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod par gyur na ni de'i rgyu med na 'bras bu med pas sems rgyu ba yang med na /
translated: If it were to be so, then since the effect would not exist if the cause does not exist, there would be no movement of mind, let alone the existence of letters.

original: yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i go rims rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i go rims rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the order would be appropriate.

original: rjod par byed pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid de /
analyzed: rjod par byed pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid de /
translated: The expressive is conventional truth,

original: de kun nas slong ba yin pas rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de kun nas slong ba yin pas rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa yang ngo //
translated: and since it is the motivating force, it is also the conceptual consciousness.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa ma yin pa kho na yin pas /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa ma yin pa kho na yin pas /
translated: That non-conceptual consciousness is not conventional truth at all.

original: des yongs su gcad pa'i bde ba la sogs pa kun rdzob kyi bden par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des yongs su gcad pa'i bde ba la sogs pa kun rdzob kyi bden par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: So how could the pleasure, etc., that are its objects be conventional truth?

original: de ltar na sems rgyu ba med pa zhes bya ba 'dir rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa kho na yongs su gzung ngo zhes brgya zhig la de skad zer du 'ong bas /
analyzed: de ltar na sems rgyu ba med pa zhes bya ba 'dir rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa kho na yongs su gzung ngo zhes brgya zhig la de skad zer du 'ong bas /
translated: Thus, in this context, ‚Äúmovement of mind‚Äù refers only to conceptual consciousness.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa nyid yin par yongs su gzung na ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa nyid yin par yongs su gzung na ni /
translated: If it is taken to refer to conceptual consciousness,

original: sems rgyu ba yang med na zhes bya ba 'dir /
analyzed: sems rgyu ba yang med na zhes bya ba 'dir /
translated: then in the phrase ‚Äúthere would be no movement of mind,‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa rgyu ba yang med na zhes gsung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rgyu ba yang med na zhes gsung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If there were no movement of conceptualization, he would say no mind.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: the tshom med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsems yin par gzung na ni ci rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa yongs su gzung ngam /
analyzed: the tshom med pa'i phyir ro // sems yin par gzung na ni ci rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa yongs su gzung ngam /
translated: Because there would be no doubt.üîΩIf he were to apprehend the mind, he would doubt whether he was apprehending a conceptual cognition or

original: 'on te sems tsam kho na yin zhig gu snyam du the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te sems tsam kho na yin zhig gu snyam du the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: whether it was just the mind alone.

original: gal te sems smos pa spyi'i sgra yin yang rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sems smos pa spyi'i sgra yin yang rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If he were to say that the word mind is a general term, but that he is apprehending a conceptual cognition,

original: 'di la nges par byed @22a * //
analyzed: 'di la nges par byed @22a * //
translated: then he would have to prove that.

original: pa'i tshad ma ni med do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: pa'i tshad ma ni med do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, There is no valid cognition that would ascertain this.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni sems rgyud med ces bya ba 'di la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni sems rgyud med ces bya ba 'di la'o //
translated: This means in this case, where it is said that there is no continuum of mind.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa nyid yongs su gzung gi / sems tsam ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa nyid yongs su gzung gi / sems tsam ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: If he were to say that he is apprehending conceptualization itself, and not just the mind,

original: sems kyi sgra ni spyi'i sgra yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sems kyi sgra ni spyi'i sgra yin mod kyi /
translated: then the word mind would be a general term.

original: bye brag tu ni rnam par rtog pa la gnas par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bye brag tu ni rnam par rtog pa la gnas par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In particular, it is a basis for conceptualization.

original: spyi'i sgra yang don dang skabs la sogs pa med par bye brag tu gzhag par mi nus so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: spyi'i sgra yang don dang skabs la sogs pa med par bye brag tu gzhag par mi nus so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response to this, it is said that a general term cannot be applied to a particular without regard to meaning, context, and so on.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni lhan cig rgyu ba la sogs pa yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni lhan cig rgyu ba la sogs pa yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes co-occurrence and so on.

original: gnyis ni sems rgyu ba yang med na yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis ni sems rgyu ba yang med na yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there is no movement of the mind, then what need is there to mention the movement of letters?

original: ci'i phyir gnyis brjod par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnyis brjod par mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it that the two cannot be expressed?

original: rjod par byed pa'i spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa'i spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe general term for the expression . . .‚Äù

original: de ni 'di skad du spyi zhes bya ba gud na med de /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du spyi zhes bya ba gud na med de /
translated: This is what is being said: There is no such thing as a general term that exists separately.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i rjes su 'jug pa kho na'i ngo bo la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i rjes su 'jug pa kho na'i ngo bo la /
translated: The nature of a general term is simply the engagement of a conceptual cognition.

original: phyi rol gyi ngo bor gzung ba ni yi ge'i spyi yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ngo bor gzung ba ni yi ge'i spyi yin no //
translated: The apprehension of an external nature is the general term for letters.

original: de ltar na sems rgyu ba med pa brjod na 'og ma yi ge rnams rgyu ba med pa yang brjod pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na sems rgyu ba med pa brjod na 'og ma yi ge rnams rgyu ba med pa yang brjod pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, if the movement of the mind is denied, then the movement of letters is also denied.

original: de'i phyir yi ge rnams rgyu ba med ces brjod pa don med do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir yi ge rnams rgyu ba med ces brjod pa don med do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is meaningless to say that the letters do not move.

original: snon bstan pa ni /
analyzed: snon bstan pa ni /
translated: The addition is taught:

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra mdzes pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra mdzes pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is not beautiful.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rjod par byed pa'i spyi rnam par rtog pa'i rjes su 'brang ba yin pa /
analyzed: rjod par byed pa'i spyi rnam par rtog pa'i rjes su 'brang ba yin pa /
translated: Because the general expression follows the conceptual consciousness.

original: de lta na ni sems rgyu ba med pa de dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na ni sems rgyu ba med pa de dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In that case, since it is not different from that,

original: yi ge rnams rgyu ba med pa yang bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: yi ge rnams rgyu ba med pa yang bstan pa yin te /
translated: the non-movement of the letters is also taught.

original: de'i phyir 'di la gang gis yang zhes bya ba'i sgra mdzes par byed pa lhag pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la gang gis yang zhes bya ba'i sgra mdzes par byed pa lhag pa ci yang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is nothing else here that makes the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù beautiful.

original: phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di'i don to //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù

original: gal te yi ge rang gi mtshan nyid du gyur pa rnams rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yi ge rang gi mtshan nyid du gyur pa rnams rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ma yin te /
translated: If the letters that are the intrinsic identity do not follow the conceptual consciousness,

original: de dag thugs la bzhag nas yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes de skad gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: de dag thugs la bzhag nas yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes de skad gsungs so zhe na /
translated: If you think that since they are not established in reality, it is not necessary to consider them in the mind, and then say, ‚ÄúWhat need is there to consider them in the mind?‚Äù

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni rjod par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir de thugs la bzhag nas rjod pa rung ba kho na ma yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni rjod par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir de thugs la bzhag nas rjod pa rung ba kho na ma yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: then it is said that it is not suitable to consider them in the mind because they do not express their own characteristics.

original: yi ge rnams rgyu ba ni rjod par skyed pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yi ge rnams rgyu ba ni rjod par skyed pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the movement of letters generates speech,

original: de ni rang gi mtshan nyid la yod pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de ni rang gi mtshan nyid la yod pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: they do not exist in their own characteristics.

original: de lta na ni 'di gsungs pas ci zhig tu 'gyur snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'di gsungs pas ci zhig tu 'gyur snyam du sems so //
translated: If that is so, what is the point of saying this?

original: ji ste yang ji ltar gyur kyang ci ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba 'di mi brjod du mi rung ngo snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ji ste yang ji ltar gyur kyang ci ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba 'di mi brjod du mi rung ngo snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that it is not suitable to not say, ‚ÄúWhat need is there to consider them in the mind?‚Äù

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: then, in that case,

original: don @22b 'og ma brjod par yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba 'og tu brjod pa 'dir /
analyzed: don @22b 'og ma brjod par yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba 'og tu brjod pa 'dir /
translated: since the meaning of the latter is not expressed, it is said below, ‚ÄúWhat need is there to consider the letters?‚Äù

original: gong ma sems rgyu ba yang med na zhes bya ba de 'dus pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gong ma sems rgyu ba yang med na zhes bya ba de 'dus pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the upper mind does not move, then that would be a contradiction.

original: ci'i phyir 'dus par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dus par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why would it be a contradiction?

original: rjod par byed pa spyi'i rjes su nang gi rjod pa 'brang ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa spyi'i rjes su nang gi rjod pa 'brang ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because the internal expression follows the general expression.

original: de'i phyir gnyis brjod par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis brjod par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Therefore, it would not be expressed twice.

original: gnyis ka yang bka' stsal to //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang bka' stsal to //
translated: But both were stated.

original: de'i phyir rab tu bsgrub par bya ba 'dod pa'i don mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /üîΩde lta bas na dngos po tsam dang mthun par byed pa'i ngang can gyi sems rgyu ba yang med ces bya ba 'di nyid yang dag par na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rab tu bsgrub par bya ba 'dod pa'i don mjug bsdu ba'i phyir / de lta bas na dngos po tsam dang mthun par byed pa'i ngang can gyi sems rgyu ba yang med ces bya ba 'di nyid yang dag par na /
translated: Therefore, in order to conclude the meaning that is desired to be established,

original: bcom ldan 'das bzhed do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bzhed do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúTherefore, the BhagavƒÅn accepts just this, that the mind that moves in accordance with mere things does not move at all.‚Äù

original: dngos po tsam dang mthun par byed pa'i ngang can gyi sems ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can gyi shes pa la bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po tsam dang mthun par byed pa'i ngang can gyi sems ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can gyi shes pa la bya'o //
translated: The mind that moves in accordance with mere things should be understood as the consciousness that has the nature of an object‚Äôs specific characteristic.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni srid pa ste /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni srid pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means existence.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: but not for the sake of apprehending the conceptual consciousness.

original: yang na bcom ldan 'das kyang bzhed do zhes blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na bcom ldan 'das kyang bzhed do zhes blta bar bya ste /
translated: Or else, it should be seen that the Lord also accepts the non-existence of the external object,

original: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin par 'dod do //
translated: but not only the noble Aksayamati.

original: yang dag par na zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du na'o //
analyzed: yang dag par na zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du na'o //
translated: In reality means in reality.

original: bzhed ces bya ba ni dgongs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bzhed ces bya ba ni dgongs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Accepts means intends.

original: de lta na ni thams cad 'tsham mo zhes bya ba ni mdzes so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste de ni brda phrad par sla'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni thams cad 'tsham mo zhes bya ba ni mdzes so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste de ni brda phrad par sla'o //
translated: Thus, everything is appropriate means thus, everything is beautiful. This is easy to understand.

original: de ltar na dngos po tsam dang mthun par byed pa'i ngang can gyi sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa rjod par byed pa spyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po tsam dang mthun par byed pa'i ngang can gyi sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa rjod par byed pa spyi ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the expression is not a universal that accompanies the mind which has the nature of conforming to mere things.

original: de'i phyir gnyis brjod pa rigs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis brjod pa rigs te /
translated: Therefore, the expression of the two is appropriate.

original: gang du dngos po tsam dang mthun par byed pa'i ngang can gyi sems mi 'jug pa der /
analyzed: gang du dngos po tsam dang mthun par byed pa'i ngang can gyi sems mi 'jug pa der /
translated: Where the mind that has the nature of conforming to mere things does not engage,

original: rnam par rtog pa yang mi 'jug pa kho na ste des rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang mi 'jug pa kho na ste des rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and conceptualization does not operate at all, because it is distinguished by that.

original: de lta na rnam par rtog pa'i rjes su 'jug pa rjod par byed pa'i phyi ni thag ring ba kho na yin pas yang zhes bya ba'i sgra yang 'tsham pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na rnam par rtog pa'i rjes su 'jug pa rjod par byed pa'i phyi ni thag ring ba kho na yin pas yang zhes bya ba'i sgra yang 'tsham pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is appropriate, since the external is far removed from the operation of conceptualization.

original: de ltar gyur na gzugs la sogs pa dang / bde ba la sogs pa yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na gzugs la sogs pa dang / bde ba la sogs pa yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no //
translated: If that is so, then form, etc., and pleasure, etc., are also conventional truths.

original: yi ni de lta yin na /
analyzed: yi ni de lta yin na /
translated: If that is so,

original: gal te kha cig 'di skad du gzugs la sogs pa dang / bde ba la sogs pa so so rang gis gnas pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni don so sor nges pa'i rnam pa'i tshig gis rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te kha cig 'di skad du gzugs la sogs pa dang / bde ba la sogs pa so so rang gis gnas pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni don so sor nges pa'i rnam pa'i tshig gis rig pa ma yin te /
translated: then if someone were to say that form, etc., and pleasure, etc., which are established by their own nature, are not known by the words that express the individual natures of objects,

original: de dag ni dag gi lam las 'das pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni dag gi lam las 'das pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa ma yin te /
translated: then they are not conventional truths, because they transcend the realm of the path of words.

original: de na tha snyad gdags pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de na tha snyad gdags pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are designated by convention.
Thus,

original: ltar mdo las de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ltar mdo las de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: in a s≈´tra it is said: ‚ÄúWhat is conventional truth?

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad gdags pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad gdags pa /
translated: and the conventions of the world,

original: yi ge dang skad dang brda bstan pa ji snyed pa dag go zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di la tshig gi don ni grags pa'i dngos po'i rgyu las byung ba /
analyzed: yi ge dang skad dang brda bstan pa ji snyed pa dag go zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // 'di la tshig gi don ni grags pa'i dngos po'i rgyu las byung ba /
translated: as many as there are, of letters, language, and signs.

original: sgra dang don ma grags pa'i rnam pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir de gnyis dang mthun par byed pa brda shes pa rnams kyi yi ge dang / tshig dang ngag mdo sde dang 'brel pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: sgra dang don ma grags pa'i rnam pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir de gnyis dang mthun par byed pa brda shes pa rnams kyi yi ge dang / tshig dang ngag mdo sde dang 'brel pa yang rung ste /
translated: Here, the meaning of the words is as follows: That which arises from the cause of a well-known thing, and that which is made to conform to those two, in order to clarify the unknown aspects of the word and its meaning, is the letter, the word, and the speech, together with the sutras, of those who know the signs.

original: brjod par bya ba dang bcas pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba dang bcas pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: That which is related to the sutras is said to be ‚Äúconventional truth.‚Äù

original: de dag ni de bzhin du spyi'i rnam pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin du spyi'i rnam pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: But they do not apprehend that as it really is,

original: de'i phyir rjod par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjod par byed do zhe na /
translated: and therefore they express it.

original: don dam pa la yang thal bar 'gyur te /üîΩde yang tshig gi ngo bo'i rjod par byed pas /
analyzed: don dam pa la yang thal bar 'gyur te / de yang tshig gi ngo bo'i rjod par byed pas /
translated: But then it follows that the ultimate truth is also not the ultimate truth,üîΩbecause it is also expressed by the essence of words,

original: brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because it is also an object of expression.

original: de dag ni don dam pa'i bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni don dam pa'i bden pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the ultimate truth,

original: de dag la dngos po'i sgra yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la dngos po'i sgra yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have the word ‚Äúthing‚Äù in their names.

original: rnam pa gzhan ni med pas /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan ni med pas /
translated: But there is no other kind of form.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni med de /
translated: Therefore, they do not exist.

original: rang gi shes pa 'gal ba bden pa gnyis kyis ma bsdus pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rang gi shes pa 'gal ba bden pa gnyis kyis ma bsdus pa'i phyir la /
translated: They are not included in the two truths, because they contradict your own knowledge.

original: de dag ni yongs su 'khyam pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni yongs su 'khyam pa yin te /
translated: They are completely lost.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das ni tha snyad gdags pa kho na kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin par mi gsung gi //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das ni tha snyad gdags pa kho na kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin par mi gsung gi //
translated: Thus, the Lord does not say that the mere conventional designation is the conventional truth.

original: gang la sems 'jug pa de kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang la sems 'jug pa de kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says that whatever the mind engages in is the conventional truth.

original: mdo'i don ni bshad zin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mdo'i don ni bshad zin pa nyid yin no //
translated: The meaning of the sutra has already been explained.

original: don dam pa ni ngag gi ngo bo rjod par byed pas /
analyzed: don dam pa ni ngag gi ngo bo rjod par byed pas /
translated: The ultimate is not the nature of speech,

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'og nas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'og nas brjod par bya'o //
translated: and therefore it is inexpressible, as will be explained later.

original: bden pa gnyis kyis ma zin pa nyid ni ma grub pa kho na yin te spros pas chog go //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyis ma zin pa nyid ni ma grub pa kho na yin te spros pas chog go //
translated: That it is not included in the two truths is simply not established. Enough of this frivolity!

original: sems spyod yul ji snyed pa de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: sems spyod yul ji snyed pa de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste /
translated: Whatever is the domain of the mind is the conventional truth.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhe na /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhe na /
translated: It is not ultimate truth.

original: rnam par dag pa'ang yang dag tu //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'ang yang dag tu //
translated: But if it is pure,

original: rigs sam 'on te min zhes soms //
analyzed: rigs sam 'on te min zhes soms //
translated: is it a reality or not?

original: zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: This is not reasonable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not reasonable?

original: de'i phyir sems spyod yul du gyur pa'o zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems spyod yul du gyur pa'o zhes smos so //
translated: Because the mind is the object of its own awareness.

original: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
translated: Why is it not reasonable?

original: bdag nyid rig pa yin pa'i phyir /üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bdag nyid rig pa yin pa'i phyir / zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because it is self-aware.

original: gal te de ni byed pa dang las dang bya ba'i ngo bos bdag nyid rig pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ni byed pa dang las dang bya ba'i ngo bos bdag nyid rig pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is not self-aware in the sense of being the agent, object, and action of awareness,

original: gal te de lta na ni shes pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni shes pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be the nature of consciousness.

original: gal te rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de lta ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de lta ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is not so because it is the nature of awareness,

original: 'o na ni de dngos po thams cad rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni de dngos po thams cad rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be aware of all things.

original: 'di ni bdag nyid rig @23b pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes smra na ni /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag nyid rig @23b pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes smra na ni /
translated: If you say that it is the nature of self-awareness,

original: sems kyi spyod yul yin pas de kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid du khas blangs pas re zhig gzhag go //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul yin pas de kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid du khas blangs pas re zhig gzhag go //
translated: Since it is the domain of mental activity, it is accepted as the conventional truth.

original: kun rdzob la log par rtogs pa'i blo can dag la rab tu dbye ba byas pas kyang rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kun rdzob la log par rtogs pa'i blo can dag la rab tu dbye ba byas pas kyang rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to make it understood by those who have a mind that is mistaken about the conventional, it is divided.

original: kun rdzob de ni yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: kun rdzob de ni yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That conventional is twofold, by way of the distinction of the real and the unreal.üîΩThere, it is said:

original: de la / brtags pa'i don gyis dben gyur pa //
analyzed: de la / brtags pa'i don gyis dben gyur pa //
translated: That which is devoid of the object of conceptualization,

original: dngos tsam brten nas gang skyes de //üîΩyang dag kun rdzob shes par bya //
analyzed: dngos tsam brten nas gang skyes de // yang dag kun rdzob shes par bya //
translated: that which is born in dependence on mere entity,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: that should be known as the real conventional.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra dang pos ni gnas pa la sogs pa yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra dang pos ni gnas pa la sogs pa yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: The first ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes abiding, etc.

original: 'og mas ni skyes bu'i yongs su 'gyur ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: 'og mas ni skyes bu'i yongs su 'gyur ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The second includes the transformation of a person, etc.

original: yang dag par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúReal‚Äù

original: re re dang yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: re re dang yang sbyar ro //
translated: is to be applied to each.

original: dngos po tsam nyid kyi gtan tshigs ni don byed nus pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po tsam nyid kyi gtan tshigs ni don byed nus pa ste /
translated: The reason for mere entity is the ability to perform a function.

original: 'di yang ji ltar snang ba bzhin du yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di yang ji ltar snang ba bzhin du yin gyi /
translated: This is as it appears,

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ni ma yin no //
translated: but not as it is in reality.

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams la brten nas skyes pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams la brten nas skyes pa ni /
translated: That which arises in dependence on causes and conditions

original: ji ltar snang ba zhes bya bar bsnyems so //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba zhes bya bar bsnyems so //
translated: is called ‚Äúas it appears. ‚Äù

original: rgyu rnams ni thun mong ma yin pa'i byed rgyu'o //
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni thun mong ma yin pa'i byed rgyu'o //
translated: The causes are the uncommon activity.

original: rkyen rnams ni thun mong ba'o //
analyzed: rkyen rnams ni thun mong ba'o //
translated: The conditions are the common activity.

original: dngos su dpyad na ni rkyen rnams kyang rgyu nyid yin no //
analyzed: dngos su dpyad na ni rkyen rnams kyang rgyu nyid yin no //
translated: When analyzed in actuality, the conditions are also the causes.

original: ci'i phyir 'di yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is this called the truth of correct convention?

original: 'di ltar byis pa yan chad kyi shes pa la don ji snyed ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byis pa yan chad kyi shes pa la don ji snyed ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚ÄúThe object of knowledge of the consciousness of ordinary beings and above. ‚Äù

original: bum pa la sogs pa shes pa la /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa shes pa la /
translated: In the knowledge of a pot and so on,

original: snang ba de ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob yin par rigs te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: snang ba de ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob yin par rigs te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: that appearance is the correct convention.

original: ji ltar snang zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar snang zhe na /
translated: How does it appear?

original: mthun par zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mthun par zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúin accordance with. ‚Äù

original: su dag dang mthun zhe na /
analyzed: su dag dang mthun zhe na /
translated: With whom is it in accordance?

original: byis pa yan chad ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: byis pa yan chad ces bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúwith the consciousness of ordinary beings and above. ‚Äù

original: mkhas pa rnams nas bzung ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams nas bzung ste /
translated: from the wise

original: byis pa'i bar du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byis pa'i bar du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: down to the childish.

original: de ni 'di skad du gang dag bstan bcos kyis brtan por byas pa'i blo dang ldan pa de dag la yang ji ltar byis pa la snang bde bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa snang ba gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du gang dag bstan bcos kyis brtan por byas pa'i blo dang ldan pa de dag la yang ji ltar byis pa la snang bde bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa snang ba gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o
translated: This is what it says: ‚ÄúThat which appears to the wise, who are firm in their understanding through the treatises, as it appears to the childish, is the real conventional truth.

original: // bstan bcos la sogs pa'i stobs kyis sgro btags pa'i rnam pa mi snang ba'i tshul can ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // bstan bcos la sogs pa'i stobs kyis sgro btags pa'i rnam pa mi snang ba'i tshul can ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: That which appears in the manner of not appearing as the aspect of superimposition by the power of the treatises, etc., is taught as the unreal conventional truth.

original: ji lta bur snang zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur snang zhe na /
translated: How does it appear?

original: rgyu las zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyu las zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúfrom a cause,‚Äù

original: mig la sogs pa tshogs pa las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /üîΩlog pa la goms pa'i bag chags yongs @24a * //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa tshogs pa las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste / log pa la goms pa'i bag chags yongs @24a * //
translated: meaning from the collection of eye, etc.

original: su smin pa las sam /
analyzed: su smin pa las sam /
translated: It is thought that it arises from the complete ripening of the latent impressions of error,

original: bstan bcos las byung ba ni ma yin par bsams pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos las byung ba ni ma yin par bsams pa'o //
translated: not from the treatises.

original: 'dis ni rgyu'i stobs kyis gzugs la sogs pa snang ba de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu'i stobs kyis gzugs la sogs pa snang ba de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin gyi /
translated: This shows that the appearance of form, etc. by the power of a cause is conventional truth.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni ma yin no zhes de ston par byed do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni ma yin no zhes de ston par byed do //
translated: It is not ultimate truth.

original: ci'i phyir 'di yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is this called ‚Äúcorrect conventional truth‚Äù?

original: shes pa la snang ba dang mthun par dngos po gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: shes pa la snang ba dang mthun par dngos po gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is because things exist in accordance with their appearance to consciousness.

original: gal te de ltar na yang dag par skye ba la sogs pa yang jig  yang dag pa la kun rdzob kyi bden par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na yang dag par skye ba la sogs pa yang jig  yang dag pa la kun rdzob kyi bden par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then correct arising, etc. would not be conventional truth.

original: yang dag par skye ba la sogs pa ni mi snang ste zhes bya ba smos so ;
analyzed: yang dag par skye ba la sogs pa ni mi snang ste zhes bya ba smos so ;
translated: Correct arising, etc. do not appear.

original: / gal te mi snang na ji ltar sgro btags pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: / gal te mi snang na ji ltar sgro btags pa yin zhe na /
translated: If they do not appear, how can they be reifications?

original: ji lta bu'ang rung ba'am /
analyzed: ji lta bu'ang rung ba'am /
translated: They are reifications in whatever way,

original: grub pa'i mtha' la brten nas sgro btags pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' la brten nas sgro btags pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: or they are only reifications based on tenets.

original: ji lta bu'ang rung zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas log par yongs su brtags pa'i dbang gis te /
analyzed: ji lta bu'ang rung zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas log par yongs su brtags pa'i dbang gis te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn whatever way‚Äù means by the power of false imagination since beginningless time.

original: de ni de lta'o //
analyzed: de ni de lta'o //
translated: That is the way it is.

original: de lta ma yin na ni yang dag par skye ba la sogs pa snang bar gyur pa de dag la /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni yang dag par skye ba la sogs pa snang bar gyur pa de dag la /
translated: Otherwise, if they were to appear as real arising, etc.,

original: rtsod pa med par thal ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsod pa med par thal ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would follow that there would be no dispute at all.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba'i shes pa la snang ba'i cha la ni rtsod pa su yang med do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba'i shes pa la snang ba'i cha la ni rtsod pa su yang med do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúNo one disputes the aspect that appears in the cognition of the proponent and the opponent.‚Äù

original: gal te 'di lta bu'i cha la brgya la rtsod par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di lta bu'i cha la brgya la rtsod par byed do zhe na /
translated: If someone were to dispute such an aspect,

original: rtsod par byed na ni mngon sum la sogs pas gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rtsod par byed na ni mngon sum la sogs pas gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: then he would be refuted by perception, etc.

original: sogs pa'i bsdu bas ni rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa yongs su bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i bsdu bas ni rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa yongs su bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes inference, etc.

original: yang dag min ni kun rdzob ste kun brtags pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: yang dag min ni kun rdzob ste kun brtags pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúUnreal‚Äù means ‚Äúconventional,‚Äù and ‚Äúimagined things‚Äù is the remainder.

original: 'di dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain this, he says:

original: yang dag par skye ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yang dag par skye ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThat which is real arising, etc.‚Äù

original: de ni rtog pa'i bzos sbyar ba'o zhes bya ba 'dis bstan te /
analyzed: de ni rtog pa'i bzos sbyar ba'o zhes bya ba 'dis bstan te /
translated: He shows that ‚Äúthat is the fabrication of imagination.‚Äù

original: mig la sogs pa tshogs kyang snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa tshogs kyang snang ba ma yin te /
translated: Even though the collection of eye, etc., exists, there is no appearance.

original: de bas na de ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya'o //üîΩni zhes bya ba ni bsnan pa'i don tam /
analyzed: de bas na de ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya'o // ni zhes bya ba ni bsnan pa'i don tam /
translated: Therefore, it is called the truth of the unreal conventional.

original: kun brtags pa kho na'o zhes go rims bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa kho na'o zhes go rims bzlog pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù means ‚Äúexclusively,‚Äù or it reverses the order, ‚ÄúIt is only imagined.‚Äù

original: gal te de lta na ni zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the two moons, etc., will not be the truth of the unreal conventional.

original: nyes pa med de skabs kyis rgol ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo rnam par gcad pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa med de skabs kyis rgol ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo rnam par gcad pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no fault, because in this context the negation of the nature of the object of refutation is primary.

original: yang dag par skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa yang /
analyzed: yang dag par skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa yang /
translated: The negation of real arising, etc.,

original: jig snang ba'i @24b tshul can ma yin pa'i phyir yang dag par skye ba la sogs pa bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rdzob tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: jig snang ba'i @24b tshul can ma yin pa'i phyir yang dag par skye ba la sogs pa bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rdzob tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is not the mode of appearance of the object, it is a false conventionality, like true arising, etc.

original: ci'i phyir mi snang zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi snang zhe na /
translated: Why does it not appear?

original: de ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThat‚Äù

original: yang dag par skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa'o //
translated: refers to the negation of true arising, etc.

original: dngos po bum pa la sogs pa snang ba na mi snang ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dngos po bum pa la sogs pa snang ba na mi snang ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: When things such as pots appear, it does not appear.

original: ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: yang dag par skye ba la sogs pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: yang dag par skye ba la sogs pa bzhin du'o //
translated: Like true arising, etc.üîΩIt is not,

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mi snang zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mi snang zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: that is, it does not appear.

original: dgag pa gnyis kyis ni snang ba kho na'o zhes bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: dgag pa gnyis kyis ni snang ba kho na'o zhes bya bar bstan to //
translated: The two negations indicate that it appears.

original: ci'i phyir snang zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snang zhe na /
translated: Why does it appear?

original: dngos po'i ngo bo dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause it is not different from the entity‚Äôs nature.‚Äù

original: dngos po bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po bzhin no //
translated: It is like the entity itself.

original: ji ltar bum pa la sogs pas dben pa ni des dben pha dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs snang bar gyur na tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir snang ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa la sogs pas dben pa ni des dben pha dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs snang bar gyur na tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir snang ste /
translated: Just as a place that is devoid of pots, etc. is perceived when it is illuminated, because it is not different from the illumination,

original: 'di yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: so it is in this case as well.

original: gang gi tshe skye ba la sogs pa chos gzhan zhig yin par rtog pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe skye ba la sogs pa chos gzhan zhig yin par rtog pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one conceives of arising, etc. as being other attributes,

original: dngos po'i ngo bo dang tha dad pa ma yin par mi 'grub bo zhes brgya zhig la de skad zer du dogs pas /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo dang tha dad pa ma yin par mi 'grub bo zhes brgya zhig la de skad zer du dogs pas /
translated: then it is not established that they are not different from the nature of entities.

original: chos gzhan zhig yin par yongs su brtags na ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chos gzhan zhig yin par yongs su brtags na ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Fearing that someone might say this, he says, ‚ÄúWhen one imagines that they are other attributes,‚Äù

original: ni zhes bya ba ni bsnam pa'i don to //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni bsnam pa'i don to //
translated: the word ‚Äúna‚Äù has the sense of ‚Äúeva.‚Äù

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rdzob tu yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rdzob tu yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThey would be unreal conventionalities‚Äù

original: 'dir yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rdzob kho na'o zhes bsnan pa'i don gyi rjes su bsnyegs so //
analyzed: 'dir yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rdzob kho na'o zhes bsnan pa'i don gyi rjes su bsnyegs so //
translated: means that here also the sense of the word ‚Äúeva‚Äù is to be supplied, namely, ‚ÄúThey are unreal conventionalities.‚Äù

original: phyogs gzhan la ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kho na yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs gzhan la ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kho na yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the other side is only the correct conventional,

original: yang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, ‚Äúagain.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir de lta yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de lta yin zhe na /
translated: Why is that so?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: skye la sogs pa bkag pa yang //
analyzed: skye la sogs pa bkag pa yang //
translated: the refutation of arising, etc.

original: don dam pa yin par kho bo cag 'dod do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: don dam pa yin par kho bo cag 'dod do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: is accepted by us as being the ultimate.

original: ci lta zhe na /üîΩyang dag pa dang mthun pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ci lta zhe na / yang dag pa dang mthun pa'i phyir //
translated: How is that?

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause it is in accord with the correct.‚Äù

original: ji ltar na yang dag pa dang mthun pa kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na yang dag pa dang mthun pa kho na yin zhe na /
translated: How is it only in accord with the correct?

original: yang dag par skye ba la sogs par rtog pa'i dngos po bkag pa'i gtan tshigs kyis zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yang dag par skye ba la sogs par rtog pa'i dngos po bkag pa'i gtan tshigs kyis zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúby the reason of the refutation of things imagined as correct arising, etc.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag ni rnal 'byor spyod pa dag gis skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rnal 'byor spyod pa dag gis skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa ni /
translated: Others, however, say that the Yogacaras accept the refutation of arising, etc.

original: yang dag pa kho nar don dam par 'dzin pas yang zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag pa kho nar don dam par 'dzin pas yang zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: only as correct, and so ‚Äúagain‚Äù has the sense of including that.

original: rigs pa smra ba yang ci'i phyir de ltar mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: rigs pa smra ba yang ci'i phyir de ltar mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why do the logicians not accept that?

original: gang gi phyir skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa kun rdzob kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa kun rdzob kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the refutation of arising, etc. is only conventional.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rigs pas dpyad na zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rigs pas dpyad na zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúwhen analyzed by reason.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir kun rdzob kho na yin @25a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir kun rdzob kho na yin @25a * //
translated: Why is it only conventional?

original: zhe na / dgag bya yod pa ma yin pas //
analyzed: zhe na / dgag bya yod pa ma yin pas //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause the object of refutation does not exist.‚Äù

original: yang dag tu na bkag med bsal //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yang dag tu na bkag med bsal // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In reality, there is no refutation.

original: de rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir dgag bya med na bkag pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir dgag bya med na bkag pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to explain that, he says, ‚Äúbecause if the object of refutation does not exist, the refutation does not occur.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir dgag bya med na bkag pa mi 'jug ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dgag bya med na bkag pa mi 'jug ce na /
translated: Why is it that if the object of refutation does not exist, the refutation does not occur?

original: yul med pa'i bkag pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yul med pa'i bkag pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause it is illogical for a refutation to occur without an object.‚Äù

original: yul med na bkag pa mi rung ba ni bden na 'di la ni yul yod de /
analyzed: yul med na bkag pa mi rung ba ni bden na 'di la ni yul yod de /
translated: If there is no object, a refutation is impossible. But in this case, the object does exist.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa la skye ba la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu can pha rol pos /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa la skye ba la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu can pha rol pos /
translated: The opponent imagines that form, etc. have arising, etc.

original: dngos po yang dag pa nyid du brtags pa gang yin pa de dgag bya nyid yin no zhe na zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dngos po yang dag pa nyid du brtags pa gang yin pa de dgag bya nyid yin no zhe na zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If you say that the entity that is imagined to be real is the very object of refutation,

original: 'di ni de lta bu yin par rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni de lta bu yin par rtogs par bya ste /
translated: then this is how you should understand it.

original: 'di ltar gzhan zhig na bum pa la sogs pa med par sgrub na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan zhig na bum pa la sogs pa med par sgrub na /
translated: For if one establishes that a pot, etc. does not exist,

original: der rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu can gyi dngos po bkag pa nyid kyis grub ste /
analyzed: der rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu can gyi dngos po bkag pa nyid kyis grub ste /
translated: then by the mere negation of the entity that is the cause of the conception, it is established,

original: gzhan ni mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not reasonable to do otherwise.üîΩThis is refuted by the following:

original: 'di ni gal te de lta na //
analyzed: 'di ni gal te de lta na //
translated: If it is so,

original: brtags pa'i rang gi ngo bo yi //
analyzed: brtags pa'i rang gi ngo bo yi //
translated: then the negation of the imagined intrinsic reality

original: bkag pa brtags min ji ltar 'gyur ;üîΩ/ zhes bya bas 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: bkag pa brtags min ji ltar 'gyur ; / zhes bya bas 'gog par byed do //
translated: would not be non-imagined.

original: ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya bas ni mi srid pa ste brtags pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya bas ni mi srid pa ste brtags pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase how could it be? means it is impossible, that is, it is only imagined.

original: de nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dgag bya brtags pa yin du zin na /
analyzed: dgag bya brtags pa yin du zin na /
translated: If the object of negation is imagined,

original: bkag pa yang brtags pa nyid du 'gyur te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bkag pa yang brtags pa nyid du 'gyur te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: then the negation would also be imagined.

original: ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: mo gsham gyi bu'i sngo bsangs nyid la sogs pa bkag pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu'i sngo bsangs nyid la sogs pa bkag pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is like the refutation of the blueness of the son of a barren woman.

original: gal te skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa yang dag par med na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa yang dag par med na /
translated: If the refutation of arising and so on is not real,üîΩthen it would be necessary to say that arising and so on exist.

original: skye ba la sogs pa yod par 'gyur ro zhes brgyal smra bar 'gyur du dogs nas /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa yod par 'gyur ro zhes brgyal smra bar 'gyur du dogs nas /
translated: Fearing that this would be the case, he says,

original: yang dag par bkag pa med kyang /
analyzed: yang dag par bkag pa med kyang /
translated: ‚ÄúEven though there is no real refutation,

original: skye ba la sogs pa yod par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa yod par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: arising and so on do not exist.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: bkag pas skye ba med pa la sogs pa lam khyab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bkag pas skye ba med pa la sogs pa lam khyab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause the refutation does not pervade the absence of arising and so on.‚Äù

original: bkag pas skye ba la sogs pa bkag pas skye ba med pa la sogs pa la ma khyab pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang gi phyir bkag pa med pa gang gis skye ba la sogs pa'i bkag pa ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bkag pas skye ba la sogs pa bkag pas skye ba med pa la sogs pa la ma khyab pa'i phyir ro // gang gi phyir bkag pa med pa gang gis skye ba la sogs pa'i bkag pa ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: The refutation does not pervade the absence of arising and so on because the refutation of arising and so on refutes arising and so on.üîΩBecause of what?

original: skye ba med pa la sogs pa ldog par 'gyur ba gang gis skye ba la sogs pa yod par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: skye ba med pa la sogs pa ldog par 'gyur ba gang gis skye ba la sogs pa yod par 'gyur ba /
translated: By what means would the refutation be reversed, by means of which the absence of arising and so on would be reversed, by means of which arising and so on would exist?

original: gang na skye ba med pa la sogs pa yod pa de na /
analyzed: gang na skye ba med pa la sogs pa yod pa de na /
translated: Where there is non-arising, etc.,

original: skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa yod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa yod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: there is the negation of arising, etc., but not the existence of non-arising, etc.

original: 'on kyang skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas so //
translated: However, non-arising, etc. exist by way of their intrinsic reality.

original: gang gis skye ba la sogs pa med pa nges na /
analyzed: gang gis skye ba la sogs pa med pa nges na /
translated: If one ascertains that there is no arising, etc.,

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i bkag pa yang yod cing /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i bkag pa yang yod cing /
translated: then the negation of arising, etc. also exists.üîΩIf that does not exist, then arising, etc. would exist.

original: de @25b med na skye ba la sogs pa yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gis lugs 'di ni 'gal ba yang yin te /
analyzed: de @25b med na skye ba la sogs pa yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gis lugs 'di ni 'gal ba yang yin te /
translated: This system is also contradictory because of the words,

original: de lta na ni mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa yang yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa yang yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and in that case it follows that the son of a barren woman, etc. would also exist.

original: snon bya ba'i phyir de yod pa'i rigs pa med pa'i yang phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: snon bya ba'i phyir de yod pa'i rigs pa med pa'i yang phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to add to that, he says, ‚Äúbecause there is no logic for the existence of that.‚Äù

original: de yod par zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa yod par te rigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod par zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa yod par te rigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe existence of that‚Äù means the existence of arising, etc.

original: ji ltar rigs pa med pa de ltar ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa med pa de ltar ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: The lack of logic will be explained below.

original: de ltar don bsgrubs nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar don bsgrubs nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus established the meaning, he concludes:

original: de bas 'di ni kun rdzob ste //
analyzed: de bas 'di ni kun rdzob ste //
translated: Therefore, this is the superficial,

original: yang dag par na skye ba med //
analyzed: yang dag par na skye ba med //
translated: but in reality there is no origination.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: yang dag don yin yang dag min //
analyzed: yang dag don yin yang dag min //
translated: The reality is not the reality,

original: yang dag pa'i don zhes bya bar bsnyegs so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don zhes bya bar bsnyegs so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: but is called the reality.

original: ci'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir / yang dag nyid du gnyis med de //
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin zhe na / de'i phyir / yang dag nyid du gnyis med de //
translated: Why is it not the reality?üîΩTherefore he says:

original: zhes bya ba smos te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te //
translated: In reality there is no duality.

original: gnyis ni skye ba la sogs pa dang / skye ba med pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis ni skye ba la sogs pa dang / skye ba med pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Duality is origination, etc. and non-origination, etc.

original: don 'di lung dang sbyar ba'i phyir //
analyzed: don 'di lung dang sbyar ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate this meaning with a scriptural citation, he says:

original: de nyid phyir na de stong min ;
analyzed: de nyid phyir na de stong min ;
translated: Therefore, it is not empty,

original: / mi stong ma yin yod med min //
analyzed: / mi stong ma yin yod med min //
translated: not non-empty, not existent, not non-existent,

original: mi skye ma yin skye min zhes //
analyzed: mi skye ma yin skye min zhes //
translated: not originated, not unoriginated, and so on.

original: de la sogs pa bcom ldan gsungs //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de la sogs pa bcom ldan gsungs // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The Lord has declared this.

original: stong pa ma yin pa ni yang dag par na dgag bya med pas bkag pa yang med par gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa ma yin pa ni yang dag par na dgag bya med pas bkag pa yang med par gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not empty because in reality the negatee is absent, and so the negation is also absent.

original: mi stong pa ma yin pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: mi stong pa ma yin pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: are refuted by such passages as:

original: du mas dngos po gcig mi byed //üîΩces bya ba la sogs pas bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du mas dngos po gcig mi byed // ces bya ba la sogs pas bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúMany do not make one thing.

original: ci'i phyir yang dag par na gnyis med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang dag par na gnyis med ce na /
translated: Why is it non-dual in reality?

original: de ni spros pa med pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni spros pa med pa yin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is free from fabrication.üîΩThe remainder is:

original: de kho na zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de kho na zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: That is reality.

original: de ni de kho na ni rtog pa'i dra ba thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes bya bas rnam par 'grel to //
analyzed: de ni de kho na ni rtog pa'i dra ba thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes bya bas rnam par 'grel to //
translated: It is free from the net of all conceptualization.

original: de'i phyir 'dir spros pa ni rtog pa'i dra ba yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir spros pa ni rtog pa'i dra ba yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, here fabrication is said to be the net of conceptualization.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na spros pa ni ngag gi rgyu ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na spros pa ni ngag gi rgyu ba ste /
translated: In one sense, fabrication is the movement of speech,

original: de yang rtog pa'i dra bas kun nas bslang ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang rtog pa'i dra bas kun nas bslang ba yin no //
translated: and that is motivated by the net of conceptualization.

original: de'i phyir kun nas slong ba po med na /
analyzed: de'i phyir kun nas slong ba po med na /
translated: Therefore, when there is no motivator,

original: bslang bar bya ba'i spros pa yang med par ston te /
analyzed: bslang bar bya ba'i spros pa yang med par ston te /
translated: it is shown that the fabricated, which is to be motivated, does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar ngag gi spyod yul las 'das pa yang dag pa yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar ngag gi spyod yul las 'das pa yang dag pa yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since that is so, the real is beyond the domain of speech.

original: 'jam dpal gyis ni yang dag dris //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis ni yang dag dris //
translated: Manjusri asked the question

original: rgyal ba'i sras po mi gsung bzhugs //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras po mi gsung bzhugs //
translated: And the Conqueror's son sat in silence.

original: zhes bya ba smos te go sla'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of this verse is selfevident.

original: chos kyi sgo gang la skye ba dang mi skye ba la sogs pa gnyis med pa de ni gnyis med pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sgo gang la skye ba dang mi skye ba la sogs pa gnyis med pa de ni gnyis med pa'o //
translated: The Dharma door in which birth and nonbirth, etc.

original: de ni gnyis med pa yang yin la /üîΩstobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa @26a * //
analyzed: de ni gnyis med pa yang yin la / stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa @26a * //
translated: are not dual is nonduality.

original: la sogs pa chos rnams kyi sgo yang yin te /
analyzed: la sogs pa chos rnams kyi sgo yang yin te /
translated: It is nonduality and it is the door of the dharmas, such as the ten powers and the fearlessnesses,

original: de ni de dag rtogs pa 'byung ba'i sgo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni de dag rtogs pa 'byung ba'i sgo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is the door through which they arise.

original: de bstan zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bstan zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The word teaching is to be supplied.

original: gnyis med pa la 'jug pa ni cang mi smra ba nyid de /
analyzed: gnyis med pa la 'jug pa ni cang mi smra ba nyid de /
translated: Entry into nonduality is silence,

original: 'dis 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes entry into that.

original: gnyis su med pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that nonduality?üîΩIt is that in which there is no engagement of letters, speech, or indication.

original: gang la yi ge dang skad dang rnam par rig byed 'jug pa med pa zhes bya ba ste yi ge ni tshig 'bru'o //üîΩskad ni tshig go //
analyzed: gang la yi ge dang skad dang rnam par rig byed 'jug pa med pa zhes bya ba ste yi ge ni tshig 'bru'o // skad ni tshig go //
translated: Letters are syllables.

original: rnam par rig byed ni ngag ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ni ngag ste /
translated: Speech is a collection of syllables.üîΩIndication is the expression of meaning by speech.

original: don rnam par rig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don rnam par rig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes the object to be cognized.

original: de'i phyir de nyid don go bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid don go bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, that alone causes the object to be understood,

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the other.

original: 'di ni tshig so sor phral ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshig so sor phral ba'o //
translated: This is the analysis of the words.

original: gang gi phyir rnam pa 'di ltar yang srid de /üîΩskad de ni yi ge sngon du 'gro ba yang yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam pa 'di ltar yang srid de / skad de ni yi ge sngon du 'gro ba yang yin la /
translated: Because it is possible in this way,

original: skad kyang yin pas yi ge'i skad do ;üîΩ/ rnam par rig byed ni de gnyis sngon du 'gro ba yang yin la rnam par rig byed kyang yin te /
analyzed: skad kyang yin pas yi ge'i skad do ; / rnam par rig byed ni de gnyis sngon du 'gro ba yang yin la rnam par rig byed kyang yin te /
translated: that speech is preceded by syllables and it is speech, therefore it is the speech of syllables.üîΩV

original: de'i phyir yi she'i skad kyi rnam par rig byed de //
analyzed: de'i phyir yi she'i skad kyi rnam par rig byed de //
translated: ocalic is preceded by those two and it is vocalic, therefore it is the vocalic of syllables.

original: 'di lta bu de kho na yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu de kho na yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this is the way it should be understood.

original: gal te de gnyis las dben pa gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo de kho na yin du zin na de'i tshe de mi rigs te /
analyzed: gal te de gnyis las dben pa gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo de kho na yin du zin na de'i tshe de mi rigs te /
translated: If that which is separate from those two is the dependent nature, then at that time it is not reasonable.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / gnyis po dag las dben pa'i dngos //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gnyis po dag las dben pa'i dngos //
translated: The entity that is separate from the two

original: gzhan dbang dngos po yang dag na //
analyzed: gzhan dbang dngos po yang dag na //
translated: Is the dependent entity.üîΩIf it is asked why,

original: dris na ci phyir rgyal ba'i sras //
analyzed: dris na ci phyir rgyal ba'i sras //
translated: The victors‚Äô heirs

original: de ni mi gsung bzhugs par gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni mi gsung bzhugs par gyur // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He remained silent.

original: gnyis po ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis po ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The two are the apprehended object and the apprehending subject.

original: rgyu rkyen gzhan dag gis dbang byed cing bskyed par bya ba yin pas gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen gzhan dag gis dbang byed cing bskyed par bya ba yin pas gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
translated: Since it is generated and controlled by other causes and conditions, it is dependent on other things.

original: ci'i phyir cang mi gsung ba mi rigs snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir cang mi gsung ba mi rigs snyam pa la /
translated: Why is it not proper for him to remain silent?

original: brda shes rigs pa shes pa yi //
analyzed: brda shes rigs pa shes pa yi //
translated: People who know the language and know logic

original: skye bo dag ni ji ltar yang //
analyzed: skye bo dag ni ji ltar yang //
translated: will in some way

original: rang gi rtogs pa rjod byed de //üîΩde bas mi gsung mi rigs so //
analyzed: rang gi rtogs pa rjod byed de // de bas mi gsung mi rigs so //
translated: express their understanding.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is not proper for him to remain silent.

original: rang gi rtogs pa brjod pa ji ltar yang kun rdzob tu rjod par byed do zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang gi rtogs pa brjod pa ji ltar yang kun rdzob tu rjod par byed do zhes sbyar ro //
translated: One should add, ‚ÄúThey express their understanding in some way conventionally.‚Äù

original: su dag gis she na /
analyzed: su dag gis she na /
translated: By whom?

original: brda shes pa dag ces bya ba smos pa ste /
analyzed: brda shes pa dag ces bya ba smos pa ste /
translated: It says, ‚Äúby those who know the language.‚Äù

original: mi dag gis so //
analyzed: mi dag gis so //
translated: By people.

original: ji lta bu dag gis she na /üîΩrigs pa shes pa dag gis te /
analyzed: ji lta bu dag gis she na / rigs pa shes pa dag gis te /
translated: In what way?üîΩBy those who know logic.

original: khong du chud par byed pa la mkhas pa dag gis so //
analyzed: khong du chud par byed pa la mkhas pa dag gis so //
translated: By those who are skilled in understanding.

original: lhag ma ni brda phrad sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni brda phrad sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: The rest is easy to understand and so is not explained.

original: gal te kun rdzob kyi bsnyad pas kyang brjod par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob kyi bsnyad pas kyang brjod par mi nus so zhe na /
translated: If it cannot be expressed even by the conventions of the relative,

original: gal te de lta min na kun rdzob kyi bsnyad pas kyang brjod par mi nus pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de lta min na kun rdzob kyi bsnyad pas kyang brjod par mi nus pa de'i tshe /
translated: then, if it is not like that, it cannot be expressed even by the conventions of the relative.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid mthar phyin pa nyid kyis gang brjod pa ci dag gi zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid mthar phyin pa nyid kyis gang brjod pa ci dag gi zhe na /
translated: At that time, what is expressed by the ultimate itself, which is the finality of intrinsic identity?

original: sgra rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sgra rnams kyi'o //
translated: The sounds.

original: su dag gis she na /
analyzed: su dag gis she na /
translated: Whose sounds?

original: rigs pa smra ba dag gis te slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rigs pa smra ba dag gis te slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po la sogs pas so //
translated: The sounds of the logicians, the Acaryas Dignaga and so on.üîΩPlease state clearly how that can be logical.

original: de ji ltar rigs par 'gyur ba gsal bar smros shig / gal te rang gi ngo bos bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: de ji ltar rigs par 'gyur ba gsal bar smros shig / gal te rang gi ngo bos bstan par mi nus te /
translated: If you say that it cannot be taught by intrinsic objectivity,
