original: brgya zhig la rtogs pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid 'bras bu thams cad rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rgyu thams cad las skye bar khas blangs na ji skad smos pa'i nyes pa 'di med do zhes smra bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: brgya zhig la rtogs pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid 'bras bu thams cad rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rgyu thams cad las skye bar khas blangs na ji skad smos pa'i nyes pa 'di med do zhes smra bar 'gyur bas /
translated: If one were to assert that all effects, such as the cognition of form and so on, arise from all causes, such as consciousness and so on, then the fault stated above would not occur.

original: kun nas thams cad skye na ni //
analyzed: kun nas thams cad skye na ni //
translated: If everything arises from everything,üîΩthen the proof of difference and nondifferenceüîΩwould be erroneous.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩrig pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / rig pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas smras te /
translated: This is stated following the VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´yas.

original: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa ni /
translated: The proof of difference and nondifference

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag 'khrul pa nyid du ston pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag 'khrul pa nyid du ston pa yin no //
translated: demonstrates that the forward and reverse pervasions are erroneous.

original: ji ste @32a * //
analyzed: ji ste @32a * //

analyzed: gal te ji skad smos pa'i nyes pa thog tu bab pas phyogs snga ma 'di ni dor bar bya ba yin gyi /

analyzed: 'di skad du rang gi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la brten par bya'o zhes smra'o snyam na /
translated: If you think that this is to be based on the statement, ‚ÄúIn accordance with the specific nature of the thing itself,‚Äù etc.,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says:

original: gal te bye brag rkyen rnams las //
analyzed: gal te bye brag rkyen rnams las //
translated: If the specific is from conditions,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //

analyzed: re re ni skyed par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //

original: dngos po rnams 'ga' zhig rtog pa sngon du btang nas /

analyzed: 'di la gcig gis kyang nus kyi /

analyzed: 'dir bdag ci dgos zhes te gzhan ldog pa med do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de yang khyed 'dod de /

analyzed: rgyu'i byed pa bye brag rnams la nye bar sbyor ba byas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the activity of the cause is applied to the specific,

original: 'dis ni snon bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni snon bstan to //

analyzed: ji ste ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pa yongs su spong bar 'dod nas /

analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa med bzhin du yang 'bras bu @32b tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: 'dis ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag 'khrul par ston to //
translated: This shows that the proof of difference or non-difference, i.e., the positive and negative concomitances, are erroneous.

analyzed: gal te gang gis 'bras bu gcig byed pa de las bdag nyid kyi khyad par gzhan gyis 'bras bu gzhan byed do zhe na zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: If you say that the same thing produces a different effect by a difference in its own nature, then

original: 'o na ni dngos po de gcig pur mi 'gyur te /üîΩbdag nyid kyi khyad par las tha dad pa med pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na ni dngos po de gcig pur mi 'gyur te / bdag nyid kyi khyad par las tha dad pa med pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: that thing is not one,üîΩbecause it is not without a difference from its own nature.

original: bdag nyid kyi khyad par med par ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi khyad par med par ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is not without a difference in its own nature, just as it is not without a difference in its own nature.

original: gal te rgyu gcig gis 'bras bu gcig kho na byed du zad mod ce na zhes bya bas ni phyogs bzhi pa la brten par byed do //
analyzed: gal te rgyu gcig gis 'bras bu gcig kho na byed du zad mod ce na zhes bya bas ni phyogs bzhi pa la brten par byed do //
translated: If you say that a single cause produces only a single effect, then

original: de lta ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: de lta ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'gog par byed do //
translated: this is not so, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'gro ba thams cad long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: because it would follow that all beings would be blind, deaf, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa rang gi rigs dang mthun pa'i skad cig skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rang gi rigs dang mthun pa'i skad cig skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because the eye, etc. generate moments of their own type,

original: rang gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rang gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: it is not the case that they generate their own consciousness.

original: de lta yin na rnam par shes pa med na long ba dang / 'on pa dang / dri mi tshor ba dang / ro mi myong ba dang / reg mi tshor ba'i dngos por gsal bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na rnam par shes pa med na long ba dang / 'on pa dang / dri mi tshor ba dang / ro mi myong ba dang / reg mi tshor ba'i dngos por gsal bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it is clear that the consequence would be that without consciousness, there would be the things of blindness, deafness, the inability to smell odors, the inability to taste tastes, and the inability to feel tactile objects.

original: ji ste rang gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa nyid du khas len na /
analyzed: ji ste rang gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa nyid du khas len na /
translated: If you accept that they generate their own consciousness,

original: de lta yin na ni sngar bshad pa'i nyes pa ni med mod kyi /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni sngar bshad pa'i nyes pa ni med mod kyi /
translated: then although the previously explained error does not occur,

original: nyes pa gzhan yod pas bshad pa /
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan yod pas bshad pa /
translated: another error does occur, as is explained.

original: rang gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid yin par khas len na ni rang gi rigs 'chad de /
analyzed: rang gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid yin par khas len na ni rang gi rigs 'chad de /
translated: If you accept that they generate their own consciousness, then the error arises that their own type would be interrupted.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rigs 'chad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rigs 'chad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the eye and so on are explained as a class.

original: de bas de lta bas na cir yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bas de lta bas na cir yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable in any way.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes pa'i skad cig phyin chad mig la sogs pa yang med la /
analyzed: shes pa'i skad cig phyin chad mig la sogs pa yang med la /
translated: Because after the moment of consciousness, the eye and so on do not exist,

original: rnam par shes pa yang med pas cir yang mi rung ngo zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang med pas cir yang mi rung ngo zhes bshad do //
translated: and consciousness also does not exist. Therefore, it is not suitable in any way.

original: rgyu gcig gis 'bras bu gcig skyed par byed do zhes bya ba khas mi len mod kyi brgya zhig la pha rol po re thag chad par gyur pa de skad smra bar 'gyur bas kho bo cag gis de'i tshig 'jug pa la gnod pa byas so snyam du
analyzed: rgyu gcig gis 'bras bu gcig skyed par byed do zhes bya ba khas mi len mod kyi brgya zhig la pha rol po re thag chad par gyur pa de skad smra bar 'gyur bas kho bo cag gis de'i tshig 'jug pa la gnod pa byas so snyam du
translated: Although we do not accept that a single cause produces a single effect, since the opponent might say that in some cases he is desperate, we have refuted the application of his words.üîΩThis is the thought.

original: bsams pa'o // de lta min na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsams pa'o // de lta min na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Otherwise,

original: de lta ma yin pa ni 'gro ba gzhal bya yang yin la /
analyzed: de lta ma yin pa ni 'gro ba gzhal bya yang yin la /
translated: if it were not so, then the world would be an object of knowledge

original: dbang phyug byed pa po yang yin na 'di la 'gal ba ci yod ces bya ba 'di'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug byed pa po yang yin na 'di la 'gal ba ci yod ces bya ba 'di'o //
translated: and God would be the agent. What contradiction would there be in this?

original: gzhal bya nyid //
analyzed: gzhal bya nyid //
translated: It would be an object of knowledge.

original: la sogs ye med kho nar 'gyur //
analyzed: la sogs ye med kho nar 'gyur //
translated: And so on, it would be absolutely nonexistent.

original: zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug byed pa po nyid yin na rgyu nye pa @33a * //üîΩkho na las 'gro ba skye ba'i phyir 'di ni gzhal bya yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid mi srid de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug byed pa po nyid yin na rgyu nye pa @33a * // kho na las 'gro ba skye ba'i phyir 'di ni gzhal bya yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid mi srid de /
translated: If ƒ™≈õvara were the agent, it would be impossible to say that the worldüîΩarises from a cause that is merely near, and that this is the object ofüîΩcomprehension.

original: dus cig car ba rnams kyi yongs su gcad par bya ba dang / yongs su gcod par byed pa'i dngos po mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus cig car ba rnams kyi yongs su gcad par bya ba dang / yongs su gcod par byed pa'i dngos po mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If ƒ™≈õvara were the agent, then this very fact that the world arises from only a proximate cause would be impossible, because the state of being the object of awareness and the means of awareness would be untenable for those that exist simultaneously.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa la sogs pa yongs su bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa la sogs pa yongs su bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the produced and the producer, and so on.

original: rnam pa mang por mdzad ces bya ba ni bdag las ma yin gzhan las ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa mang por mdzad ces bya ba ni bdag las ma yin gzhan las ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn many ways‚Äù refers to ‚Äúnot from self, not from another,‚Äù and so on.üîΩIn the same way, the refutation of arising is ‚Äúnot from self, not from another,‚Äù and so on.

original: de bzhin du skye ba 'gog par byed pa bdag las gzhan las zhes brtags pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu can la yin na ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba 'gog par byed pa bdag las gzhan las zhes brtags pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu can la yin na ni /
translated: If it is the cause of the imputation of the convention,

original: 'di grub pa sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'di grub pa sgrub pa'o //
translated: then this is the proof of the established conclusion.

original: de lta na gang las skye ba de bdag las gzhan las zhes tha snyad gdags par mi nus te /
analyzed: de lta na gang las skye ba de bdag las gzhan las zhes tha snyad gdags par mi nus te /
translated: Thus, it is not possible to designate that from which something arises as other than itself.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni ngag gi rgyu las 'das nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni ngag gi rgyu las 'das nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the intrinsic identity of a thing transcends the cause of speech and engages in the activity of arising.

original: gang yang gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pas tha snyad 'dogs pa de ni rtog pas nye bar bkod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang yang gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pas tha snyad 'dogs pa de ni rtog pas nye bar bkod pa yin te /
translated: And that which is designated as other, etc., is merely posited by conceptual thought.

original: de'i phyir de las mi skye'o zhes bya ba smra ba ni gsal ba kho nar grub pa sgrub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de las mi skye'o zhes bya ba smra ba ni gsal ba kho nar grub pa sgrub pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the statement, ‚ÄúIt does not arise from that,‚Äù is the mere establishment of what has already been established.

original: 'di ltar rgyu med dngos med pas //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu med dngos med pas //
translated: In the same way, the statement, ‚ÄúBecause there is no entity without a cause,‚Äù etc., is the mere establishment of what has already been established.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po rang gi sgo kho na nas len 'debs su 'jug par rim pa 'god par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po rang gi sgo kho na nas len 'debs su 'jug par rim pa 'god par byed pa'o //
translated: In this way, he makes the opponent accept the order of the argument by means of his own door.

original: ci s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pa de myu gu la sogs pa 'bras bu las gzhan nam /
analyzed: ci s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pa de myu gu la sogs pa 'bras bu las gzhan nam /
translated: In this regard, is the seed of rice, etc., different from the effect, the sprout, etc.?

original: 'on te sa bon la sogs pa de nyid myu gu la sogs pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te sa bon la sogs pa de nyid myu gu la sogs pa yin /
translated: Or is the seed of rice, etc., itself the sprout, etc.?

original: ci'i phyir rtog pa 'di gnyis kho na byed snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rtog pa 'di gnyis kho na byed snyam pa la /
translated: Why are only these two alternatives imagined?

original: phan tshun log pa'i lus la ni //
analyzed: phan tshun log pa'i lus la ni //
translated: But in a body that is mutually inverted,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so on.

original: rnam pa gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIn another way‚Äù means

original: sa bon las myu gu la sogs pa gzhan yang yin la /
analyzed: sa bon las myu gu la sogs pa gzhan yang yin la /
translated: that the sprout is different from the seed,

original: gzhan ma yin pa gang yin pa dang / gzhan yang ma yin gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ste 'di ni 'gal bas mi srid do //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa gang yin pa dang / gzhan yang ma yin gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ste 'di ni 'gal bas mi srid do //
translated: and it is not different, and it is not both different and not different. This is impossible because of contradiction.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni ngag gi spyod yul las 'das pa'i phyir brjod par mi nus zhes smra'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni ngag gi spyod yul las 'das pa'i phyir brjod par mi nus zhes smra'o //
translated: The specific characteristic cannot be expressed because it is beyond the range of speech.

original: lam gzhan ni brjod pa'i kun rdzob po //
analyzed: lam gzhan ni brjod pa'i kun rdzob po //
translated: The other path is the conventional that is expressed.

original: legs zhes bya ba ni lam gzhan gyi bye brag gam bya ba'i bye brag go //
analyzed: legs zhes bya ba ni lam gzhan gyi bye brag gam bya ba'i bye brag go //
translated: ‚ÄúGood‚Äù means the specific characteristic of the path or the specific activity of the path.

original: ji ltar tha snyad kyi rjes su mthun par bum pa snam bu zhes bya ba la sogs par bsnyad par nus pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar tha snyad kyi rjes su mthun par bum pa snam bu zhes bya ba la sogs par bsnyad par nus pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as it is possible to designate a pot, a cloth, and so on in accordance with convention,

original: sa bon la sogs pa las myu gu la sogs pa gzhan nam gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di yang bsnyad par nus par gnang ngo //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa las myu gu la sogs pa gzhan nam gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di yang bsnyad par nus par gnang ngo //
translated: It is also possible to say that the sprout is different or not different from the seed, etc.

original: de lta ma yin te rnam pa thams @33b cad du brjod par bya ba ma yin na ni /üîΩmi smra thug ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te rnam pa thams @33b cad du brjod par bya ba ma yin na ni / mi smra thug ste /
translated: If it were not so, if it were not at all expressible,üîΩthen it would be like a mute,

original: 'di ltar phyed rgas pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyed rgas pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: and it would not be right to say that it is half-dead.

original: ji ste sa bon la sogs pa dang myu gu la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa'i phyogs gnyis kyi nang nas 'ga' phyogs gsum pa zhig brjod na /
analyzed: ji ste sa bon la sogs pa dang myu gu la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa'i phyogs gnyis kyi nang nas 'ga' phyogs gsum pa zhig brjod na /
translated: If one were to say that the sprout is different or not different from the seed, etc.,üîΩwe would refute that very thing,

original: de nyid kho bo cag gis dgag / de bas de lta bas na de lta yin na ni /
analyzed: de nyid kho bo cag gis dgag / de bas de lta bas na de lta yin na ni /
translated: so it is like that.

original: pha rol gyis khas blangs pa 'gog pa yin na /
analyzed: pha rol gyis khas blangs pa 'gog pa yin na /
translated: If it is so, then it is the opponent‚Äôs assertion that is refuted,

original: rtsod pa la bzo ba ga la yin /
analyzed: rtsod pa la bzo ba ga la yin /
translated: so how can it be a debate?üîΩHow can you be skilled in debate? You cannot be!

original: khyod rtsod pa la mkhas pa ga la yin te ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyod rtsod pa la mkhas pa ga la yin te ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: 'di skad du dbu ma pa ni byas shi 'gog pa smra ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di skad du dbu ma pa ni byas shi 'gog pa smra ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is said that the MƒÅdhyamika is not one who advocates the refutation of what is created.

original: 'on kyang pha rol pos phyogs gang khas len pa de kho na 'gog pa smra'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang pha rol pos phyogs gang khas len pa de kho na 'gog pa smra'o //
translated: But we refute only what the opponent accepts.

original: ji ste pha rol po phyogs 'ga' yang khas mi len na ni /
analyzed: ji ste pha rol po phyogs 'ga' yang khas mi len na ni /
translated: If the opponent does not accept anything,

original: dbu ma pa 'gog pa yang ci yang mi smra ba nyid do //
analyzed: dbu ma pa 'gog pa yang ci yang mi smra ba nyid do //
translated: then the Madhyamika does not say anything to refute him.

original: de lta yin na bdag las skye gzhan las skye zhes bya ba de lta bu ni pha rol po kho nas smras kyi /
analyzed: de lta yin na bdag las skye gzhan las skye zhes bya ba de lta bu ni pha rol po kho nas smras kyi /
translated: In that case, the statement ‚Äúarising from self or arising from other‚Äù is something that the opponent himself says,

original: slob dpon gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not something the Acarya says.

original: slob dpon ni ma yin no zhes dgag pa tsam 'chad par zad pas nyes pa ci yang med do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon ni ma yin no zhes dgag pa tsam 'chad par zad pas nyes pa ci yang med do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The Acarya explains only the refutation, ‚ÄúIt is not so.‚Äù Therefore there is no fault.

original: ma zhig pa las 'bras skye na //
analyzed: ma zhig pa las 'bras skye na //
translated: If the effect arises from the non-disintegrated cause,

original: de tshem zhig pa'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: de tshem zhig pa'i gnas skabs na /
translated: then at the time of the non-disintegration of the cause,

original: ci'i phyir 'bras bu med /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'bras bu med /
translated: why is there no effect?

original: gal te yod na ni de'i tshe 'bras bu dang rgyu gnyis cig car yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yod na ni de'i tshe 'bras bu dang rgyu gnyis cig car yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is, then it follows that cause and effect would be simultaneous.

original: de lta na yang de gnyis kyi rang gi ngo bo nyams par thal ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang de gnyis kyi rang gi ngo bo nyams par thal ba yin no //
translated: Even if that were so, it would follow that the nature of the two would be impaired.

original: zhig nas 'bras bu skye na ni de tshe rgyu gang las 'bras bur 'gyur /
analyzed: zhig nas 'bras bu skye na ni de tshe rgyu gang las 'bras bur 'gyur /
translated: If the effect arises after the cause has disintegrated, from what cause would the effect arise?

original: 'di ltar re zhig 'bras bu 'di rgyu zhig pa las ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig 'bras bu 'di rgyu zhig pa las ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, first, the effect does not arise from the cause that has disintegrated,

original: de nus par brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nus par brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is an entity devoid of all expression of potentiality.

original: rgyu gzhan yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there another cause,

original: de la yang mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the same consequence would apply to that.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu rgyu med pa can kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu rgyu med pa can kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the effect would arise without a cause,

original: yang na ni med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ni med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: or it would not exist at all.

original: ji ste bdag nyid kyis rang dags rgyu ma 'gags pa yod pa las 'bras bu skye'o zhes bya ba de lta bur rtog par byed na /
analyzed: ji ste bdag nyid kyis rang dags rgyu ma 'gags pa yod pa las 'bras bu skye'o zhes bya ba de lta bur rtog par byed na /
translated: But if you imagine that the effect arises from the cause that exists through its own power without having ceased,

original: de la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dus mnyam pa nyid kho na dang 'brel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dus mnyam pa nyid kho na dang 'brel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the cause and effect would be related only if they were simultaneous.

original: gal te yang rgyu'i lus ni 'jig pas zin la /
analyzed: gal te yang rgyu'i lus ni 'jig pas zin la /
translated: Moreover, if the body of the cause is pervaded by disintegration,

original: 'bras bu ni skye bas zin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni skye bas zin te /
translated: and the effect is pervaded by arising,

original: rgyu 'jig pa na mjug thogs kho nar 'bras bu skye la /
analyzed: rgyu 'jig pa na mjug thogs kho nar 'bras bu skye la /
translated: When the cause is destroyed, the effect arises immediately after.

original: bar na bar du gcod par byed pa'i dus ci yang med pas /
analyzed: bar na bar du gcod par byed pa'i dus ci yang med pas /
translated: There is no time in between when something interrupts.

original: de'i phyir rgyu ma 'gags pa'i mjug thogs kho nar 'bras bu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu ma 'gags pa'i mjug thogs kho nar 'bras bu 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the effect arises immediately after the cause has ceased.

original: gang gi phyir skad @34a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skad @34a * //
translated: Why?

original: cig ma dang po la ni rgyu /
analyzed: cig ma dang po la ni rgyu /
translated: In the first moment, there is the cause.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la ni 'bras bu skye ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la ni 'bras bu skye ste /
translated: In the second moment, the effect arises.

original: de lta yin na ni ma zhig pa las skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni ma zhig pa las skye ba yin no //
translated: If that were so, then it would arise from what has not ceased.

original: 'di ltar mjug thogs su yod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mjug thogs su yod pa yin la /
translated: In this way, it exists immediately after,

original: de yang ma zhig pa kho na las 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang ma zhig pa kho na las 'byung ba yin no //
translated: and that arises only from what has not ceased.

original: de lta ma yin na skad cig gsum pa la 'bras bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na skad cig gsum pa la 'bras bur 'gyur te /
translated: If it were otherwise, the effect would occur in the third moment.

original: skad cig dang po la ni rgyu yod pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig dang po la ni rgyu yod pa'o //
translated: In the first moment, the cause exists.

original: gnyis pa la ni 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni 'jig pa'o //
translated: In the second moment, it is destroyed.

original: zhig nas ni 'bras bu skyed de skyes ma thag tu ni 'bras bu yod pa yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: zhig nas ni 'bras bu skyed de skyes ma thag tu ni 'bras bu yod pa yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that after it has ceased, the effect arises, and immediately after it arises, the effect exists,

original: 'di yang rigs pas 'brel pa nyams su 'bab pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang rigs pas 'brel pa nyams su 'bab pa ma yin no //
translated: that is also not logically tenable.

original: 'di ltar re zhig dang po kho nar de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig dang po kho nar de lta ma yin na /
translated: Thus, if it were not so,

original: skad cig gsum pa la 'bras bur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di shin tu ma 'brel ba yin te /üîΩgang zhig ji ltar yang zhig pa dang ma zhig pa las skye bar mi 'dod pa de la /
analyzed: skad cig gsum pa la 'bras bur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di shin tu ma 'brel ba yin te / gang zhig ji ltar yang zhig pa dang ma zhig pa las skye bar mi 'dod pa de la /
translated: then this statement ‚ÄúThe effect arises from the destroyed and nondestroyed‚Äù would be completely incoherent.üîΩYou should understand for yourself how this statement is appropriate for one who does not accept that an effect arises from that which is destroyed or nondestroyed.

original: 'di lta bu'i rjod pa ji ltar 'tsham zhes bdag nyid kyis rtogs shig / gang yang re zhig skad cig ma dang po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de yang snying po med pa nyid do /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rjod pa ji ltar 'tsham zhes bdag nyid kyis rtogs shig / gang yang re zhig skad cig ma dang po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de yang snying po med pa nyid do /
translated: Also, the statement ‚ÄúFirst, the effect arises from the nondestroyed,‚Äù etc., is also pointless.

original: 'di ltar skad cig gnyis pa la ma zhi pa las 'bras bu 'di 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig gnyis pa la ma zhi pa las 'bras bu 'di 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the effect does not arise from the nondestroyed at the second moment,

original: de'i tshe ma zhig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe ma zhig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time the nondestroyed does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe 'di ma zhig pa de'i tshe yang 'bras bu med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di ma zhig pa de'i tshe yang 'bras bu med pa kho na'o //
translated: When it is nondestroyed, then the effect does not exist.

original: ji ste skad cig gnyis pa la ma zhig pa kho na las 'bras bu skye ste /
analyzed: ji ste skad cig gnyis pa la ma zhig pa kho na las 'bras bu skye ste /
translated: But if the effect arises from the nondestroyed at the second moment,

original: 'di ltar skyes ma thag tu yod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes ma thag tu yod la /
translated: then it would arise immediately after it comes into existence.

original: de yang ma zhig pa kho na las 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ma zhig pa kho na las 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: But it arises only from that which has not yet ceased.

original: yin la ni rag mod kyi /
analyzed: yin la ni rag mod kyi /
translated: This is so, but

original: khyod kyi skad cig pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyod kyi skad cig pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not be momentary.

original: gal te 'di skad cig pa nyid ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'di skad cig pa nyid ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is not momentary,

original: 'di ltar rgyu 'jig pa na 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu 'jig pa na 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhe na /
translated: then when the cause ceases, it produces the effect.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te //üîΩ'di ltar re zhig gang gi tshe rgyu 'jig pa de'i tshe na re zhig 'bras bu med la gang gi tshe /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te // 'di ltar re zhig gang gi tshe rgyu 'jig pa de'i tshe na re zhig 'bras bu med la gang gi tshe /
translated: This is not reasonable.üîΩWhen the cause is ceasing, at that time the effect does not yet exist.

original: zhig zin pa de'i tshe 'bras bu de gang las 'byung zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: zhig zin pa de'i tshe 'bras bu de gang las 'byung zhes brjod par bya /
translated: When it has already ceased, from what would the effect arise?

original: gal te 'jig pa de nyid las 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa de nyid las 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that it arises from that which is ceasing,

original: de'i tshe de med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i tshe de med pa ma yin nam /
translated: then at that time it does not yet exist.

original: gang gi tshe yod par gyur pa de'i tshe ni de las 'bras bu 'byung bar khyod mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yod par gyur pa de'i tshe ni de las 'bras bu 'byung bar khyod mi 'dod do //
translated: When it exists, at that time you do not assert that the effect arises from it.

original: gnas skabs gzhan yang ci yang med de /
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan yang ci yang med de /
translated: There is no other state.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rtogs bzhin du yang mjug thogs pa la mngon par zhen pa tsam gyi ling tog gis yang dag pa'i blo'i mig khebs pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rtogs bzhin du yang mjug thogs pa la mngon par zhen pa tsam gyi ling tog gis yang dag pa'i blo'i mig khebs pas /
translated: Therefore, even while things are being understood, the cataract of mere attachment to the immediately preceding condition obscures the eye of the mind.

original: rgyu ma 'gags pa las skye'o snyam du gdon mi za bar sems te /
analyzed: rgyu ma 'gags pa las skye'o snyam du gdon mi za bar sems te /
translated: Thus, one thinks, ‚ÄúWithout doubt, an effect arises from a cause that has not ceased.‚Äù

original: de ltar ni dbye @34b par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ltar ni dbye @34b par mi nus so //
translated: But it cannot be analyzed in this way.

original: 'di ltar skad cig dang po la nus pa thams cad ma nyams pa rgyu mthu che ba'i tshe ni 'bras bu mi skye'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig dang po la nus pa thams cad ma nyams pa rgyu mthu che ba'i tshe ni 'bras bu mi skye'o //
translated: When the cause is powerful, that is, when all its potency is unimpaired in the first moment, the effect does not arise.

original: skad cig gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: skad cig gnyis pa ste /
translated: In the second moment,

original: gang gi tshe 'bras bu sgrub par nus pa'i mthu'i bye brag thams cad med par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'bras bu sgrub par nus pa'i mthu'i bye brag thams cad med par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: when all the potency that could have produced the effect is gone,

original: 'bras bu skye bar ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye bar ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could the effect arise?

original: de lta bas na smra ci dgos te de ni gzhag go //üîΩde dag rnam par rtogs byed pa //
analyzed: de lta bas na smra ci dgos te de ni gzhag go // de dag rnam par rtogs byed pa //
translated: Therefore, what need is there to say that this is untenable?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don gsal lo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don gsal lo //
translated: The rest is clear.

original: gal te 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ni lung dang 'jig rten na yang yod la /
analyzed: gal te 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ni lung dang 'jig rten na yang yod la /
translated: The statement ‚Äúif this exists, that comes to be‚Äù is found in scripture and in the world.

original: sa bon la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'di yang 'di tsam gyi rgyu rkyen yin pas de'i phyir 'di don dam par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'di yang 'di tsam gyi rgyu rkyen yin pas de'i phyir 'di don dam par yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThis thing that is the entity of cause and effect, such as a seed, exists ultimately because it is the cause and condition of this,‚ÄùüîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: 'di yod 'di zhes bya ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di yod 'di zhes bya ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This exists, that arises, and so on.

original: 'di skad du 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba 'di 'jig rten dang grub pa'i mtha' la yang yod de /
analyzed: 'di skad du 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba 'di 'jig rten dang grub pa'i mtha' la yang yod de /
translated: This is saying, ‚ÄúThis exists, that arises‚Äù exists in the world and in philosophical systems.

original: de ni tshig tsam gyis ma yin te tshad mas yin na /
analyzed: de ni tshig tsam gyis ma yin te tshad mas yin na /
translated: That is not merely words; it is by means of valid knowledge.

original: sngar bshad pa yi rnam pa yis //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa yi rnam pa yis //
translated: As explained above,

original: tshad ma'ang khyod la yod ma yin /
analyzed: tshad ma'ang khyod la yod ma yin /
translated: valid knowledge also does not exist for you.

original: sngar bshad pa yi rnam pa ni //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa yi rnam pa ni //
translated: As explained above,

original: rnam pa med pa'i shes pa ni //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i shes pa ni //
translated: a consciousness without aspects

original: yul la 'dzin par mi rigs so //
analyzed: yul la 'dzin par mi rigs so //
translated: cannot be suitable to apprehend an object.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / du mas dngos po gcig mi byed //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / du mas dngos po gcig mi byed //
translated: And so on, and ‚ÄúMany do not produce one thing.‚Äù

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: de lta bas na nged kyi ste //
analyzed: de lta bas na nged kyi ste //
translated: Therefore, ours is

original: kho bo cag gi rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam /
translated: this mere conditionality.üîΩ  What exists in the scriptures and in the world

original: gsung rab dang 'jig rten na yod pa ni /
analyzed: gsung rab dang 'jig rten na yod pa ni /
translated: The scriptures and the world say:üîΩ

original: ji ltar snang ba kho nar zad do //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba kho nar zad do //
translated: It is just as it appears.

original: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar 'di la dngos bsams na //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di la dngos bsams na //
translated: Because, when one reflects on the nature of this,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: etc.

original: brgya zhig la nga yang ji ltar snang ba 'di kho na 'dod do zhes smra bar 'gyur bas /üîΩnged kyang de ltar 'dod ce na //
analyzed: brgya zhig la nga yang ji ltar snang ba 'di kho na 'dod do zhes smra bar 'gyur bas / nged kyang de ltar 'dod ce na //
translated: If someone were to say, ‚ÄúI accept just what appears,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: we would say, ‚ÄúWe accept that too.‚Äù

original: gal te bag med pas 'khrul pa'i phyir rkyen 'di tsam rjod pa la nyes pa ci yang med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bag med pas 'khrul pa'i phyir rkyen 'di tsam rjod pa la nyes pa ci yang med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no fault in stating this much, because of the confusion of carelessness,

original: yang dang yang du zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yang dang yang du zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: we say, ‚ÄúAgain and again, etc.‚Äù

original: mkhas pa ni nam yang yang dang yang du 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩgal te tshad mas grub pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mkhas pa ni nam yang yang dang yang du 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro // gal te tshad mas grub pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: The wise are never confused again and again.

original: de grub bya la tshad ma ni //
analyzed: de grub bya la tshad ma ni //
translated: If you say that it is established by a valid cognition,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: we say, ‚ÄúThat which is to be established, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te tshig tsam gyis grub po zhe na ;üîΩthams cad 'grub par thal 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: gal te tshig tsam gyis grub po zhe na ; thams cad 'grub par thal 'gyur phyir //
translated: If you say that it is established by mere words,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: we say, ‚ÄúIt follows that everything is established, etc.‚Äù

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan dbang phyir //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan dbang phyir //
translated: because of the other-dependence which is the object of the desire to express.

original: sgra rnams gang la yod ma yin //
analyzed: sgra rnams gang la yod ma yin //
translated: The words do not exist in it.

original: de yod pas ni don 'grub na //
analyzed: de yod pas ni don 'grub na //
translated: If the object is established by its existence,

original: thams cad kyi ni thams cad 'grub //
analyzed: thams cad kyi ni thams cad 'grub //
translated: everything would be established for everyone.

original: ces 'byung ba'i phyir thams cad 'grub par thal ba yin no //
analyzed: ces 'byung ba'i phyir thams cad 'grub par thal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, it follows that everything would be established.

original: @35a * // 'di lta bu'i rkyen 'di pa nyid tsam 'di yang dag par yod do zhes rjod par byed cing bdag nyid stod par byed pa ni /
analyzed: @35a * // 'di lta bu'i rkyen 'di pa nyid tsam 'di yang dag par yod do zhes rjod par byed cing bdag nyid stod par byed pa ni /
translated: But, when you say that this mere conditionality itself exists in reality, you are praising yourself.

original: kye ma'o blo ni shin tu zhib //
analyzed: kye ma'o blo ni shin tu zhib //
translated: Oh, how clever you are!

original: 'dis ni blun pa nyid du brjod cing bzhad gang du byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni blun pa nyid du brjod cing bzhad gang du byed do //
translated: This is said to be the foolishness and the joke of the opponent.

original: khyod kyis kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bye brag ni brjod la /
analyzed: khyod kyis kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bye brag ni brjod la /
translated: You have described the division of conventional truth,

original: gang gis na des de na pa yin pa kun rdzob de nyid ni ma bshad do snyam pa la /
analyzed: gang gis na des de na pa yin pa kun rdzob de nyid ni ma bshad do snyam pa la /
translated: but you have not explained that conventional itself by which it is so.üîΩIf you think that, then, what is this so-called conventional?

original: ji ste kun rdzob kyi zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩgang zhig gis sgrib ces bya ba 'dis ni byed pa sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: ji ste kun rdzob kyi zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩgang zhig gis sgrib ces bya ba 'dis ni byed pa sgrub pa'o //
translated: By what is it obscured?

original: gang zhig la zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzhi sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig la zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzhi sgrub pa'o //
translated: The phrase to whatever establishes the basis.

original: bzhed ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das bzhed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bzhed ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das bzhed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word accepts means that the Bhagavat accepts.

original: 'di nyid lung dang bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di nyid lung dang bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate this very point through scripture,

original: mdo las ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mdo las ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, As it is said in the sutra...

original: skye ba kun rdzob tu zhes bya ba ni ji ltar snang bzhin skye'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩdam pa'i don gyi tshul du dpyad na /
analyzed: skye ba kun rdzob tu zhes bya ba ni ji ltar snang bzhin skye'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // dam pa'i don gyi tshul du dpyad na /
translated: Birth is conventional means that it is just as it appears, i.e., it is born.üîΩWhen one analyzes in terms of ultimate reality, the error that those which are essenceless are born is accepted as a conventional truth.

original: rang bzhin med pa rnams la skye'o zhes 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag kun rdzob 'dod de ni bden te 'khrul pa yin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩkun rdzob des na sna tshogs 'di kun thams cad bden pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa rnams la skye'o zhes 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag kun rdzob 'dod de ni bden te 'khrul pa yin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // kun rdzob des na sna tshogs 'di kun thams cad bden pa yin gyi /
translated: It is true, but one should not make it an error, i.e., one should not make it an ultimate truth.

original: dam pa'i don rigs pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dam pa'i don rigs pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, all of this variety is true conventionally, but not through reasoning directed at the ultimate.

original: 'di yang lung dang sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di yang lung dang sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this very point through scripture, he says, As it is said in the sutra...

original: mdo las ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mdo las ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The sutra says, etc.

original: ji ste kun rdzob ces bya ba 'di ci yin zhe na zhes dris pa dang dbu ma pas kun rdzob ni dngos po med pa yin no zhes bshad ces grags pa de la /
analyzed: ji ste kun rdzob ces bya ba 'di ci yin zhe na zhes dris pa dang dbu ma pas kun rdzob ni dngos po med pa yin no zhes bshad ces grags pa de la /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúWhat is this so-called conventional?‚Äù and the Madhyamika replies, ‚ÄúThe conventional is a non-entity,‚Äù

original: btsun pa lha dbang blos sun 'byin pa smras pa dang / kun rdzob dngos po med yin na //
analyzed: btsun pa lha dbang blos sun 'byin pa smras pa dang / kun rdzob dngos po med yin na //
translated: then the Venerable Devendrabuddhi says that this is a refutation:üîΩIf the conventional is a non-entity,

original: gal te kun rdzob ces bya ba'i sgra dngos po med par brjod par 'gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob ces bya ba'i sgra dngos po med par brjod par 'gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: then the word ‚Äúconventional‚Äù would express a non-entity.

original: skye ba dngos po'i rnam grangs yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skye ba dngos po'i rnam grangs yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúArising‚Äù is a synonym for entity.üîΩTherefore, at that time,

original: phyir de lta bas na de la dngos po gzugs la sogs pa gcig po de la de'i tshe //
analyzed: phyir de lta bas na de la dngos po gzugs la sogs pa gcig po de la de'i tshe //
translated: that one entity, form, etc.,

original: nus dang mi nus cig car 'gyur //
analyzed: nus dang mi nus cig car 'gyur //
translated: would simultaneously be both able and unable.

original: zhes bya bar bsnyegs so //
analyzed: zhes bya bar bsnyegs so //
translated: This is the argument.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa de'i phyir don bya bar mi nus te mi rung ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa de'i phyir don bya bar mi nus te mi rung ba yin no //
translated: Because all these things such as form are the nature of the superficial, therefore they are not able to perform a function, that is, it is not possible.

original: gang gi phyir skye ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa de'i phyir don byed nus te bsgrub par nus pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa de'i phyir don byed nus te bsgrub par nus pa'o //
translated: Because they are the nature of production, therefore they are able to perform a function, that is, they can be accomplished.

original: de lta bas na gcig la phan tshun 'gal ba'i ngo bo nyid gnyis ji ltar rung /
analyzed: de lta bas na gcig la phan tshun 'gal ba'i ngo bo nyid gnyis ji ltar rung /
translated: Thus, how can it be possible that two natures which are mutually contradictory belong to one thing?

original: ji ste kun rdzob ni skye ba'i rnam grangs yin no zhes smra na /
analyzed: ji ste kun rdzob ni skye ba'i rnam grangs yin no zhes smra na /
translated: If you say that the superficial is a synonym for production,

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: then we reply:

original: gal @35b te kun rdzob skye ba yin na /
analyzed: gal @35b te kun rdzob skye ba yin na /
translated: If the superficial is production,

original: de'i tshe lta ba 'di la ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe lta ba 'di la ni /
translated: then in this view

original: kun rdzob tu skye bzhes bya ba mkhas pa rnams kyi tshig 'di'i don ni /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu skye bzhes bya ba mkhas pa rnams kyi tshig 'di'i don ni /
translated: the meaning of the words of the wise, ‚Äúproduction is superficial,‚Äù

original: skye ba skye zhes bya bar 'gyur bas mtshar to //
analyzed: skye ba skye zhes bya bar 'gyur bas mtshar to //
translated: is that production is production.

original: de ltar bas na brjod pa de lta bu ni 'brel pa ma yin no zhes phyas su bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar bas na brjod pa de lta bu ni 'brel pa ma yin no zhes phyas su bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, such a statement is not related.

original: 'di ni 'brel pa med pa gzhan yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'brel pa med pa gzhan yin te /
translated: This is another irrelevance.

original: 'di'i skye ba kun rdzob ste don dam pa ni ma skyes na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di smos te /
analyzed: 'di'i skye ba kun rdzob ste don dam pa ni ma skyes na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di smos te /
translated: Here, ‚Äúarising‚Äù is conventional, but ‚Äúultimately non-arisen‚Äù and so on are ultimate.

original: don dam pa ni kun rdzob las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa ni kun rdzob las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: He thinks that the ultimate is the opposite of the conventional.

original: de lta yin na dngos po rnams don dam par ma skyes pa'o zhes bya ba la 'di skad du /
analyzed: de lta yin na dngos po rnams don dam par ma skyes pa'o zhes bya ba la 'di skad du /
translated: If that is so, then the statement ‚ÄúThings are ultimately non-arisen‚Äù would be the same as saying,

original: skye ba med pas dngos po rnams ma skyes par bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba med pas dngos po rnams ma skyes par bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThings are non-arisen because they do not arise.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na rgol ba de skad du /
analyzed: de lta bas na rgol ba de skad du /
translated: Therefore, if the opponent argues in this way,

original: smra na grub pa sgrub pa nyid smra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: smra na grub pa sgrub pa nyid smra bar 'gyur te /
translated: he would be saying that he is proving what is already established.

original: 'di ltar dngos po rnams skye ba med pas ma skyes so zhes bya ba de ni thams cad la grub pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po rnams skye ba med pas ma skyes so zhes bya ba de ni thams cad la grub pa kho na ste /
translated: For example, the statement ‚ÄúThings are non-arisen because they do not arise‚Äù is established for everyone.

original: de'i phyir dam bcas pa grub pa sgrub pa nyid kyi nyes pa yin no //üîΩde lta yin na rgol bas rkyen la rag las te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dam bcas pa grub pa sgrub pa nyid kyi nyes pa yin no // de lta yin na rgol bas rkyen la rag las te /
translated: Therefore, the fault is that he is proving what is already established.üîΩIf that is so, then the opponent would be saying that the reason ‚Äúbecause they arise in dependence on conditions‚Äù

original: skye ba nyid kyi gtan tshigs 'dis gang gis na 'di sgrub pa yin par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: skye ba nyid kyi gtan tshigs 'dis gang gis na 'di sgrub pa yin par 'gyur ba /
translated: establishes the probandum,

original: mi 'dod ci zhig bsgrubs par 'gyur //
analyzed: mi 'dod ci zhig bsgrubs par 'gyur //
translated: What is not desired is accomplished.

original: rigs pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'dis //üîΩgnas pa la sogs de bzhin brjod //
analyzed: rigs pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'dis // gnas pa la sogs de bzhin brjod //
translated: Following reasoning, it is saidüîΩthat it is like that for endurance, etc.

original: gnas pa dang brgal ba dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa la yang de bzhin brjod de /
analyzed: gnas pa dang brgal ba dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa la yang de bzhin brjod de /
translated: Endurance, refutation, impermanence, etc. are also like that.

original: 'di ltar kun rdzob dngos po med yin na //
analyzed: 'di ltar kun rdzob dngos po med yin na //
translated: If the conventional were a non-entity,

original: gnas sogs dngos po yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gnas sogs dngos po yin pa'i phyir //
translated: endurance, etc. would be entities.

original: de tshe dngos po gcig de la //
analyzed: de tshe dngos po gcig de la //
translated: Then, for that one entity,

original: nus dang mi nus cig car 'gyur //
analyzed: nus dang mi nus cig car 'gyur //
translated: ability and inability would be simultaneous.

original: gal te kun rdzob gnas sogs yin //
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob gnas sogs yin //
translated: If the conventional were endurance, etc.,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: etc.

original: de la sogs pa zhes smos pa ni slob dpon chos skyong gis ji ste kun rdzob ces bya ba 'di ci zhig yin /
analyzed: de la sogs pa zhes smos pa ni slob dpon chos skyong gis ji ste kun rdzob ces bya ba 'di ci zhig yin /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to the statement by the master DharmapƒÅla: ‚ÄúWhat is this so-called conventional?

original: mi bden pa'i rnam grangs yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa'am /
analyzed: mi bden pa'i rnam grangs yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa'am /
translated: Is it a synonym for ‚Äòuntrue‚Äô?‚Äù

original: gzhan 'ga' zhig gis kun rdzob kyi bden pa las brtsams nas smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan 'ga' zhig gis kun rdzob kyi bden pa las brtsams nas smras pa /
translated: Or it refers to the statement by some other person: ‚ÄúThe conventional truth is that which is the object of the six consciousnesses.‚Äù

original: gang yin pa bsdus te skabs dang mi ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang yin pa bsdus te skabs dang mi ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since these are not included in the root text and are not relevant to the context,

original: ma 'brel la /
analyzed: ma 'brel la /
translated: they are not related.

original: 'di skad kyi byings dang nye bar bsgyur ba dang / rkyen rnams kyi don ma yin pa'i phyir sgra'i don ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad kyi byings dang nye bar bsgyur ba dang / rkyen rnams kyi don ma yin pa'i phyir sgra'i don ma yin no //
translated: because it is not the meaning of the word, since it is not the meaning of the verbal root, the prefix, or the suffix.

original: kun rdzob mtshan 'di las zhes bya ni gang gis yang dag pa'i sgrib par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa las so //
analyzed: kun rdzob mtshan 'di las zhes bya ni gang gis yang dag pa'i sgrib par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom this characteristic of the superficial‚Äù means from ‚Äúthat which obscures the real.‚Äù

original: nyams pa ni bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyams pa ni bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúDegeneration‚Äù means ‚Äúseparation.‚Äù

original: de bas na 'dis ni rgol ba dag bsal bar bya ba la kho bo cag 'bad pa mi byed do zhes @36a * //üîΩrjod par byed do //üîΩslob dpon chos skyong gis dngos po gcig la cig car bden par yang 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas na 'dis ni rgol ba dag bsal bar bya ba la kho bo cag 'bad pa mi byed do zhes @36a * // rjod par byed do // slob dpon chos skyong gis dngos po gcig la cig car bden par yang 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, he says that he does not strive to refute the opponents.

original: mi bden par yang 'gyur zhes 'gal ba smras pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: mi bden par yang 'gyur zhes 'gal ba smras pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: The master DharmapƒÅla, in order to avoid the contradiction of saying that one thing is both real and unreal at the same time, explains:

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i rigs pas brtags na ni /
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i rigs pas brtags na ni /
translated: When examined by the reasoning of the inference based on fact,

original: bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bden pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not real,

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pas mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pas mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not suitable as the object of the inference based on fact.

original: dngos po de gzhan du na bden pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po de gzhan du na bden pa yin te /
translated: That thing is true in another way.

original: ji ltar snang ba bzhin du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba bzhin du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: just as it appears.

original: yang na ni rigs pa las gzhan pa ni de gzhan du na ste /
analyzed: yang na ni rigs pa las gzhan pa ni de gzhan du na ste /
translated: Or else, ‚Äúin another way‚Äù means that it is other than reasoning.

original: des na ji ltar snang ba dang rigs pa'i stobs kyis brjod pa na dngos po gcig la bden pa nyid dang mi bden pa nyid ji ltar 'gal te /
analyzed: des na ji ltar snang ba dang rigs pa'i stobs kyis brjod pa na dngos po gcig la bden pa nyid dang mi bden pa nyid ji ltar 'gal te /
translated: Therefore, when it is expressed by the power of appearance and reasoning, how can there be a contradiction in a single thing of its being true and not being true?

original: mi 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: mi 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning is: there is no contradiction at all.

original: ltos pa'i bye brag gis zhes snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: ltos pa'i bye brag gis zhes snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The idea is that it is due to the difference of perspective.

original: slob dpon lha dbang blos 'gal ba smras pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir /üîΩrigs pas brtags na dngos ma yin //
analyzed: slob dpon lha dbang blos 'gal ba smras pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir / rigs pas brtags na dngos ma yin //
translated: Master Devendrabuddhi, in order to completely avoid the contradiction,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: says, ‚ÄúWhen examined by reasoning, it is not a thing,‚Äù and so on.

original: da ni dbu ma pa rnams kyi dam bcas pa ji ltar bur rnam par gnas pa de bsnyad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dbu ma pa rnams kyi dam bcas pa ji ltar bur rnam par gnas pa de bsnyad pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain how the Madhyamaka thesis is posited,

original: de lta yin na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta yin na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúEven though that is so,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di skad du pha rol po rnams kyis ni dngos po rnams don dam par skyes so zhes smras la /
analyzed: 'di skad du pha rol po rnams kyis ni dngos po rnams don dam par skyes so zhes smras la /
translated: This is what is said: the opponents say that things are ultimately produced.

original: dbu ma bas ni dngos po rnams don dam par skyes so zhes gang smras pa de ma yin no zhes dgag pa tsam byed par zad do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dbu ma bas ni dngos po rnams don dam par skyes so zhes gang smras pa de ma yin no zhes dgag pa tsam byed par zad do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The Followers of the Middle Way simply say, ‚ÄúIt is not the case that things are ultimately produced,‚Äù and thereby engage in refutation.

original: tshig don 'di ni rigs pa yi //
analyzed: tshig don 'di ni rigs pa yi //
translated: This is the meaning of the words.üîΩFollowing the principle of logic,

original: rjes su 'brangs nas skye ba med //
analyzed: rjes su 'brangs nas skye ba med //
translated: there is no arising.

original: ces bya ba ni de nyid ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni de nyid ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: tshig 'di'i don ni don dam par ma skyes pa'o zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩgzhan la'ang de bzhin sbyar bar gyis //
analyzed: tshig 'di'i don ni don dam par ma skyes pa'o zhes bya ba yin no // gzhan la'ang de bzhin sbyar bar gyis //
translated: The meaning of the words is that things are not ultimately produced.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The rest of the passage is easy to understand.

original: pha rol po dngos por smra ba rnams kyis skye ba la sogs pa 'dod pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: pha rol po dngos por smra ba rnams kyis skye ba la sogs pa 'dod pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The opponents, the Proponents of Things, assert arising and so on.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni gnas pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni gnas pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes endurance and so on.

original: ji lta bu zhig snyam pa la bshad pa /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig snyam pa la bshad pa /
translated: What is it like?

original: rigs lam brten pa can //
analyzed: rigs lam brten pa can //
translated: It is based on the path of reasoning.

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus, he says.

original: gang dag gi snyam pa la dngos po rnams kyi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang dag gi snyam pa la dngos po rnams kyi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: With respect to what? He says, ‚Äúof things.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa rig pa'i lam la brten pa nyid kyi ngo bo de kho na rang bzhin med pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rig pa'i lam la brten pa nyid kyi ngo bo de kho na rang bzhin med pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of things such as form, etc., which are based on the path of cognition, is seen to be essenceless.

original: 'gog par byed na de bas de lta na rang bzhin med pa nyid du lta ba la /
analyzed: 'gog par byed na de bas de lta na rang bzhin med pa nyid du lta ba la /
translated: If you refute that, then in that case, what is the harm in viewing essencelessness?

original: ci zhig gnod de ci zhig gnod //üîΩces bya @36b pa'i tshig 'dis ni gzhan dag gis dam bcas pa la /
analyzed: ci zhig gnod de ci zhig gnod // ces bya @36b pa'i tshig 'dis ni gzhan dag gis dam bcas pa la /
translated: What is the harm?

original: mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / rang gi tshig dang grangs pa dang lung dang 'gal ba'i gnod pa yod do zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de mi srid do zhes ston par byed do /
analyzed: mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / rang gi tshig dang grangs pa dang lung dang 'gal ba'i gnod pa yod do zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de mi srid do zhes ston par byed do /
translated: This statement shows that it is impossible for others to claim that the view of essencelessness is undermined by the contradictions of direct perception, inference, one‚Äôs own words, general principles, and scripture.

original: 'di ltar skye ba la sogs pa ji ltar snang ba bzhin rnam par gnas pa de dag ni gang gi phyir mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba de ltar ni mi 'gog gi / rigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'gog ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba la sogs pa ji ltar snang ba bzhin rnam par gnas pa de dag ni gang gi phyir mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba de ltar ni mi 'gog gi / rigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'gog ste /
translated: Thus, we do not refute arising, etc., as they are perceived, but we refute them in accordance with reason,

original: ji ltar gzhan dag gis skye ba la sogs par yongs su brtags pa dag 'jug pa de dag kyang de ltar ni mngon sum ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan dag gis skye ba la sogs par yongs su brtags pa dag 'jug pa de dag kyang de ltar ni mngon sum ma yin te /
translated: because the imputations of arising, etc., by others do not occur in the way they are perceived.

original: de lta bas na de dang ga la 'gal /
analyzed: de lta bas na de dang ga la 'gal /
translated: So how can we be faulted?

original: don dam par skye'o zhes bya ba de la rigs pa smra ba rnams kyis gzhan dag gis don dam pa zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ji lta bur yongs su brtags pa de la brten nas 'gog par byed de /
analyzed: don dam par skye'o zhes bya ba de la rigs pa smra ba rnams kyis gzhan dag gis don dam pa zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ji lta bur yongs su brtags pa de la brten nas 'gog par byed de /
translated: When the logicians say, ‚ÄúIt arises ultimately,‚Äù they refute the ultimate on the basis of the meaning of the term ‚Äúultimate‚Äù as imputed by others.

original: de lta yin na slob dpon chos skyong gis dam par ma skyes zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: de lta yin na slob dpon chos skyong gis dam par ma skyes zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: If that were so, then DharmapƒÅla would not have said, ‚ÄúIt does not arise ultimately.‚Äù

original: don dam pa zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ci yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnod pa smras pa gang yin pa de 'di la mi srid do snyam nas /
analyzed: don dam pa zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ci yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnod pa smras pa gang yin pa de 'di la mi srid do snyam nas /
translated: One might think, The objection that the meaning of the word 'ultimate' is not possible, etc., does not apply to this.

original: ci zhig gnod ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ci zhig gnod ces bya ba smos te /
translated: To this, the reply is, What objection?

original: 'di ltar don dam par skye'o zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam par skye'o zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: Thus, in the statement, ultimately it arises,

original: don dam pa zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don 'jig rten gyi rnam par 'jog pa gang yin pa de nyid rigs pa smra bas 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: don dam pa zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don 'jig rten gyi rnam par 'jog pa gang yin pa de nyid rigs pa smra bas 'gog par byed do //
translated: the meaning of the word 'ultimate' is the mundane positing of the object, and this is refuted by the proponent of reasoning.üîΩTo explain the meaning of the sutra passage that begins with Therefore, Subhuti,

original: de ni yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo'i tshig 'og nas 'byung ba bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: de ni yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo'i tshig 'og nas 'byung ba bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: the root text says, For that reason...üîΩ The phrase For that reason

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: refers to the fact that the conventional is called 'ultimate' because it is consistent with the ultimate.üîΩTo explain the meaning of the sutra passage that begins with The conventional,üîΩthe root text says, The conventional is called 'ultimate' because it is consistent with the ultimate.üîΩ The phrase The conventional is called 'ultimate' because it is consistent with the ultimateüîΩrefers to the fact that the conventional is called 'ultimate' because it is consistent with the ultimate.üîΩThe phrase The conventional is called 'ultimate' because it is consistent with the ultimateüîΩrefers to the fact that the conventional is called 'ultimate' because it is consistent with the ultimate.üîΩThe phrase The conventional is called 'ultimate' because it is consistent with the ultimateüîΩrefers to the fact that the conventional is called 'ultimate' because it is consistent with the ultimate.üîΩThe phrase The conventional is called 'ultimate' because it is consistent with the ultimateüîΩrefers to the fact that the conventional is called 'ultimate' because it is consistent with the ultimate.üîΩThe phrase The conventional is called 'ultimate' because it is consistent with the ultimate

original: gang gi phyir don dam pa dang mthun pa'i phyir /üîΩkun rdzob nyid don dam pa'i sgrar brjod pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don dam pa dang mthun pa'i phyir / kun rdzob nyid don dam pa'i sgrar brjod pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: refers to the fact that the conventional is called 'ultimate' because it is consistent with the ultimate.üîΩThe phrase The conventional is called 'ultimate' because it is consistent with the ultimateüîΩrefers to the fact that the conventional is called 'ultimate' because it is consistent with the ultimate.üîΩThe phrase The conventional is called 'ultimate' because it is consistent with the ultimateüîΩrefers to the fact that the conventional is called 'ultimate' because it is consistent with the ultimate.

original: kun rdzob ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩde bzhin nyid ni ngo bo nyid do /
analyzed: kun rdzob ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩde bzhin nyid ni ngo bo nyid do /
translated: The phrase The conventional is called 'ultimate' because it is consistent with the ultimateüîΩref

original: ci'i phyir kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis tha mi dad snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis tha mi dad snyam pa la /
translated: Why are the conventional and the ultimate not different?

original: rigs de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rigs de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this question, he says, ‚ÄúThat reasoning, too, is conventional.‚Äù

original: de lta yin na ni rigs pa yang kun rdzob kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni rigs pa yang kun rdzob kho na yin no //
translated: If that is so, then reasoning is only conventional.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ji ltar snang ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the nature of appearance.

original: de nyid ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
analyzed: de nyid ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
translated: Why is that so?

original: rigs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rigs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response to this question, he says, ‚ÄúReasoning is not ultimate.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir rig pa gzhan du mi 'jug go snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rig pa gzhan du mi 'jug go snyam pa la /
translated: Why does reasoning not engage in another way?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this question, he says, ‚ÄúBecause the object of reasoning is not established.‚Äù

original: 'di rnam par 'grol par byed do //
analyzed: 'di rnam par 'grol par byed do //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba 'byung gi zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba 'byung gi zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúinference and what is inferred occur‚Äù is supplied.

original: ji ltar zhe na rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba dag gi snang ba'i chos so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba dag gi snang ba'i chos so //
translated: How is that? The phenomena that appear to the proponent and opponent.

original: @37a * // nga la zhe na /
analyzed: @37a * // nga la zhe na /
translated: To what?

original: blo'i bdag nyid la'o //
analyzed: blo'i bdag nyid la'o //
translated: To the mind.

original: ji lta bur zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: chos can dang / chos dang / dpe nyid du rnam par gzhag par ro //
analyzed: chos can dang / chos dang / dpe nyid du rnam par gzhag par ro //
translated: The subject, the property, and the example are established.

original: gzhan na ni 'byung ba ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan na ni 'byung ba ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The inference does not occur elsewhere.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rjes su dpag pa 'byung ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa 'byung ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the occurrence of inference is impossible.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gnyis ka la ma grub pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gnyis ka la ma grub pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Because of the nonestablishment of both.

original: gang dag ce na /
analyzed: gang dag ce na /
translated: What are those?

original: chos can dang chos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos can dang chos la sogs pa'o //
translated: The subject, the property, and so on.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni dpe nye bar bsdu pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni dpe nye bar bsdu pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the example.

original: ci'i phyir gnyi ga la ma grub pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnyi ga la ma grub pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Why is there nonestablishment of both?

original: bshad pa chos dang chos can dang dpe gang la yang blo mtshungs pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa chos dang chos can dang dpe gang la yang blo mtshungs pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no similarity of cognition in any subject, property, or example.

original: gang dag gi zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag gi zhe na /
translated: Whose?

original: gzhung lugs tha dad pa gnas pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gzhung lugs tha dad pa gnas pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Those who maintain different systems.

original: gzhung lugs ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: gzhung lugs ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: A system is a philosophical school.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de nyid kyi phyir blo la snang ba'i chos can de lta bu la gnas te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de nyid kyi phyir blo la snang ba'i chos can de lta bu la gnas te /
translated: Because that is so, therefore, the inference is based on such a subject that appears to cognition.

original: dngos po sems par byed pa rnams ni blo la snang ba'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa de lta bu kho nas ci blo la snang ba 'di yang dag par yod dam med /
analyzed: dngos po sems par byed pa rnams ni blo la snang ba'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa de lta bu kho nas ci blo la snang ba 'di yang dag par yod dam med /
translated: Those who think about things should consider this alone, namely, that the reason, etc. , appear to the mind. Is what appears to the mind really existent or not?

original: dngos po la brten pa zhig gam 'on te ma yin zhes sems par byed par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po la brten pa zhig gam 'on te ma yin zhes sems par byed par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Is it based on things or not?

original: sogs pa zhes smos pas ni dpe nye bar gzung ngo //üîΩrigs pa smra ba ni dbu ma pa'am /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes smos pas ni dpe nye bar gzung ngo // rigs pa smra ba ni dbu ma pa'am /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the example.üîΩThe ‚Äúlogicians‚Äù are the MƒÅdhyamikas

original: dngos po smra ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po smra ba'o //
translated: or the essentialists.

original: blo la snang ba'i cha ma brtags na nyams dga' bas /
analyzed: blo la snang ba'i cha ma brtags na nyams dga' bas /
translated: The part of the mind that appears is delightful when not examined.

original: gzhan gyi skye ba la sogs par yongs su brtags pa 'gog pa lhur len pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'byung bar byed na /üîΩku zhig 'gog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi skye ba la sogs par yongs su brtags pa 'gog pa lhur len pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'byung bar byed na / ku zhig 'gog par 'gyur te /
translated: When one is intent on refuting the imputation of other-production, etc., one generates an inference.üîΩBut that refutes a non-existent,

original: spong bar byed pa su zhig ces bya ba su yang mi 'gog go zhes ston to //
analyzed: spong bar byed pa su zhig ces bya ba su yang mi 'gog go zhes ston to //
translated: for no one is refuting anything.

original: dngos po 'di ni mtshungs pa nyid du grub par rgya cher gtan la phab bas mngas su dogs pas /
analyzed: dngos po 'di ni mtshungs pa nyid du grub par rgya cher gtan la phab bas mngas su dogs pas /
translated: This matter has been extensively settled in the PrasannapadaÃÑ, so fearing verbosity, I will not go into it here.

original: 'dir ni 'di rgya ma bskyed do //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'di rgya ma bskyed do //
translated: Here, I will not elaborate on this.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rigs pa de yang ji ltar snang ba bzhin du kun tu gnas pa de nyid kyi phyir mdo las /üîΩ'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rigs pa de yang ji ltar snang ba bzhin du kun tu gnas pa de nyid kyi phyir mdo las / 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyang gzhan la /
translated: The reason why it is so is because it is just as it appears. Therefore, the s≈´tra says:üîΩ‚ÄúThe conventional of the world is not different from the ultimate.‚Äù

original: don dam pa yang gzhan pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs te rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa yang gzhan pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs te rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not reasonable.

original: ci'i phyir de gnyis gzhan ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de gnyis gzhan ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are the two not different?

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa ji ltar snang ba'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa ji ltar snang ba'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is because the suchness of the conventional of the world is the essence of just as it appears, which is to say, the essence of the conventional.

original: de nyid don dam pa'i de bzhin nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: de nyid don dam pa'i de bzhin nyid kyang yin te /
translated: That itself is the suchness of the ultimate.

original: rigs pa yang ji ltar snang ba bzhin kun rdzob tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa yang ji ltar snang ba bzhin kun rdzob tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reasoning is that it is just as it appears, because it abides conventionally.

original: re zhig de ltar mdo'i @37b don tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyi mtshan nyid kyi rig pa don dam pa yin par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de ltar mdo'i @37b don tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyi mtshan nyid kyi rig pa don dam pa yin par bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the s≈´tra is explained to be the ultimate, which is the reasoning that has the characteristics of a trimodal logical reason.

original: rnam pa gzhan yang bshad pa /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan yang bshad pa /
translated: Another aspect of this is now explained.

original: yang na skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or else, ‚Äúthe negation of arising, etc.‚Äù

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù means not only by reasoning.

original: 'ga' zhig gis zhes bya ba ni don dam par spros pa thams cad bral ba dang mthun pa'i phyir rigs pa smra ba rnams kyis don dam pa nyid du 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis zhes bya ba ni don dam par spros pa thams cad bral ba dang mthun pa'i phyir rigs pa smra ba rnams kyis don dam pa nyid du 'dod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSome‚Äù means that because it is in accord with the freedom from all fabrication in the ultimate, the proponents of reasoning assert it as the ultimate.

original: gzhan dag gis ni skye ba med pa la sogs pa 'gog pa yang dag pa kho nar don dam pa nyid du 'dod ces bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni skye ba med pa la sogs pa 'gog pa yang dag pa kho nar don dam pa nyid du 'dod ces bya bar sbyar te /
translated: ‚ÄúOthers‚Äù means that they assert the negation of non-arising, etc. as the only correct ultimate.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams kyi ltar na dngos su stong pa nyid yang dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams kyi ltar na dngos su stong pa nyid yang dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, according to the Yogacaras, emptiness is the real.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i don dam pa la brten na yang ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i don dam pa la brten na yang ste /
translated: ‚ÄúEven so‚Äù means even in dependence on such an ultimate.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyang gzhan la /
translated: The words of the sutra state that the conventional is one thing,üîΩand the ultimate is another.

original: don dam pa yang gzhan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di legs par drangs te /
analyzed: don dam pa yang gzhan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di legs par drangs te /
translated: and ‚ÄúNor is the ultimate something else.‚Äù

original: legs par go bar byas pa yin te /
analyzed: legs par go bar byas pa yin te /
translated: This is well-drawn, and well-understood.

original: de la ni skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa yang kun rdzob kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa yang kun rdzob kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For in that context, the refutation of arising, etc. is the nature of the superficial.

original: 'di ni sngar yang /
analyzed: 'di ni sngar yang /
translated: This has already been established earlier:

original: dgag bya yod pa ma yin pas //üîΩyang dag tu na bkag med gsal //
analyzed: dgag bya yod pa ma yin pas // yang dag tu na bkag med gsal //
translated: Since the object of refutation does not exist,

original: zhes bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: zhes bsgrubs zin to //
translated: in reality there is no refutation, only manifestation.

original: dngos po de nyid slob dpon klu sgrub kyis bshad pa /
analyzed: dngos po de nyid slob dpon klu sgrub kyis bshad pa /
translated: The master Nagarjuna explained that very thing:
