original: gzhan rnal 'byor spyod pa'i don dam par byas pa rnam par gzhag pa skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: gzhan rnal 'byor spyod pa'i don dam par byas pa rnam par gzhag pa skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever is the refutation of arising, etc.

original: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba dbu ma pa'i kun rdzob yin no //üîΩgal te ji ltar gcig kho na gcig gi don dam pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba dbu ma pa'i kun rdzob yin no // gal te ji ltar gcig kho na gcig gi don dam pa yin la /
translated: in the ultimate, that is the superficial of the Centrists.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi ni kun rdzob yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni kun rdzob yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow is it that one is the ultimate of one, and the other is the superficial of the other?‚Äù

original: ltos pa'i bye brag gis de ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: ltos pa'i bye brag gis de ni nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault in that, because of the difference in the perspectives.

original: 'di ltar bud med gcig kho na gzhan de'i bu'i ni ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bud med gcig kho na gzhan de'i bu'i ni ma yin la /
translated: In this way, one woman is the mother of one son,

original: ma de nyid gzhan gyi chung ma yang yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ma de nyid gzhan gyi chung ma yang yin pa bzhin no //
translated: and that very mother is the wife of another.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is applied in a different order.

original: kha cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po don dam pa rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma 'gog pa dang / yang dag pa'i skye ba 'gog pa'i rigs pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: kha cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po don dam pa rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma 'gog pa dang / yang dag pa'i skye ba 'gog pa'i rigs pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: Some think that the reasoning that refutes the ultimate valid cognition that realizes the nature of cause and effect and refutes true arising

original: kun rdzob pa'i skye ba dang de rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma ji ltar snang ba bzhin gnas pa la yang mtshungs te gtan tshigs kyi yul ni skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis bye brag tu dbye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob pa'i skye ba dang de rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma ji ltar snang ba bzhin gnas pa la yang mtshungs te gtan tshigs kyi yul ni skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis bye brag tu dbye ba ma yin te /
translated: is also similar for conventional arising and the valid knowledge that realizes it, as it appears, because the domain of the reason is not distinguished by the power of the wish of the person,

original: khyab pa ni thams cad nye bar bsdus nas nye bar ston pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems te de'i @38a * //
analyzed: khyab pa ni thams cad nye bar bsdus nas nye bar ston pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems te de'i @38a * //
translated: because the pervasion is taught by including everything.

original: phyir 'dod pa de'i dogs pa bsu bar byed de /
analyzed: phyir 'dod pa de'i dogs pa bsu bar byed de /
translated: Therefore, anticipating that wish, he says:

original: kun rdzob tu yang mi skye dang / yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don dam pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang mi skye dang / yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don dam pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNor in the conventional‚Äù means that it is not produced even in the conventional.üîΩThe word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that it is not produced not only ultimately.

original: mi skye zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: mi skye zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúNot produced‚Äù is an example.

original: de rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma zhes bya bar yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma zhes bya bar yang shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that ‚Äúthe valid cognition that realizes it‚Äù is also an example.

original: yang na dang zhes bya ba'i sgra mi skye dang zhes bya ba rim pa gzhan du sbyar te /
analyzed: yang na dang zhes bya ba'i sgra mi skye dang zhes bya ba rim pa gzhan du sbyar te /
translated: Or, the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is connected to ‚Äúnot produced‚Äù in a different order.

original: dang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni de rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma yang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni de rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma yang zhes bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that ‚Äúthe valid cognition that realizes it‚Äù is an example.

original: rigs pa'i stobs kyis na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rigs pa'i stobs kyis na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBy the power of reasoning‚Äù means

original: du mas dngos po gcig mi byed //
analyzed: du mas dngos po gcig mi byed //
translated: many do not produce one thing.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pas so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pas so //
translated: This is stated by the passage beginning with this.

original: 'di bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di bshad pa /
translated: This is explained:

original: ji ste dngos por smra ba rnams //
analyzed: ji ste dngos por smra ba rnams //
translated: If the proponents of real things

original: kun rdzob la yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob la yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is as before.

original: snang ba dang ldan pa ni rnam pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba dang ldan pa ni rnam pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEndowed with appearance‚Äù means having aspects.

original: cig shos kyis zhes bya ba ni shes pa rnam pa med pas so //
analyzed: cig shos kyis zhes bya ba ni shes pa rnam pa med pas so //
translated: The other, i.e., the cognition devoid of aspects.

original: yongs su gcod pa mi rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa mi rung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not possible to determine.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur 'dod pa me dang du ba la sogs pa 'dzin par mi 'thad pa'i rgyus rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid nges pa med pa kho na ste mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur 'dod pa me dang du ba la sogs pa 'dzin par mi 'thad pa'i rgyus rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid nges pa med pa kho na ste mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: Since it is not tenable to apprehend fire and smoke, etc., as cause and effect, it is not possible that they are definitely cause and effect.

original: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /üîΩgong du dngos por smra ba rnams la rnam pa med pa'i shes pa ni /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni / gong du dngos por smra ba rnams la rnam pa med pa'i shes pa ni /
translated: As before, i.e.,

original: yul la 'dzin par mi rigs so //
analyzed: yul la 'dzin par mi rigs so //
translated: previously, in the context of the objection that the cognition devoid of aspects is not tenable as the apprehender of objects, it was stated:üîΩThe cognition devoid of aspects is not tenable as the apprehender of objects.

original: rnam pa tshad ma min phyir dang // mi rigs phyir na cig shos min //
analyzed: rnam pa tshad ma min phyir dang // mi rigs phyir na cig shos min //
translated: Because the aspects are not valid cognitions and because the other is not tenable.

original: zhes ji skad bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes ji skad bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is as stated above.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not tenable.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid do //
translated: This refers to the status of cause and effect.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩdu mas dngos po gcig mi byed //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / du mas dngos po gcig mi byed //
translated: Why?üîΩMany do not produce one thing.

original: du mas du ma byed ma yin //
analyzed: du mas du ma byed ma yin //
translated: Many do not produce many.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs snga ma kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs snga ma kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: and so on, for the very reasons stated earlier.

original: 'dir lan bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir lan bshad pa /
translated: Here is the reply:

original: blo rgya chen po'i nor can khyod kyis gang smras pa /
analyzed: blo rgya chen po'i nor can khyod kyis gang smras pa /
translated: You, who are rich in great intelligence, have said:

original: de bden te /
analyzed: de bden te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat is true,

original: brtag mi bzod pa nyid kyi rgyu //
analyzed: brtag mi bzod pa nyid kyi rgyu //
translated: but it is not tenable that they are causes and effects.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir na 'di ni bcom ldan 'das thugs rje'i rgyu las byung ba'i rdul phra rab kyis bsgrubs pa'i sku can gyis /
analyzed: de'i phyir na 'di ni bcom ldan 'das thugs rje'i rgyu las byung ba'i rdul phra rab kyis bsgrubs pa'i sku can gyis /
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One, whose body is composed of the most subtle particles of compassion,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul la 'jug pa ye shes snang ba'i rgyan la sogs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul la 'jug pa ye shes snang ba'i rgyan la sogs pa'i mdo las /
translated: in the s≈´tras such as the Ornament of the Light of Awareness of the Domain of All Buddhas,

original: ji ltar snang bzhin yin par gsungs //
analyzed: ji ltar snang bzhin yin par gsungs //
translated: has said that arising is just as it appears.

original: 'di bshad pa rgyu gang gi phyir /
analyzed: 'di bshad pa rgyu gang gi phyir /
translated: This is explained because of what?

original: rigs pa'i mthus rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa mi rung ba /
analyzed: rigs pa'i mthus rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa mi rung ba /
translated: By the power of reasoning, cause and effect and so on are untenable.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis skye ba ni ji ltar snang ba bzhin yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis skye ba ni ji ltar snang ba bzhin yin par gsungs so //
translated: For that very reason, the Blessed One has said that arising is just as it appears.

original: gzhan yang rung zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang rung zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Moreover, ‚Äútenable‚Äù means

original: de rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma dang / gnas pa dang rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: de rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma dang / gnas pa dang rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o//
translated: The valid cognition that realizes that, and such things as enduring, aging, and impermanence.

original: @38b 'di'i ngo bo nyid skye ba med pa'i chos yin pas /
analyzed: @38b 'di'i ngo bo nyid skye ba med pa'i chos yin pas /
translated: Since the nature of this is a non-arisen phenomenon,

original: skye ba med chos te /
analyzed: skye ba med chos te /
translated: it is a non-arisen phenomenon.

original: de'i chos don dam pa pa'i skye ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i chos don dam pa pa'i skye ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not a phenomenon of ultimate arising.

original: rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i gnas skabs na yang dag pa'i shes pas sgro btags pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i gnas skabs na yang dag pa'i shes pas sgro btags pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Even in the state of complete buddhahood, because it is free from the aspect of superimposition by correct knowledge,

original: de ltar chos ma skyes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar chos ma skyes pa yin gyi /
translated: it is a non-arisen phenomenon.üîΩBut it is not that it was previously a nature that became so.

original: snga ma de ltar rang bzhin yin par gyur pa ni ma yin no snyam du dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: snga ma de ltar rang bzhin yin par gyur pa ni ma yin no snyam du dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To dispel such doubts, it is said:

original: rtag tu ste dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: rtag tu ste dus thams cad du'o //
translated: Always, at all times,

original: rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas pa'i gnas skabs na yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas pa'i gnas skabs na yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: even in the state of not being a complete buddha,üîΩthus:

original: 'di ltar / 'di la bsal ba ci yang med //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'di la bsal ba ci yang med //
translated: There is nothing at all to be removed from it,

original: gzhag par bya ba ci yang med //
analyzed: gzhag par bya ba ci yang med //
translated: and there is nothing at all to be added.

original: yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
analyzed: yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
translated: The real is seen as real.

original: yang dag mthong na rnam par 'grol //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang dag mthong na rnam par 'grol // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: If one sees reality, one is liberated.

original: chos rnams kun kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos rnams kun kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúall phenomena‚Äù refers to

original: de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan pa rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan pa rnams so //
translated: those things other than the TathƒÅgata.

original: bde bar gshegs pa dang 'dra zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa dang 'dra zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúlike the Sugata‚Äù refers to

original: mi skye ba'i chos rnams yin pas /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos rnams yin pas /
translated: those things that are not produced.

original: de dag kyang skye ba tshad mas gnod pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag kyang skye ba tshad mas gnod pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the production of those things is undermined by valid cognition,

original: rang bzhin 'di las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'di las mi 'da'o //
translated: they do not transcend this nature.

original: 'o na ni ji ltar skye bo dag gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa la rten to zhes tha snyad dag 'jug par byed snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na ni ji ltar skye bo dag gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa la rten to zhes tha snyad dag 'jug par byed snyam pa la /
translated: But how do people use the conventions of production, endurance, and destruction in regard to things such as form?

original: bshad pa / mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'jug pa'i phyin ci log gi bag chags las byung ba dngos por mngon par zhen pas /
analyzed: bshad pa / mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'jug pa'i phyin ci log gi bag chags las byung ba dngos por mngon par zhen pas /
translated: The answer is that due to the latent potentialities of error, which have operated from beginningless time in the apprehension of signs, one conceives of things as real.

original: dngos po'i de kho na brtag pa la mi gzo ba'i phyir mi mkhas pa rnams ni byis pa dag go //
analyzed: dngos po'i de kho na brtag pa la mi gzo ba'i phyir mi mkhas pa rnams ni byis pa dag go //
translated: Since they are not skilled in the analysis of the reality of things, the unwise are called ‚Äúfools.‚Äù

original: gang dag la thos pa'am bsams pa'am bsgoms pa'i rim pas blo skyes par ma gyur pa yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag la thos pa'am bsams pa'am bsgoms pa'i rim pas blo skyes par ma gyur pa yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those who have not generated the mind through the stages of hearing, reflection, and meditation are called ‚Äúthose who have not generated the mind.‚Äù

original: med pa'i chos te /
analyzed: med pa'i chos te /
translated: The non-existent phenomena

original: skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa gzugs la sogs pa med pa rnams la yang dag bar mngon par zhen pas tha snyad 'dogs so //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa gzugs la sogs pa med pa rnams la yang dag bar mngon par zhen pas tha snyad 'dogs so //
translated: are form, etc., which are devoid of origination, etc., and are imagined to exist through the conventional designation of the non-existent.üîΩBecause of the nature of what appears

original: ji ltar snang bzhin ngo bo'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar snang bzhin ngo bo'i phyir // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because of the nature of things as they appear.üîΩüîΩ

original: ma brtags na nyams dga' ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma brtags na nyams dga' ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is delightful when not examined.

original: kun rdzob 'di la dpyad pa ste //
analyzed: kun rdzob 'di la dpyad pa ste //
translated: This conventional reality is analyzed

original: brtag pa mi 'jug go //
analyzed: brtag pa mi 'jug go //
translated: but not the imagined reality.

original: 'di la ji skad bshad pa'i dpyad pa /üîΩci rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po kun rdzob pa /
analyzed: 'di la ji skad bshad pa'i dpyad pa / ci rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po kun rdzob pa /
translated: Here, the analysis as explainedüîΩis whether the conventional reality of cause and effect is known by consciousness together with its aspects,

original: shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pas shes sam zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'di ji ltar 'dod /
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pas shes sam zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'di ji ltar 'dod /
translated: and similarly, whether it is accepted that many produce one,

original: ci du mas gcig byas sam /
analyzed: ci du mas gcig byas sam /
translated: or that many are produced by one, etc.

original: 'on te du ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ni gnas med de rten med do //
analyzed: 'on te du ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ni gnas med de rten med do //
translated: This is groundless, without support.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar ji @39a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar ji @39a * //
translated: In this way,

original: skad bshad pa'i rnam bar dpyod par byed pa yin na ni /
analyzed: skad bshad pa'i rnam bar dpyod par byed pa yin na ni /
translated: if one were to engage in the analysis as explained above,

original: gnod pa de tshar gcad pa'i gnas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod pa de tshar gcad pa'i gnas su 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be a case of refuting the refutation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don gzhan du song bas te /
analyzed: don gzhan du song bas te /
translated: Because it would be a different point.

original: skabs yin pa'i don bor na rtsod pa gzhan la brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skabs yin pa'i don bor na rtsod pa gzhan la brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If one were to abandon the point at hand, then it would be a case of relying on a different debate.

original: 'di rnam par 'grel bar byed de /
analyzed: 'di rnam par 'grel bar byed de /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: dbu ma pa kho bo cag ni kun rdzob 'di la dpyod pa sngar ma bstan gyi /
analyzed: dbu ma pa kho bo cag ni kun rdzob 'di la dpyod pa sngar ma bstan gyi /
translated: We Followers of the Middle Way do not analyze conventionalities in the way you do.

original: khyed kyis byed na 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: khyed kyis byed na 'gog par byed do //
translated: We refute you when you engage in such analysis.

original: gal te dpyad pa byas te /
analyzed: gal te dpyad pa byas te /
translated: If you engage in analysis

original: de dag gi de ma rung na ma rung du zad do //
analyzed: de dag gi de ma rung na ma rung du zad do //
translated: and thereby invalidate those conventionalities, then so be it.

original: kho bo cag la ci gnod /üîΩ'on kyang ji ltar snang ba'i ngo bo'i kun rdzob la sngar brten nas te /
analyzed: kho bo cag la ci gnod / 'on kyang ji ltar snang ba'i ngo bo'i kun rdzob la sngar brten nas te /
translated: What harm does that do to us?üîΩWe simply rely on and accept the relative as it appears.

original: khas blangs nas phyis kun rdzob de la khyod ji skad bshad pa'i dpyod pa byed pa yin na ni don rnal ma las /
analyzed: khas blangs nas phyis kun rdzob de la khyod ji skad bshad pa'i dpyod pa byed pa yin na ni don rnal ma las /
translated: If you later engage in the analysis you just described in relation to those conventionalities, then you will be analyzing the genuine meaning of the relative.

original: don gzhan du 'gro ba'i phyir gnod pa ste /
analyzed: don gzhan du 'gro ba'i phyir gnod pa ste /
translated: because it goes to another meaning, it is a fault.

original: pham pa 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ro //üîΩdon rnal ma las don gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: pham pa 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ro // don rnal ma las don gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is only a defeat.

original: ma 'brel ba'i don te /
analyzed: ma 'brel ba'i don te /
translated: ‚ÄúAnother meaning‚Äù means a meaning that is not connected.

original: de tshar gcad pa'i gnas su rnam par gzhag pa ni rig pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de tshar gcad pa'i gnas su rnam par gzhag pa ni rig pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: It is reasonable to establish that as a basis for refutation.

original: ji ste ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa la zhes bya ba ni ji ltar snang ba'i ngo bo ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ste ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa la zhes bya ba ni ji ltar snang ba'i ngo bo ma yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is not as it has been explained‚Äù means that it is not as it appears.

original: rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba nyid kyis khas blangs pa'i don kho na la /
analyzed: rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba nyid kyis khas blangs pa'i don kho na la /
translated: It is only by following reasoning that one accepts the meaning.

original: gal te kun rdzob ces bya ba'i ming du 'dogs na de la de lta bu'i nyes pa brjod kyang kho bo cag la gnod pa ci yang med de /
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob ces bya ba'i ming du 'dogs na de la de lta bu'i nyes pa brjod kyang kho bo cag la gnod pa ci yang med de /
translated: If one designates the name ‚Äúconventional‚Äù to that, then even if one says that it has such faults, there is no harm at all to us,

original: don gzhan du 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan du 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not go to another meaning.

original: dngos por mngon par zhen pa chen po'i gzhan gyi dbang gi blo can gzhan dag don dam pa'i tshul la rnam par sdang zhing klan ka tshol bar byed de /
analyzed: dngos por mngon par zhen pa chen po'i gzhan gyi dbang gi blo can gzhan dag don dam pa'i tshul la rnam par sdang zhing klan ka tshol bar byed de /
translated: Other people, who are under the power of a mind that is under the influence of a great clinging to things, are hostile to the way of the ultimate and seek to find fault with it.

original: 'o na gal te dngos po rnams don dam par ma skyes pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te dngos po rnams don dam par ma skyes pa kho na yin na /
translated: But if things are not produced ultimately,

original: de'i tshe ci'i phyir na 'di la me dang sa bon la sogs pa'i rgyu 'di las du ba dang myu gu la sogs pa'i ngo bo der sngon mi snang ba las nges par snang zhes bya ba 'di smra bar byos /
analyzed: de'i tshe ci'i phyir na 'di la me dang sa bon la sogs pa'i rgyu 'di las du ba dang myu gu la sogs pa'i ngo bo der sngon mi snang ba las nges par snang zhes bya ba 'di smra bar byos /
translated: why do you say that the nature of smoke, a sprout, and so on, definitely appears from causes such as fire and seeds, which were not previously manifest?

original: klan ka 'di'i lan glon par byed de /
analyzed: klan ka 'di'i lan glon par byed de /
translated: We respond to this objection:

original: khyod dang ba lang rdzi la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa ngan pa'i dug la sogs pas ma rung bar byas pa'i blo can rnams kyis ji ltar mthong ba 'di 'dra ste /
analyzed: khyod dang ba lang rdzi la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa ngan pa'i dug la sogs pas ma rung bar byas pa'i blo can rnams kyis ji ltar mthong ba 'di 'dra ste /
translated: This is how you and cowherds and so on see things, but your minds are corrupted by the poison of bad views.

original: 'di lta bu du ba la sogs pa 'di ni me la sogs pa'i rgyu 'di las snang ste /
analyzed: 'di lta bu du ba la sogs pa 'di ni me la sogs pa'i rgyu 'di las snang ste /
translated: This smoke and so on appears from causes such as fire.

original: de'i phyir 'di la lhag pa ci zhig smra bar bya /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la lhag pa ci zhig smra bar bya /
translated: Therefore, what else is there to say about this?

original: sngon ma byung ba ci yang smrar med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: sngon ma byung ba ci yang smrar med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is impossible to say that anything previously nonexistent appears.

original: 'di ltar khyod la du ba la sogs pa cha ji tsam snang ba de tsam /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod la du ba la sogs pa cha ji tsam snang ba de tsam /
translated: In this way, you see smoke and so on to the extent that it appears.

original: kho bo la yang de dag la cha de tsam @39b snang ngo //
analyzed: kho bo la yang de dag la cha de tsam @39b snang ngo //
translated: For us, they appear just as they do for you.

original: kho bos khyod kyi ngo mi chod pa'i phyir smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: kho bos khyod kyi ngo mi chod pa'i phyir smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: We want to say that we do not understand your question.

original: mig gnyis te por phye yang de dag la sngon ma byung ba'i rnam pa ni ci yang mi snang na /
analyzed: mig gnyis te por phye yang de dag la sngon ma byung ba'i rnam pa ni ci yang mi snang na /
translated: Even if we open our eyes wide, we do not see anything that is not already known.

original: de la de lta bu'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid la kho bo cag la ci zhig 'dri /
analyzed: de la de lta bu'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid la kho bo cag la ci zhig 'dri /
translated: So what is it that you ask us about the nature of things?

original: dri ba gzhan gyi yul sngon ma byung ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dri ba gzhan gyi yul sngon ma byung ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since there is nothing that is not already known as the domain of other questions,

original: khyod kyi 'dri ba 'di ni don med la kho na yin te /
analyzed: khyod kyi 'dri ba 'di ni don med la kho na yin te /
translated: your question is meaningless.

original: 'di ltar dris su zin kyang kho bos gang khyod dang ba lang rdzi la sogs pa dang bcas bas mthong ba de tsam gyi cha zhig brjod par bya'i /
analyzed: 'di ltar dris su zin kyang kho bos gang khyod dang ba lang rdzi la sogs pa dang bcas bas mthong ba de tsam gyi cha zhig brjod par bya'i /
translated: Even if you ask, we will only say what you and the cowherds and so on see.

original: sngon ma byung ba'i ngo bo brjod par bya ba ni ci yang med do //
analyzed: sngon ma byung ba'i ngo bo brjod par bya ba ni ci yang med do //
translated: There is nothing at all that is not already known that we can say.

original: de'i phyir ci'i phyir na rgyu 'di las der snang ba 'di smra ba byos /üîΩzhes bya ba de skad du /
analyzed: de'i phyir ci'i phyir na rgyu 'di las der snang ba 'di smra ba byos /üîΩzhes bya ba de skad du /
translated: Therefore, why do you ask, ‚ÄúWhy do they appear in this way?‚Äù

original: 'dri ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dri ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Questioning is defilement.

original: don stong pa la brten pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: don stong pa la brten pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: It is based on the emptiness of the object alone.

original: gzhan yang skye bo blo'i nor can gang zhig ma brtags na dga' ba /
analyzed: gzhan yang skye bo blo'i nor can gang zhig ma brtags na dga' ba /
translated: Moreover, some people who are rich in intelligence, who are happy without examination,üîΩeven though they see fire, smoke, etc.

original: me dang du ba la sogs pa bdag nyid kyis rnam par gsal bar mthong bzhin du'ang /
analyzed: me dang du ba la sogs pa bdag nyid kyis rnam par gsal bar mthong bzhin du'ang /
translated: clearly with their own eyes,

original: dmigs bzhin du'ang mi shes te 'di ni de lta'o zhes mi go ba /
analyzed: dmigs bzhin du'ang mi shes te 'di ni de lta'o zhes mi go ba /
translated: do not understand, ‚ÄúThis is like that.‚Äù

original: de rtsod pa yis /üîΩgrags pas kyang gzhan la ci'i phyir na rgyu 'di las /
analyzed: de rtsod pa yis / grags pas kyang gzhan la ci'i phyir na rgyu 'di las /
translated: By that dispute,

original: der snang ba 'di smra bar byos //
analyzed: der snang ba 'di smra bar byos //
translated: why do you not speak to others about this appearance from this cause?

original: zhes smra'o // ma 'phags ngan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes smra'o // ma 'phags ngan pa ni /
translated: The ignoble, the bad,

original: bzang po ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bzang po ma yin pa'o //
translated: are not good.

original: mi shes pa ni blun pa ste //
analyzed: mi shes pa ni blun pa ste //
translated: The ignorant are fools.

original: mi shes pa kho na 'dir ngan pa zhes bya bar 'os kyi /üîΩsrog chags phan pa 'dod pas bslus pa la /
analyzed: mi shes pa kho na 'dir ngan pa zhes bya bar 'os kyi / srog chags phan pa 'dod pas bslus pa la /
translated: Ignorance alone is worthy to be called bad here.

original: lta nyes ba ci yod snyam du bsams pa'o //üîΩrtsod par grags pa ni /
analyzed: lta nyes ba ci yod snyam du bsams pa'o // rtsod par grags pa ni /
translated: What fault is there in the desire to deceive living beings who want to benefit?üîΩThis is what he thinks.üîΩFame through dispute

original: rtsod pa yis ni grags pa'o /
analyzed: rtsod pa yis ni grags pa'o /
translated: is fame through dispute.

original: // / bam po gsum pa ste tha ma'o //
analyzed: // / bam po gsum pa ste tha ma'o //
translated: Chapter III

original: btsun pa blo brten na re /
analyzed: btsun pa blo brten na re /
translated: The Venerable Sthiramati says:üîΩ‚ÄúThe conventional is not suitable without a basis.‚Äù

original: kun rdzob ni gzhi med par mi rung ngo zhes zer ba de'i dogs pa bsu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kun rdzob ni gzhi med par mi rung ngo zhes zer ba de'i dogs pa bsu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to respond to that doubt, it is said:

original: kun rdzob 'di ni gzhi med bar ;üîΩ/ zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: kun rdzob 'di ni gzhi med bar ; / zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This conventional is without a basis.

original: rten med par mi rung ngo zhes kyang brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: rten med par mi rung ngo zhes kyang brjod par mi nus te /
translated: It cannot be said that it is not suitable without a basis.

original: 'di ltar brtags pa kun rdzob ni gzhi dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar brtags pa kun rdzob ni gzhi dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Thus, the imputed conventional has a basis.

original: yang dag pa'i gzhi dang ldan pa ni 'ga' yang dngos po gang la yang mi snang ngo //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i gzhi dang ldan pa ni 'ga' yang dngos po gang la yang mi snang ngo //
translated: Nothing at all appears to have a real basis.

original: shing la sogs pa gdags pa'i gzhi yal ga la sogs pa snang ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: shing la sogs pa gdags pa'i gzhi yal ga la sogs pa snang ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But are not the bases of imputation such as a tree, its branches, and so on, apparent?

original: brdzun pa yin no snyam nas bshad pa /
analyzed: brdzun pa yin no snyam nas bshad pa /
translated: Thinking that they are false, it is said:

original: shing la sogs pa'i don gyi gdags pa 'di yang gzhi ste /
analyzed: shing la sogs pa'i don gyi gdags pa 'di yang gzhi ste /
translated: This imputation of the object such as a tree and so on is also a basis.

original: don dam pa pa'i rgyu la ltos pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: don dam pa pa'i rgyu la ltos pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: It does not depend on a cause that is ultimate.

original: 'di ltar shing la sogs pa'i gdags pa'i rgyu ni yal ga la sogs pa yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar shing la sogs pa'i gdags pa'i rgyu ni yal ga la sogs pa yin par 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, the cause of the imputation of a tree and so on would be its branches and so on.

original: yal ga la sogs pa de @40a * //
analyzed: yal ga la sogs pa de @40a * //
translated: and the branches, etc.

original: yang cha shas dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang cha shas dang bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: are also composed of parts.

original: de'i cha shas kyi gzugs kyang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: de'i cha shas kyi gzugs kyang gzhan yin no //
translated: The form of its parts is also different.

original: de bzhin du blos rnam par gzhigs na gdags pa'i gzhi rdul phra rab kyi bar du rnam par gnas la /
analyzed: de bzhin du blos rnam par gzhigs na gdags pa'i gzhi rdul phra rab kyi bar du rnam par gnas la /
translated: In the same way, when analyzed by the intellect, the basis of designation is reduced to the most subtle particles.üîΩBut,

original: de yang / gang la shar sogs phyogs yod pa //
analyzed: de yang / gang la shar sogs phyogs yod pa //
translated: that which has directions such as east

original: de la shar gyi phyogs cha'ang yod //
analyzed: de la shar gyi phyogs cha'ang yod //
translated: also has an eastern part.

original: gang phyir rdul la phyogs rnams yod //
analyzed: gang phyir rdul la phyogs rnams yod //
translated: Since the directions are in the particle,

original: de'i phyir rdul phran min par bshad //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdul phran min par bshad //
translated: it is explained that the particle does not exist.

original: ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa phyogs cha tha dad pas dpyad na med pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa phyogs cha tha dad pas dpyad na med pa kho na yin na /
translated: If one analyzes in this way, using the different directional parts, it does not exist at all.

original: shing la sogs pa kun rdzob pa gdags pa'i rgyu de lta ga la yod de med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa kun rdzob pa gdags pa'i rgyu de lta ga la yod de med pa kho na'o //
translated: How can there be such a cause for the conventional designation of trees, etc.? There cannot be!

original: de ltar snang ba'i rgyu rnam par shes pa yin par rtog pa gang yin pa de yang sngar skye ba med par bsgrubs pa'i phyir mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar snang ba'i rgyu rnam par shes pa yin par rtog pa gang yin pa de yang sngar skye ba med par bsgrubs pa'i phyir mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: Also, the idea that the cause of the appearance is consciousness is untenable because it has been proven earlier that consciousness does not arise.

original: dngos po yod pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa yin no //
translated: The so-called existent thing is the ultimate.

original: kun rdzob pa ni rgyu kho na yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob pa ni rgyu kho na yin te /
translated: The conventional is only the cause.

original: 'di'i rgyur snga ma mi 'gal la /
analyzed: 'di'i rgyur snga ma mi 'gal la /
translated: There is no contradiction in the prior being the cause of this.

original: rgyu de'i rgyu yang kun rdzob pa gzhan snga ma kho na yin no //
analyzed: rgyu de'i rgyu yang kun rdzob pa gzhan snga ma kho na yin no //
translated: And the cause of that cause is only the prior other conventional.

original: de ltar rgyu brgyud pa thog ma med pa'i phyir kun rdzob gzhi med pa ni ci yang med do //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu brgyud pa thog ma med pa'i phyir kun rdzob gzhi med pa ni ci yang med do //
translated: Thus, because the succession of causes is beginningless, there is no basis for the conventional at all.

original: gal te 'di'i rgyu rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di'i rgyu rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the cause of this is not in accord with reason,

original: 'di yang rnam pa de lta bu kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa de lta bu kho na ma yin nam /
translated: is not this also the case?

original: de lta bas na ci yang mi gnod do //
analyzed: de lta bas na ci yang mi gnod do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction at all.

original: ji ste yang dag pa'i gzhi med par 'di 'byung bar rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na ni /
analyzed: ji ste yang dag pa'i gzhi med par 'di 'byung bar rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na ni /
translated: But if you maintain that it is not reasonable for this to occur without a real basis,

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa ba'i gzhi der 'di ltar de med na der mi 'gyur ba'i 'bral ba ci yang med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa ba'i gzhi der 'di ltar de med na der mi 'gyur ba'i 'bral ba ci yang med pa ma yin nam /
translated: is not the basis of the conventional and the ultimate devoid of that which is not in accord with the fact?

original: gal te de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the characteristic of reality,

original: gal te de lta na gzhi yang de'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin pas kho bo cag gi 'dod pa grub pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gal te de lta na gzhi yang de'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin pas kho bo cag gi 'dod pa grub pa kho na yin no //
translated: If that is so, then the basis is just that entity itself, so our assertion is established.

original: de lta yin na don dam pa pa'i gzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob kyi ngo bo 'dor bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de lta yin na don dam pa pa'i gzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob kyi ngo bo 'dor bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If that is so, then because it is the entity of the ultimate basis, the entity of the conventional would be lost,

original: gzhi kun rdzob tu yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi kun rdzob tu yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or it would follow that the basis exists conventionally.

original: skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yin na ni /
analyzed: skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yin na ni /
translated: If it is the relation of the characteristic of arising,

original: rang gi ngo bo nyams par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyams par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that its own entity would be lost,

original: 'bras bu ni rgyu dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyu dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect is in accordance with the cause.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: ji ltar snang ba 'di kho na'o //üîΩrgyu dngos po yod pa la ltos nas 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba 'di kho na'o // rgyu dngos po yod pa la ltos nas 'jug pa ni /
translated: it is just as it appears.

original: gang yang med do zhes khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang med do zhes khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: One should accept that there is no engagement in dependence on a cause that is an existent thing.

original: gal te kun rdzob don dam pa pa'i gzhi la ltos par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob don dam pa pa'i gzhi la ltos par gyur na /
translated: If the conventional were dependent on the ultimate basis,

original: de lta yin na ni dngos por 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni dngos por 'gyur te /
translated: then it would be a thing.

original: 'bras bu ni rgyu dang mthun pa'i phyir kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid 'dor zhing don dam pa pa'i dngos por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i @40b tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyu dang mthun pa'i phyir kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid 'dor zhing don dam pa pa'i dngos por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i @40b tha tshig go //
translated: Because the effect is concordant with the cause, the conventional nature is relinquished and it becomes an ultimate thing.

original: ji ste de rang gi ngo bo mi 'dor na de lta yin na ni /
analyzed: ji ste de rang gi ngo bo mi 'dor na de lta yin na ni /
translated: But if it does not relinquish its own nature, then in that case,

original: khyod kyi gzhi yang ji ltar kun rdzob tu mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyod kyi gzhi yang ji ltar kun rdzob tu mi 'gyur te /
translated: how could your basis not be conventional?

original: de yang de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i phyogs dag la kun rdzob kyi ngo bor bsgrubs ma thag pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i phyogs dag la kun rdzob kyi ngo bor bsgrubs ma thag pa yin no //
translated: Because it is established as the nature of the conventional in terms of the aspects of being its nature and arising from it.

original: de ni de lta yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni de lta yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is so,

original: btags pa gzhi dang bcas pa ni //
analyzed: btags pa gzhi dang bcas pa ni //
translated: the imputed and the basis of the imputed

original: 'ga' yang gang la'ang mi snang ngo //
analyzed: 'ga' yang gang la'ang mi snang ngo //
translated: do not appear as anything at all.

original: zhes bya ba de ni de lta yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ni de lta yin pa'o //
translated: That is so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gtan tshigs gang gi phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa dngos por smra ba khyod kyi ltar na yang /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gang gi phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa dngos por smra ba khyod kyi ltar na yang /
translated: Because, according to you YogƒÅcƒÅra proponents of real entities,

original: brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: the imputed nature, which has the character of apprehendeds and apprehenders,

original: rgyu ci la yang mi ltos pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ci la yang mi ltos pa kho na yin no //
translated: It is not dependent on any cause at all.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu bar byed de /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu bar byed de /
translated: The Yogacarin raises a doubt:

original: rtag tu med ces 'byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rtag tu med ces 'byung ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it is said to be always nonexistent,

original: gal te med pa'i phyir mi ltos so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te med pa'i phyir mi ltos so zhe na /
translated: if it is not dependent because it does not exist,

original: 'di'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: the intended meaning is this:

original: brtags pa ni gcig kho nar med pa yin te /üîΩji skad du dang po pa ni mtshan nyid kyis //
analyzed: brtags pa ni gcig kho nar med pa yin te / ji skad du dang po pa ni mtshan nyid kyis //
translated: The imagined is nonexistent in only one way,

original: ngo bo nyid med ces bshad pa lta bu'o //üîΩde'i phyir 'di ni ji ltar snang ba bzhin du yang med pa yin pas /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med ces bshad pa lta bu'o // de'i phyir 'di ni ji ltar snang ba bzhin du yang med pa yin pas /
translated: as it is said, ‚ÄúThe first is said to be essenceless in terms of characteristic.‚Äù

original: de rgyu la mi ltos pa nyid ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de rgyu la mi ltos pa nyid ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that it is not dependent on a cause, since it does not exist as it appears.

original: ji ltar snang ba bzhin du kun rdzob tu yod pa gang yin pa de ni nges par rgyu la ltos pa yin no snyam pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba bzhin du kun rdzob tu yod pa gang yin pa de ni nges par rgyu la ltos pa yin no snyam pa 'di yin no //
translated: But whatever exists conventionally as it appears must definitely depend on a cause.

original: de'i phyir 'dir lan mngon sum dang 'gal ba kun tu spyod de zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir lan mngon sum dang 'gal ba kun tu spyod de zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, here he commits the error of contradicting direct perception.

original: 'di la gang gis na mngon sum dang 'gal bar rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ba mngon sum dang grags pa'i don spang ba gang zhig yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'di la gang gis na mngon sum dang 'gal bar rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ba mngon sum dang grags pa'i don spang ba gang zhig yin snyam pa la /
translated: What is the object of direct perception and what is commonly held that is abandoned here, so that this would be posited as contradicting direct perception?

original: bshad pa / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: The root text says, ‚ÄúThe apprehended and apprehender are said to be the imagined nature.‚Äù

original: don phyir na brtags pa bstan pa yin zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don phyir na brtags pa bstan pa yin zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the meaning, the imagined is taught.

original: de gnyis kyang mngon sum kho nar shing rta 'tshong ba la sogs pa skye bo mtha' dag la grags pa'i tshad mas grags pa dag yin pas de spangs na mngon sum dang 'gal ba bzlog dka' ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang mngon sum kho nar shing rta 'tshong ba la sogs pa skye bo mtha' dag la grags pa'i tshad mas grags pa dag yin pas de spangs na mngon sum dang 'gal ba bzlog dka' ste /
translated: Those two are direct perception, because they are established by valid knowledge that is commonly held by all beings, such as a chariot maker. Therefore, if they are abandoned, it is difficult to avoid contradicting direct perception.

original: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa dang de 'dzin par byed pa srog chags thams cad kyi mngon sum du grub po //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa dang de 'dzin par byed pa srog chags thams cad kyi mngon sum du grub po //
translated: Thus blue and so on and the consciousness apprehending them are established as the direct perception of all living beings.

original: yang pha rol po 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu bar byed de /
analyzed: yang pha rol po 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu bar byed de /
translated: Again, anticipating an assertion of the opponent, the root text says,

original: rnam par shes pa nyid ni gnyis med pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid ni gnyis med pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúConsciousness itself is the nondual nature.‚Äù

original: ma rig pas gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa nyid kyis dkrugs pa ni nor bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pas gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa nyid kyis dkrugs pa ni nor bar byas pa'o //
translated: The agitation of the mind is due to the clinging to the apprehended object and apprehending subject, which is caused by ignorance.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor te /üîΩgnyis pa la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyi gnyid ma sangs @41a * //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor te / gnyis pa la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyi gnyid ma sangs @41a * //
translated: Thus, means in the nature of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: pa dag gi gnyid kyis non pa'i sems rnams kyis rtogs pa bzhin du rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: pa dag gi gnyid kyis non pa'i sems rnams kyis rtogs pa bzhin du rtogs so zhe na /
translated: The mind that is overcome by sleep, i.e. by the sleep of the latent impressions of the clinging to the duality, which is not yet awakened, understands in the same way as the understanding of those who are asleep.

original: rigs pa smra bas bshad pa /
analyzed: rigs pa smra bas bshad pa /
translated: The proponent of reason replies:

original: myong ba dang 'gal ba sgrub pa khyod la 'gog par byed pa su zhig yod /
analyzed: myong ba dang 'gal ba sgrub pa khyod la 'gog par byed pa su zhig yod /
translated: Who can refute you, who are proving what is contrary to experience?

original: grub pa'i mtha'i phyogs 'dzin pas ma nyams pa'i blo gros can bud med dang dmangs rigs la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha'i phyogs 'dzin pas ma nyams pa'i blo gros can bud med dang dmangs rigs la sogs pa'am /
translated: You, who are not impaired by the adherence to a philosophical position, or a woman, or a ≈õ≈´dra, or someone with an unimpaired mind,

original: mngon par ma zhen pa'i gnas skabs na khyod kyang rung ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma zhen pa'i gnas skabs na khyod kyang rung ste /
translated: or even you, when you are in a state of non-adherence,

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'di gzugs la sogs pa nyid du rtogs kyi /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'di gzugs la sogs pa nyid du rtogs kyi /
translated: understand that this consciousness that engages in form and so on is the understanding of form and so on.

original: de las ma gtogs pa gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa ni med do //
analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa ni med do //
translated: Apart from that, form, sound and so on do not exist.

original: zhes bya ba de lta bu'i myong ba ni med kyi rnam par shes pa 'di ni nang na gnas pa'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de lta bu'i myong ba ni med kyi rnam par shes pa 'di ni nang na gnas pa'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: But there is no such experience as ‚Äúthis consciousness is the nature of what is internal‚Äù or ‚Äúthis form, etc. is the nature of what appears externally.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'di ni pha rol na snang ba'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i myong ba 'jug pa rab tu grags par gyur to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'di ni pha rol na snang ba'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i myong ba 'jug pa rab tu grags par gyur to //
translated: Such an experience is well known to occur.

original: ji ste khyod de ltar gyur pa 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa'i don yang spang na ni de'i tshe /
analyzed: ji ste khyod de ltar gyur pa 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa'i don yang spang na ni de'i tshe /
translated: But if you reject the meaning that is well known to everyone,

original: bdag nyid mi shes pa de lta bu bdag dang gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba dang 'gal ba'i tha snyad smra ba khyod ni /üîΩ'jig rten gyis thag ring po kho nar spong ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid mi shes pa de lta bu bdag dang gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba dang 'gal ba'i tha snyad smra ba khyod ni / 'jig rten gyis thag ring po kho nar spong ste /
translated: then you, who are ignorant of yourself, will be rejected by both yourself and others, and you will be an object of ridicule.

original: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad dang mi mthun par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad dang mi mthun par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: You will be rejected by the world because you are not in accord with worldly conventions.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa /
translated: The opponent says:

original: rmi lam la sogs pa na yang rnam par shes pa nyid de ltar rtogs par mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa na yang rnam par shes pa nyid de ltar rtogs par mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that even in dreams consciousness is seen to apprehend objects in that way?

original: sogs pa smos pas ni sgyu ma dang dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa yongs su bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni sgyu ma dang dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa yongs su bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes illusions and cities of gandharvas.

original: rmi lam na ni /
analyzed: rmi lam na ni /
translated: In dreams,

original: phyi rol gyi gzugs yod par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzugs yod par mi 'thad de /
translated: external form is not tenable.

original: khyim chung ngu na yang dpag tshad kyi tshad kyi ri dang shing dang rgya mtsho la sogs pa dag dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyim chung ngu na yang dpag tshad kyi tshad kyi ri dang shing dang rgya mtsho la sogs pa dag dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In a small house, one perceives mountains, trees, oceans, and so on, which are the size of leagues.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yang thogs pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yang thogs pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: Form and so on are also obstructive.

original: de lta bas na de na rnam par shes pa nyid de ltar rtogs te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de na rnam par shes pa nyid de ltar rtogs te /
translated: Therefore, consciousness itself is perceived in that way.

original: gnyid kyis ma log pa'i gnas skabs na yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: gnyid kyis ma log pa'i gnas skabs na yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: It is the same in the waking state.

original: de la bshad pa /
analyzed: de la bshad pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: bden na rmi lam la sogs pa na yang rnam par shes pa la ma gtogs pa de /
analyzed: bden na rmi lam la sogs pa na yang rnam par shes pa la ma gtogs pa de /
translated: If that were true, then in dreams and so on, that which is not included in consciousness

original: gzugs la sogs pa ji ltar snang ba bzhin mthong bzhin du yang mngon par zhen pa ngan pas khyod la rnam par shes pa nyid de ltar rtogs so snyam du log par snang gi / gnyid kyis ma log pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ji ltar snang ba bzhin mthong bzhin du yang mngon par zhen pa ngan pas khyod la rnam par shes pa nyid de ltar rtogs so snyam du log par snang gi / gnyid kyis ma log pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du /
translated: Even though you see forms and so on just as they appear, you think, ‚ÄúConsciousness is realized in that way by you due to bad, manifest clinging,‚Äù and it appears falsely.

original: de na yang de ltar rtogs pa na /
analyzed: de na yang de ltar rtogs pa na /
translated: When you realize it in that way,

original: phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa @41b ji ltar snang ba bzhin ni yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa @41b ji ltar snang ba bzhin ni yod pa kho na'o //
translated: external forms and so on exist just as they appear.

original: gal te rigs pas mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rigs pas mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: If you say that is not tenable,

original: de nyid kyi phyir ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i phyir dang / brtag pa'i dpyad pa mi bzod pa'i phyir kun rdzob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i phyir dang / brtag pa'i dpyad pa mi bzod pa'i phyir kun rdzob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: then because it is delightful when not examined and because it is not able to withstand analysis, it is called ‚Äúconventional.‚Äù

original: gnyid kyis ma log pa'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de lta bu kho na yin te /
analyzed: gnyid kyis ma log pa'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de lta bu kho na yin te /
translated: Consciousness that exists in the state of not being awakened from sleep is just like that.

original: de yang skye ba med par bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang skye ba med par bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is established as being unborn.

original: snon bshad pa /
analyzed: snon bshad pa /
translated: The reply to that is this:

original: gang yang 'jig rten thams cad la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba'i dngos po 'di ci zhig gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin nam /
analyzed: gang yang 'jig rten thams cad la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba'i dngos po 'di ci zhig gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin nam /
translated: Moreover, what is this entity that appears in all worlds in the aspect of the grasped and the grasper? Is it the other-dependent nature?

original: 'di ji ltar rung ste 'di gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de ni yang dag par na des dben pa'i ngo bo can yin no //
analyzed: 'di ji ltar rung ste 'di gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de ni yang dag par na des dben pa'i ngo bo can yin no //
translated: How could that be? That other-dependent nature is, in reality, the nature that is devoid of that.

original: gang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa des dben zhing bral ba'i rang gi ngo bo yod pa de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa des dben zhing bral ba'i rang gi ngo bo yod pa de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That which has the nature that is devoid of the aspect of the grasped and the grasper, that which is free from that, is said to be ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: de la snga ma po rtag tu med par gyur pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la snga ma po rtag tu med par gyur pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that the former is always non-existent.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar na gzhan gyi dbang de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang /üîΩgal te ma rig pas dkrugs pa'i phyir de ltar snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar na gzhan gyi dbang de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang / gal te ma rig pas dkrugs pa'i phyir de ltar snang ngo zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how could that other-dependent nature appear in the aspect of the grasped and the grasper?üîΩIf it is said that it appears in that way because it is disturbed by ignorance,

original: bshad pa / ma rig pas dkrugs pa'i phyir de ltar snang bar ni chug mod kyi zhes bya ba ni khas blang ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / ma rig pas dkrugs pa'i phyir de ltar snang bar ni chug mod kyi zhes bya ba ni khas blang ba'o //
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúLet it be that it appears in that way because it is disturbed by ignorance.‚Äù This is an acceptance.

original: der snang bar rigs pa ni ma yin te 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes mjug thogs kho nar gtan tshigs 'chad de /
analyzed: der snang bar rigs pa ni ma yin te 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes mjug thogs kho nar gtan tshigs 'chad de /
translated: The reason is stated immediately after: ‚ÄúIt is not reasonable that it appear as that, because there is no relation.‚Äù

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang de'i bdag nyid ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang de'i bdag nyid ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The aspect of the apprehended and the aspect of the apprehender are not the nature of the dependent nature.

original: ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they not?

original: gzhan gyi dbang de'i bdag nyid ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo gnyis kyis dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang de'i bdag nyid ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo gnyis kyis dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The dependent nature is devoid of the two natures of the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: de lta yin na yang gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid de snang ba na /
analyzed: de lta yin na yang gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid de snang ba na /
translated: Even though that is so, when the dependent nature appears,

original: gnyis po ci'i phyir snang /
analyzed: gnyis po ci'i phyir snang /
translated: why do the two appear?

original: ci'i phyir de snang bar mi 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de snang bar mi 'gyur snyam na /
translated: Why don‚Äôt they appear as that?

original: bshad pa / gnyis po dang gzhan gyi dbang du 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / gnyis po dang gzhan gyi dbang du 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is explained: Because the two are not related to the dependent nature.

original: sbyor ba ni gang gis dben pa'am gang zhig gang dang 'brel ba med pa ni de snang ba na de mi snang ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang gis dben pa'am gang zhig gang dang 'brel ba med pa ni de snang ba na de mi snang ste /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is devoid of or unrelated to something does not appear as that when that appears.

original: dper na rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la gzugs bzhin no //
translated: For example, form does not appear to auditory consciousness.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid kyang gnyis pos dben pa la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid kyang gnyis pos dben pa la /
translated: The dependent nature is also devoid of the two.

original: gnyis po dang gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid du 'brel ba yang med ces bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no //üîΩpha rol po na re /
analyzed: gnyis po dang gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid du 'brel ba yang med ces bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no // pha rol po na re /
translated: And there is no connection between the dependent nature and the two.üîΩThis is the nonobservation of a pervader.

original: gtan tshigs gnyis po ma grub ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gnyis po ma grub ste /
translated: The opponent may say, ‚ÄúThe two reasons are not established.

original: 'di ltar ma rig pas dkrugs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis 'brel @42a * //üîΩpa smras zin to zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pas dkrugs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis 'brel @42a * // pa smras zin to zhes zer na /
translated: Because it is disturbed by ignorance, this statement expresses a connection.‚Äù

original: lan bshad pa /
analyzed: lan bshad pa /
translated: The response to that is as follows.

original: gal te de ltar 'brel pa yod pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te de ltar 'brel pa yod pa yin na ni /
translated: If there were such a connection,

original: de'i tshe gnyis pos dben pa'i shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i tshe gnyis pos dben pa'i shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du /
translated: then, like the nature of consciousness that is devoid of the two,

original: ma rig pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is connected with ignorance,

original: gzhan dbang nyid smos te su zlog sus kyang bzlog par mi nus te /
analyzed: gzhan dbang nyid smos te su zlog sus kyang bzlog par mi nus te /
translated: the dependent nature would be mentioned and no one could refute it.

original: 'di ltar cig shos gnyis pos dben pa gzhan gyi dbang sems dang sems las byung ba'i bdag nyid du 'dod pa yang gzhan gyi dbang nyid du bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar cig shos gnyis pos dben pa gzhan gyi dbang sems dang sems las byung ba'i bdag nyid du 'dod pa yang gzhan gyi dbang nyid du bya ba ste /
translated: Because the other, which is devoid of the two, is asserted to be the dependent nature of the mind and mental factors, it is the dependent nature.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid du rnam par gzhag pa la 'brel pa'i rgyu 'di kho nar zad la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid du rnam par gzhag pa la 'brel pa'i rgyu 'di kho nar zad la /
translated: This is the only connection that can be posited for the dependent nature.

original: 'brel pa'i rgyu de ni gnyis po de la yang yod de /
analyzed: 'brel pa'i rgyu de ni gnyis po de la yang yod de /
translated: And that connection exists for those two.

original: de bas na de lta bas na brtags pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na de lta bas na brtags pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no imagined nature.

original: ji ste shes pa gang la gnyis po de snang ba'i shes pa de nyid rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ste shes pa gang la gnyis po de snang ba'i shes pa de nyid rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang yin gyi /
translated: But if you assert that the consciousness to which those two appear is dependent because it is produced by causes and conditions,

original: gnyis po ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gnyis po ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: but the two are not,

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: gal te yang shes pa kho na rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis skyed na ni /
analyzed: gal te yang shes pa kho na rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis skyed na ni /
translated: If consciousness alone is produced by causes and conditions,

original: gal te yang zhes bya ba ni khas len pa rjod par byed pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang zhes bya ba ni khas len pa rjod par byed pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBut if‚Äù is a statement that expresses an assertion.

original: de yang yang dag par na skye ba med do zhes du mas dngos po gcig mi byed ces bya ba la sogs pas bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: de yang yang dag par na skye ba med do zhes du mas dngos po gcig mi byed ces bya ba la sogs pas bsgrubs zin to //
translated: And that is not produced in reality. That many things do not produce a single thing has already been established by ‚ÄúIf many things do not produce a single thing . . .‚Äù

original: 'on kyang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang bshad par bya ste /
translated: But it will be explained.

original: de tsam skyed la ni rag na gnyis kyi bdag nyid de go ci'i phyir snang ste /
analyzed: de tsam skyed la ni rag na gnyis kyi bdag nyid de go ci'i phyir snang ste /
translated: But if it is generated in that way, why does it appear to have the nature of the two?

original: de ni de dag gis bskyed ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de dag gis bskyed ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not generated by those two.

original: pha rol bo na re gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid shes pa nyid /
analyzed: pha rol bo na re gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid shes pa nyid /
translated: The opponent says: The nature of consciousness is dependent.

original: de ltar gnyis kyi ngo bor snang ngo zhes zer na /
analyzed: de ltar gnyis kyi ngo bor snang ngo zhes zer na /
translated: It appears as the nature of the two.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that, it is said:

original: de ni bshad zin te /
analyzed: de ni bshad zin te /
translated: That has already been explained.

original: ji skad du bshad ce na /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad ce na /
translated: How has it been explained?

original: rnam par shes pa gnyis pos dben pa'i ngo bo de rgyu dang rkyen de dag gis ji lta bu kho nar bskyed pa de lta bu kho nar snang du zad kyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnyis pos dben pa'i ngo bo de rgyu dang rkyen de dag gis ji lta bu kho nar bskyed pa de lta bu kho nar snang du zad kyi /
translated: The nature of consciousness is devoid of the two, and it is generated by those causes and conditions just as they are. It appears just as it is generated.

original: gnyis kyi bdag nyid du go ci'i phyir snang zhes bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: gnyis kyi bdag nyid du go ci'i phyir snang zhes bya bar bshad do //
translated: Why does it appear to have the nature of the two?

original: yang pha rol po 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu bar byed de /
analyzed: yang pha rol po 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu bar byed de /
translated: Again, anticipating the opponent‚Äôs assertion, it is said:

original: gnyis kyi ngo bo de lta bu kho nar skyed do zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis kyi ngo bo de lta bu kho nar skyed do zhe na /
translated: If it is generated as the nature of the two,

original: lan du bshad pa /
analyzed: lan du bshad pa /
translated: in response to that it is said:

original: 'o na ni shes pa de gnyis kyis dben pa can gyi ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni shes pa de gnyis kyis dben pa can gyi ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: Well then, the nature of consciousness is not devoid of the two.

original: de gnyis kyi bdag nyid du bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi bdag nyid du bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is generated as the nature of those two.

original: ngo bo ste rang gi ngo bo gang la gnyis kyis dben pa yod pa'i ngo bo de ni gnyis kyi dben pa can no //
analyzed: ngo bo ste rang gi ngo bo gang la gnyis kyis dben pa yod pa'i ngo bo de ni gnyis kyi dben pa can no //
translated: The nature that is the essence that is devoid of duality is the essence that is devoid of duality.

original: 'di la gnyis kyis dben pa'i ngo bo yod pas de skad ces bshad do //
analyzed: 'di la gnyis kyis dben pa'i ngo bo yod pas de skad ces bshad do //
translated: It is explained in this way because the essence that is devoid of duality exists in this.

original: gzhan yang 'di la gzhan gyi @42b dbang nyid du smra la rag ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di la gzhan gyi @42b dbang nyid du smra la rag ste /
translated: Moreover, it is said that this is the dependent nature.

original: 'di la su zhig zlog ces bshad kyang zin to //
analyzed: 'di la su zhig zlog ces bshad kyang zin to //
translated: It is explained that ‚Äúwho would refute this?‚Äù

original: ji ste shes pa la ni gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gnyug ma kho nar yod na /
analyzed: ji ste shes pa la ni gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gnyug ma kho nar yod na /
translated: But if consciousness has a primordial nature that is nondual,

original: ma rig pas dkrugs pa'i shes pa gzhan gyis de nyid kyi bdag nyid du rtogs so zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: ma rig pas dkrugs pa'i shes pa gzhan gyis de nyid kyi bdag nyid du rtogs so zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: then it is asserted that other consciousnesses that are disturbed by ignorance realize that nature.

original: de'i phyir gnyis po med pa'i ngo bo yin na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis po med pa'i ngo bo yin na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúEven though it has an essence that is devoid of duality,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar shes pa gzhan de la yang brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa gzhan de la yang brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs te /
translated: In this way, the same objection and response can be made to that other consciousness.

original: shes pa gzhan de yang gnyis kyis dben pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan de yang gnyis kyis dben pa kho na yin no //
translated: And that other cognition is also devoid of duality.

original: de lta na yang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir de snang ba na gnyis po go ci'i phyir snang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir de snang ba na gnyis po go ci'i phyir snang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad brjod par bya'o //
translated: But even so, because there is no relation, it must be explained how, when that appears, the two appear.

original: yang don dam pa'i tshul la sdang ba gzhan dag klan ka tshol bar byed de /
analyzed: yang don dam pa'i tshul la sdang ba gzhan dag klan ka tshol bar byed de /
translated: Moreover, others who are hostile to the method of ultimate reality seek to find fault, saying:

original: yang dag par dngos ma skyes pa //
analyzed: yang dag par dngos ma skyes pa //
translated: Things that are not ultimately producedüîΩare not produced even relatively,

original: mo gsham bu la sogs bzhin du //üîΩkun rdzob tu yang mi skye zer //
analyzed: mo gsham bu la sogs bzhin du // kun rdzob tu yang mi skye zer //
translated: like the son of a barren woman.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don dam pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don dam pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that they are not only not produced ultimately.

original: don dam par ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid gang dag yin pa de dag ni kun rdzob tu yang 'byung ba 'thob bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: don dam par ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid gang dag yin pa de dag ni kun rdzob tu yang 'byung ba 'thob bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Those things that are not ultimately produced do not occur even relatively,

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu dang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu dang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the son of a barren woman, the horn of a rabbit, and so on.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa yang /
translated: Form, feeling, and so on

original: don dam par ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin dag yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: don dam par ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin dag yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúare pure in terms of the ultimate non-arising nature‚Äù

original: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ltar 'chos pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ltar 'chos pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: is a restatement of the non-observation of the pervader.

original: 'di ni bsgrub pa'am thal bar bsgrub pa zhig tu 'gyur grang ste /
analyzed: 'di ni bsgrub pa'am thal bar bsgrub pa zhig tu 'gyur grang ste /
translated: This is either an affirmation or an inference.

original: rnam pa gzhan ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no other form.

original: de la re zhig 'di sgrub pa ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'di sgrub pa ni ma yin pas /
translated: First, this is not an affirmation.

original: 'jig rten gnod sogs srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gnod sogs srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúbecause the world‚Äôs refutation and so on are possible.

original: sgra'i don 'gog na 'jig rten gyi gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i don 'gog na 'jig rten gyi gnod pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äù If the meaning of the words is refuted, the world‚Äôs refutation is possible.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni mngon sum gyi gnod pa la sogs pa yongs su bsdu'o //üîΩbrgya zhig la 'jig rten ma skyes pa'i phyir /üîΩ'jig rten gyi gnod pa la sogs pa mi srid do zhes smra bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni mngon sum gyi gnod pa la sogs pa yongs su bsdu'o // brgya zhig la 'jig rten ma skyes pa'i phyir / 'jig rten gyi gnod pa la sogs pa mi srid do zhes smra bar 'gyur bas /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the possibility of refutation by direct perception and so on.üîΩIf it is possible that the world‚Äôs refutation and so on are not possible because the world has not arisen,

original: gal te 'jig rten ma skyes phyir //
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten ma skyes phyir //
translated: then he says, ‚ÄúIf the world has not arisen. . . .

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus it is said.üîΩüîΩ

original: 'jig rten ma skyes pa'i phyir gtan tshigs la sogs pa yang 'jig rten gyi khongs su gtogs pas med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten ma skyes pa'i phyir gtan tshigs la sogs pa yang 'jig rten gyi khongs su gtogs pas med do //
translated: The reason and so on are included in the world, because the world is not produced.

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: Even so,

original: gtan tshigs la sogs med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gtan tshigs la sogs med pa'i phyir //
translated: because the reason and so on do not exist,

original: de tshe bsgrub bya grub mi 'gyur //üîΩsogs pa smos pas ni /
analyzed: de tshe bsgrub bya grub mi 'gyur // sogs pa smos pas ni /
translated: at that time the probandum is not established.

original: dpe la sogs pa bsdu'o //üîΩrang gi @43a * //
analyzed: dpe la sogs pa bsdu'o // rang gi @43a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the example and so on.

original: tshig dang 'gal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: tshig dang 'gal ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of the contradiction with your own words,

original: de tshe bsgrub bya grub mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya bar bsnyegs so //
analyzed: de tshe bsgrub bya grub mi 'gyur // zhes bya bar bsnyegs so //
translated: at that time the probandum is not established.

original: 'di ltar dam 'cha' bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar dam 'cha' bar 'dod pas /
translated: Thus, the one who wishes to make an assertion

original: rang gi tshig skye bar khas blangs te /
analyzed: rang gi tshig skye bar khas blangs te /
translated: accepts the production of his own words.

original: khas blangs nas yang 'dor bar byed bas gsal bar rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no //üîΩbrgya zhig la kho bos rang gi tshig gcig pu ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: khas blangs nas yang 'dor bar byed bas gsal bar rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no // brgya zhig la kho bos rang gi tshig gcig pu ma gtogs pa /
translated: Having accepted them, he rejects them. Therefore, it is clear that he contradicts his own words.

original: lhag ma kun rdzob tu mi skye'o zhes dam bcas so zhes smra bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: lhag ma kun rdzob tu mi skye'o zhes dam bcas so zhes smra bar 'gyur bas /
translated: If he were to say, ‚ÄúI assert that all things except for my own words are not produced conventionally,‚Äù

original: gal te de gcig ma gtogs na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te de gcig ma gtogs na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then in response to that, it would be said, ‚ÄúIf that one thing is not excluded.‚Äù

original: dam bcas ba'i ngo bor zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //üîΩde zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshig go //
analyzed: dam bcas ba'i ngo bor zhes bya ba lhag ma'o // de zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshig go //
translated: The remainder is the statement of the thesis.üîΩ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the statement of the reason.

original: des na zhes bya ni rang gi tshig gis so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ni rang gi tshig gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù refers to the statement of the pervasion.

original: dpe la'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni snon bstan to //
analyzed: dpe la'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni snon bstan to //
translated: The statement beginning with ‚ÄúThe example, etc.‚Äù teaches the addition.

original: sgrub pa ni 'dir gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: sgrub pa ni 'dir gtan tshigs te /
translated: The proof is the reason here.

original: yang dag par nam skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin na /
analyzed: yang dag par nam skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin na /
translated: If it were the case that the nature of the effect were to arise,

original: de yang mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa la med de /
analyzed: de yang mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa la med de /
translated: then it would not be nonexistent in the son of a barren woman, etc.

original: de dag la yang dag par nam skyes pa'i rang bzhin nyid med pa'i phyir ro ;üîΩ/ bsgrub byas khyab pa de bzhin na //
analyzed: de dag la yang dag par nam skyes pa'i rang bzhin nyid med pa'i phyir ro ; / bsgrub byas khyab pa de bzhin na //
translated: Because the nature of the effect would not arise in them.üîΩIf you accept the pervasion by the probandum,

original: khyod la gal te grub ce na //
analyzed: khyod la gal te grub ce na //
translated: then you are refuted.

original: zhes bya bar bsnyegs te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar bsnyegs te /
translated: This is the continuation of the verse.

original: de ltar gtan tshigs dang khyab pa grub pa'i phyir 'di khyod la nyes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar gtan tshigs dang khyab pa grub pa'i phyir 'di khyod la nyes pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, because the reason and the pervasion are established, this is your fault.

original: kho bo'i ni gtan tshigs grub tu zin kyang /üîΩkhyab pa ma grub pas de'i phyir kho bo la nyes pa 'di med pas /
analyzed: kho bo'i ni gtan tshigs grub tu zin kyang / khyab pa ma grub pas de'i phyir kho bo la nyes pa 'di med pas /
translated: Although the reason is established for us,üîΩthe pervasion is not established. Therefore this fault does not apply to us.

original: der ni bdag la nyes pa med //
analyzed: der ni bdag la nyes pa med //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in our position.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus, etc.

original: brgya zhig la khyod kho na la gtan tshigs grub kyi nga la ni ma yin no zhes smra bar 'gyur bas bshad pa /
analyzed: brgya zhig la khyod kho na la gtan tshigs grub kyi nga la ni ma yin no zhes smra bar 'gyur bas bshad pa /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThe reason is established for you alone, not for me,‚Äù then the response is:

original: gal te nga la tshad ma yis //
analyzed: gal te nga la tshad ma yis //
translated: If it were established for me by a valid cognition,

original: grub na gtan tshigs zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: grub na gtan tshigs zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: then it would be called a reason.

original: grub de khyod la'ang khyab /
analyzed: grub de khyod la'ang khyab /
translated: That establishment would also pervade you.
